metadata.author: Vyasa
metadata.description: The Bhagavad Gita with Sanskrit shlokas and English translation.

verses.original_text:
धृतराष्ट्र उवाच 
धर्मक्षेत्रे कुरुक्षेत्रे समवेता युयुत्सवः । 
मामकाः पाण्डवाश्चैव किमकुर्वत सञ्जय ।।
सञ्जय उवाच 
दृष्ट्वा तु पाण्डवानीकं व्यूढं दुर्योधनस्तदा । 
आचार्यमुपसङ्गम्य राजा वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
पश्यैतां पाण्डुपुत्राणामाचार्य महतीं चमूम् । 
व्यूढां द्रुपदपुत्रेण तव शिष्येण धीमता
verses.english_translation: Dhrtarastra said.  On the field of Kurukshetra, gathered together eager for battle, what  did my people and the Pandavas do, O Sanjaya?

verses.original_text:
अत्र शूरा महेष्वासा भीमार्जुनसमा युधि । 
युयुधानो विराटश्च द्रुपदश्च महारथः
verses.english_translation: Sanjaya said.  King Duryodhana, on seeing the Pandavas army in battle array, approached  his teacher Drona and said these words:

verses.original_text:
धृष्टकेतुश्चेकितानः काशिराजश्च वीर्यवान् । 
पुरुजित्कुन्तिभोजश्च शैब्यश्च नरपुङ्गवः
verses.english_translation: Behold, O teacher, this mighty army of the Pandavas, arrayed by the son of Drupada, your intelligent disciple.

verses.original_text:
युधामन्युश्च विक्रान्त उत्तमौजाश्च वीर्यवान् । 
सौभद्रो द्रौपदेयाश्च सर्व एव महारथाः
verses.english_translation: There (in that army) are heroes, great bowmen, like Bhima and Arjuna; Yuyudhana, Virata and Drupada a mighty warrior;

verses.original_text:
अस्माकं तु विशिष्टा ये तान्निबोध द्विजोत्तम । 
नायका मम सैन्यस्य सञ्ज्ञार्थं तान् ब्रवीमि ते
verses.english_translation: Dhrstaketu, Cekitana, and the valiant king of Kasi; Purujit and Kuntibhoja, and Saibya the best among men;

verses.original_text:
भवान्भीष्मश्च कर्णश्च कृपश्च समितिञ्जयः । 
अश्वत्थामा विकर्णश्च सौमदत्तिस्तथैव च
verses.english_translation: Yudhamanyu the valiant, and Uttamaujas the strong; and also the son of Subhadra and the sons of Draupadi, all mighty warriors.

verses.original_text:
अन्ये च बहवः शूरा मदर्थे त्यक्तजीविताः । 
नानाशस्त्रप्रहरणाः सर्वे युद्धविशारदाः
verses.english_translation: Know, O best Brahmanas, those who are important on our side- those who are the commanders of my army. I shall name them to refresh your memory.

verses.original_text:
अपर्याप्तं तदस्माकं बलं भीष्माभिरक्षितम् ।
 पर्याप्तं त्विदमेतेषां बलं भीमाभिरक्षितम्
verses.english_translation: Yourself, Bhishma and Karna, the victorious Krpa, Asvatthama, Vikarna and Jayadratha the son of somadatta;

verses.original_text:
अयनेषु च सर्वेषु यथाभागमवस्थिताः । 
भीष्ममेवाभिरक्षन्तु भवन्तः सर्व एव हि
verses.english_translation: And there are many other heroes who are determined to give up their lives for my sake.  They all are experts in using manifold missiles and are dexterous in battle.

verses.original_text:
तस्य सञ्जनयन्हर्षं कुरुवृद्धः पितामहः ।
 सिंहनादं विनद्योच्चैः शङ्खं दध्मौ प्रतापवान्
verses.english_translation: Inadequate is the force of ours, which is guarded by Bhisma, while adequate is that force of theirs, which is guarded by Bhima.

verses.original_text:
ततः शङ्खाश्च भेर्यश्च पणवानकगोमुखाः । 
सहसैवाभ्यहन्यन्त स शब्दस्तुमुलोऽभवत्
verses.english_translation: There fore all of you taking your places firmly in your respective divisions, guard Bhishma at all cost.

verses.original_text:
ततः श्वेतैर्हयैर्युक्ते महति स्यन्दने स्थितौ ।
 माधवः पाण्डवश्चैव दिव्यौ शङ्खौ प्रदध्मतुः
verses.english_translation: Then the valiant grandsire Bhishma, senior most of the Kuru clan, roaring like a lion, blew his conch with a view to cheer up Duryodhana

verses.original_text:
पाञ्चजन्यं हृषीकेशो देवदत्तं धनञ्जयः ।
 पौण्ड्रं दध्मौ महाशङ्खं भीमकर्मा वृकोदरः
verses.english_translation: Then suddenly conchs and kettle drums, trumpets, tabors and blow horns blared forth; and the sound was terrific.

verses.original_text:
अनन्तविजयं राजा कुन्तीपुत्रो युधिष्ठिरः । 
नकुलः सहदेवश्च सुघोषमणिपुष्पकौ
verses.english_translation: Then Sri Krishna and Arjuna, stationed in their great chariot yoked with white horses, blew their divine conchs.

verses.original_text:
काश्यश्च परमेष्वासः शिखण्डी च महारथः । 
धृष्टद्युम्नो विराटश्च सात्यकिश्चापराजितः
verses.english_translation: Sri Krishna blew his conch, Panjajanya, Arjuna his Devadatta and Bhima of terrible deeds his great conch Paundra.

verses.original_text:
द्रुपदो द्रौपदेयाश्च सर्वशः पृथिवीपते । 
सौभद्रश्च महाबाहुः शङ्खान्दध्मुः पृथक् पृथक्
verses.english_translation: King Yudhisthira the son of Kunti blew his conch Anantavijaya and Nakula and Sahadeva blew their conchs Sughosha and Manipushpaka.

verses.original_text:
स घोषो धार्तराष्ट्राणां हृदयानि व्यदारयत् । 
नभश्च पृथिवीं चैव तुमुलो व्यनुनादयन्
verses.english_translation: And the king of Kasi the supreme Bowman, Sikandi the mighty warrior , Dhrstadyumna and Virata; and Satyaki the invincible;

verses.original_text:
अथ व्यवस्थितान्दृष्ट्वा धार्तराष्ट्रान्कपिध्वजः । 
प्रवृत्ते शस्त्रसम्पाते धनुरुद्यम्य पाण्डवः
verses.english_translation: Drupada and the sons of Draupadi, and the strong armed son of Subhadra all ,O king, blew their several conchs again and again.

verses.original_text:
हृषीकेशं तदा वाक्यमिदमाह महीपते । 
अर्जुन उवाच 
सेनयोरुभयोर्मध्ये रथं स्थापय मेऽच्युत
verses.english_translation: And that tumultuous uproar, resounding through heaven and earth, rent the hearts of Dhrtarastra's sons.

verses.original_text:
यावदेतान् निरीक्षेऽहं योद्धुकामानवस्थितान् । 
कैर्मया सह योद्धव्यमस्मिन्रणसमुद्यमे
verses.english_translation: Then Arjuna, who had Hanuman as his banner crest, on beholding the sons of Drtarastra in array, took up his bow, while missiles were beginning to fly.

verses.original_text:
योत्स्यमानानवेक्षेऽहं य एतेऽत्र समागताः । 
धार्तराष्ट्रस्य दुर्बुद्धेः युद्धे प्रियचिकीर्षवः
verses.english_translation: And he spoke, O lord of earth, these words to Sri Krishna... Draw up my chariot, O Krishna, between the two armies.

verses.original_text:
सञ्जय उवाच 
एवमुक्तो हृषीकेशो गुडाकेशेन भारत । 
सेनयोरुभयोर्मध्ये स्थापयित्वा रथोत्तमम्
verses.english_translation: So that I may have a good look at those who are standing eager to fight and know with whom I have to fight in this enterprise of war.

verses.original_text:
भीष्मद्रोणप्रमुखतः सर्वेषां च महीक्षिताम् । 
उवाच पार्थ पश्यैतान्समवेतान्कुरूनिति
verses.english_translation: I wish to see those gathered here ready to fight in this battle in order to please the evil-minded son of Dhrtarastra.

verses.original_text:
तत्रापश्यत्स्थितान्पार्थः पितॄनथ पितामहान् । 
आचार्यान्मातुलान्भ्रातॄन्पुत्रान्पौत्रान्सखींस्तथा
verses.english_translation: Sanjaya said. Thus addressed by Arjuna, Sri Krishna drew up that best of chariots between the two armies.

verses.original_text:
श्वशुरान्सुहृदश्चैव सेनयोरुभयोरपि । 
तान्समीक्ष्य स कौन्तेयः सर्वान्बन्धूनवस्थितान्
verses.english_translation: Before the view of Bhisma and Drona and all the other kings, O Dhrtarastra, and said ,' O Arjuna, behold these assembled Kauravas'.

verses.original_text:
कृपया परयाविष्टो विषीदन्निदमब्रवीत् । 
अर्जुन उवाच 
दृष्ट्वेमं स्वजनं कृष्ण युयुत्सुं समुपस्थितम्
verses.english_translation: Then as Arjuna looked on, he saw standing there fathers and grandfathers teachers, uncles, brothers, sons, grandsons and comrades.

verses.original_text:
सीदन्ति मम गात्राणि मुखं च परिशुष्यति । 
वेपथुश्च शरीरे मे रोमहर्षश्च जायते
verses.english_translation: Fathers-in-law and dear friends in both armies. When Arjuna saw all these kinsmen in array,

verses.original_text:
गाण्डीवं स्रंसते हस्तात्त्वक्चैव परिदह्यते । 
न च शक्नोम्यवस्थातुं भ्रमतीव च मे मनः
verses.english_translation: He was filled with deep compassion and said these words in despair:.. ... O Krishna, when I look on these, my kinsmen present here, eager for battle,

verses.original_text:
निमित्तानि च पश्यामि विपरीतानि केशव । 
न च श्रेयोऽनुपश्यामि हत्वा स्वजनमाहवे
verses.english_translation: My limbs are weakened, my mouth gets parched, my body trembles and my hairs stand erect.

verses.original_text:
न काङ्क्षे विजयं कृष्ण न च राज्यं सुखानि च । 
किं नो राज्येन गोविन्द किं भोगैर्जीवितेन वा
verses.english_translation: The bow Gandiva slips from my hand and my skin is burning. I can stand no longer. My mind seems to reel.

verses.original_text:
येषामर्थे काङ्क्षितं नो राज्यं भोगाः सुखानि च । 
त इमेऽवस्थिता युद्धे प्राणांस्त्यक्त्वा धनानि च
verses.english_translation: I see, Krishna, inauspicious omens. I foresee no good in killing my kinsmen in the fight.

verses.original_text:
आचार्याः पितरः पुत्रास्तथैव च पितामहाः । 
मातुलाः श्वशुराः पौत्राः श्यालाः सम्बन्धिनस्तथा
verses.english_translation: I desire no victory, nor empire, nor pleasure. What have we to do with empire, O Krishna, or enjoyment or even life?

verses.original_text:
एतान्न हन्तुमिच्छामि घ्नतोऽपि मधुसूदन । 
अपि त्रैलोक्यराज्यस्य हेतोः किं नु महीकृते
verses.english_translation: Those for whose sake we do desire empire, enjoyment and pleasure, stand here in war renouncing life and wealth-

verses.original_text:
निहत्य धार्तराष्ट्रान्नः का प्रीतिः स्याज्जनार्दन । 
पापमेवाश्रयेदस्मान्हत्वैतानाततायिनः
verses.english_translation: Teachers, fathers, sons and also grandfathers, uncles, fathers-in-law and grandsons, brothers in law and other kinsmen-

verses.original_text:
तस्मान्नार्हा वयं हन्तुं धार्तराष्ट्रान्स्वबान्धवान् । 
स्वजनं हि कथं हत्वा सुखिनः स्याम माधव
verses.english_translation: These I would not slay, though they might slay me, even for the sovereignty of the three worlds- how much less for this earth O Krishna.

verses.original_text:
यद्यप्येते न पश्यन्ति लोभोपहतचेतसः ।
 कुलक्षयकृतं दोषं मित्रद्रोहे च पातकम्
verses.english_translation: If we kill the sons of Dhrthrastra, what joy will be ours, O Krishna? Sin alone will accrue to us if we kill these murderous felons.

verses.original_text:
कथं न ज्ञेयमस्माभिः पापादस्मान्निवर्तितुम् । 
कुलक्षयकृतं दोषं प्रपश्यद्भिर्जनार्दन
verses.english_translation: Therefore, it is not befitting that we slay our kin, the sons of Dhrtarastra. For if we kill our kinsmen, O Krishna, how indeed can we be happy?

verses.original_text:
कुलक्षये प्रणश्यन्ति कुलधर्माः सनातनाः । 
धर्मे नष्टे कुलं कृत्स्नमधर्मोऽभिभवत्युत
verses.english_translation: Though, these people, whose minds are overpowered by greed, see no evil in the destruction of a clan and no sin in treachery to friends.

verses.original_text:
अधर्माभिभवात्कृष्ण प्रदुष्यन्ति कुलस्त्रियः । 
स्त्रीषु दुष्टासु वार्ष्णेय जायते वर्णसङ्करः
verses.english_translation: Why should we not learn to shun this crime- we who see the evil of ruining a clan, O Krishna?.

verses.original_text:
सङ्करो नरकायैव कुलघ्नानां कुलस्य च । 
पतन्ति पितरो ह्येषां लुप्तपिण्डोदकक्रियाः
verses.english_translation: With the ruins of a clan, perish its ancient tradition, and when traditions perish, lawlessness overtakes the whole clan.

verses.original_text:
दोषैरेतैः कुलघ्नानां वर्णसङ्करकारकैः । 
उत्साद्यन्ते जातिधर्माः कुलधर्माश्च शाश्वताः
verses.english_translation: When lawlessness prevails, O Krishna, the women of the clan become corrupt; when women become corrupt, there arises intermixture of classes.

verses.original_text:
उत्सन्नकुलधर्माणां मनुष्याणां जनार्दन । 
नरकेऽनियतं वासो भवतीत्यनुशुश्रुम
verses.english_translation: This mixing of classes leads to hell the clan itself and its destroyers for the spirits of their ancestors fall degraded, deprived of the ritual offerings of food and water.

verses.original_text:
अहो बत महत्पापं कर्तुं व्यवसिता वयम् । 
यद्राज्यसुखलोभेन हन्तुं स्वजनमुद्यताः
verses.english_translation: By the sins of the clan-destroyers who bring about inter-mixture of classes, the ancient traditions of clan and class are destroyed.

verses.original_text:
यदि मामप्रतीकारमशस्त्रं शस्त्रपाणयः । 
धार्तराष्ट्रा रणे हन्युस्तन्मे क्षेमतरं भवेत्
verses.english_translation: For those whose clan-laws are destroyed, dwelling to hell is ordained O Krishna; thus have we heard.

verses.original_text:
सञ्जय उवाच 
एवमुक्त्वार्जुनः संख्ये रथोपस्थ उपाविशत् । 
विसृज्य सशरं चापं शोकसंविग्नमानसः
verses.english_translation: Alas! we have resolved to commit a great sin in that we are ready to slay our kith and kin out of desire for sovereignty and enjoyments.

verses.original_text:
सञ्जय उवाच 
तं तथा कृपयाविष्टमश्रुपूर्णाकुलेक्षणम् । 
विषीदन्तमिदं वाक्यमुवाच मधुसूदनः
verses.english_translation: Sanjaya said  To whom, who was thus overcome with pity, whose eyes where wet with  tears, who was sorrow-stricken and bore a bewildered look Sri Krishna spoke as follows.

verses.original_text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच 
कुतस्त्वा कश्मलमिदं विषमे समुपस्थितम् । 
अनार्यजुष्टमस्वर्ग्यमकीर्तिकरमर्जुन
verses.english_translation: The Lord said.  Whence comes on you this despondency, O Arjuna, in this crisis? It is  unfit for a noble person. It is disgraceful and it obstructs one's attainment of heaven.

verses.original_text:
क्लैब्यं मा स्म गमः पार्थ नैतत्त्वय्युपपद्यते । 
क्षुद्रं हृदयदौर्बल्यं त्यक्त्वोत्तिष्ठ परन्तप
verses.english_translation: Yield not to unmanliness, O Arjuna, it does not become you. Shake off this base faint-heartedness and arise, O scorcher of foes!

verses.original_text:
अर्जुन उवाच 
कथं भीष्ममहं सङ्ख्ये द्रोणं च मधुसूदन । 
इषुभिः प्रतियोत्स्यामि पूजार्हावरिसूदन
verses.english_translation: Arjuna said: How can I, O slayer of foes, aim arrows in battle against Bhishma and Drona who are worthy of reverence?

verses.original_text:
गुरूनहत्वा हि महानुभावान् श्रेयो भोक्तुं भैक्ष्यमपीह लोके । 
हत्वार्थकामांस्तु गुरूनिहैव भुञ्जीय भोगान् रुधिरप्रदिग्धान्
verses.english_translation: It is better even to live on beggar's fare in this world than to slay these most venerable teachers. If I should slay my teachers, though degraded they be by desire for wealth, I would be enjoying only blood stained pleasure here.

verses.original_text:
न चैतद्विद्मः कतरन्नो गरीयो यद्वा जयेम यदि वा नो जयेयुः । 
यानेव हत्वा न जिजीविषामः तेऽवस्थिताः प्रमुखे धार्तराष्ट्राः
verses.english_translation: We do not know, which of the two is better for us- whether our vanquishing them, or their vanquishing us. The very sons of Dhratarastra ,whom if we slay, we should not wish to live, even they are standing in array against us.

verses.original_text:
कार्पण्यदोषोपहतस्वभावः पृच्छामि त्वां धर्मसम्मूढचेताः । 
यच्छ्रेयः स्यान्निश्चितं ब्रूहि तन्मे शिष्यस्तेऽहं शाधि मां त्वां प्रपन्नम्
verses.english_translation: With my heart stricken by the fault of weak compassion, with my mind perplexed about my duty,

verses.original_text:
न हि प्रपश्यामि ममापनुद्यात् यच्छोकमुच्छोषणमिन्द्रियाणाम् । 
अवाप्य भूमावसपत्नमृद्धम् राज्यं सुराणामपि चाधिपत्यम्
verses.english_translation: Even if I should win unchallenged sovereignty of a prosperous earth or even the kingdom on lordship over the Devas, I do not feel that it would dispel the grief that withers up my senses.

verses.original_text:
सञ्जय उवाच 
एवमुक्त्वा हृषीकेशं गुडाकेशः परन्तप । 
न योत्स्य इति गोविन्दमुक्त्वा तूष्णीं बभूव ह
verses.english_translation: Sanjaya said: having spoken thus to Sri Krishna, Arjuna, the conqueror of sleep and the scorcher of foes, said, "I will not fight" and became silent.

verses.original_text:
तमुवाच हृषीकेशः प्रहसन्निव भारत । 
सेनयोरुभयोर्मध्ये विषीदन्तमिदं वचः
verses.english_translation: O King, to him who was thus sorrowing between the two armies, Sri Krishna spoke the following words, as if smiling (by way of ridicule)

verses.original_text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच 
अशोच्यानन्वशोचस्त्वं प्रज्ञावादांश्च भाषसे । 
गतासूनगतासूंश्च नानुशोचन्ति पण्डिताः
verses.english_translation: The lord said: You grieve for those who should not be grieved for; yet you speak words of wisdom. The wise grieve neither for the dead nor for the living.

verses.original_text:
न त्वेवाहं जातु नासं न त्वं नेमे जनाधिपाः । 
न चैव न भविष्यामः सर्वे वयमतः परम्
verses.english_translation: There never was a time when I did not exist, nor you, nor any of these kings of men. Nor will there be any time in future when all of us shall cease to be.

verses.original_text:
देहिनोऽस्मिन्यथा देहे कौमारं यौवनं जरा । 
तथा देहान्तरप्राप्तिः धीरस्तत्र न मुह्यति
verses.english_translation: Just as the self associated with a body passes through childhood, youth and old age (pertaining to that body), so too (at death) It passes into another body. A wise man is not deluded by that.

verses.original_text:
मात्रास्पर्शास्तु कौन्तेय शीतोष्णसुखदुःखदाः । 
आगमापायिनोऽनित्यास्तांस्तितिक्षस्व भारत
verses.english_translation: The contact of senses with their objects, O Arjuna, gives rise to feelings of cold and heat, pleasure and pain. They come and go, never lasting long. Endure them, O Arjuna.

verses.original_text:
यं हि न व्यथयन्त्येते पुरुषं पुरुषर्षभ । 
समदुःखसुखं धीरं सोऽमृतत्वाय कल्पते
verses.english_translation: For, he whom these do not affect, O chief of men, and to whom pain and pleasure are the same-that steadfast man alone is worthy of immortality.

verses.original_text:
नासतो विद्यते भावो नाभावो विद्यते सतः । 
उभयोरपि दृष्टोऽन्तस्त्वनयोस्तत्त्वदर्शिभिः
verses.english_translation: The unreal can never come into being, the real never ceases to be. The conclusion about these two is seen by the seers of truth.

verses.original_text:
अविनाशि तु तद्विद्धि येन सर्वमिदं ततम् । 
विनाशमव्ययस्यास्य न कश्चित्कर्तुमर्हति
verses.english_translation: Know That to be indestructible by which all this is pervaded. None can cause the destruction of this Immutable.

verses.original_text:
अन्तवन्त इमे देहा नित्यस्योक्ताः शरीरिणः । 
अनाशिनोऽप्रमेयस्य तस्माद्युध्यस्व भारत
verses.english_translation: These bodies of the Jiva(the embodied self) are said to have an end while the Jiva itself is eternal, indestructible and incomprehensible. Therefore, fight O Bharata (Arjuna).

verses.original_text:
य एनं वेत्ति हन्तारं यश्चैनं मन्यते हतम् । 
उभौ तौ न विजानीतो नायं हन्ति न हन्यते
verses.english_translation: He who deems It( the self) a slayer, and he who thinks of It as slain- both are ignorant. For, the self neither slays nor is slain.

verses.original_text:
न जायते म्रियते वा कदाचित् नायं भूत्वा भविता वा न भूयः । 
अजो नित्यः शाश्वतोऽयं पुराणो न हन्यते हन्यमाने शरीरे
verses.english_translation: It (the self) is never born; It never dies; having come into being once it never ceases to be. Unborn, eternal, abiding and primeval, It is not slain when the body is slain.

verses.original_text:
वेदाविनाशिनं नित्यं य एनमजमव्ययम् । 
कथं स पुरुषः पार्थ कं घातयति हन्ति कम्
verses.english_translation: He who knows this (self) to be indestructible, unborn, unchanging and hence eternal- how and whom, O Arjuna, does he cause to be killed, and whom does he kill.

verses.original_text:
वासांसि जीर्णानि यथा विहाय नवानि गृह्णाति नरोऽपराणि । 
तथा शरीराणि विहाय जीर्णान्यन्यानि संयाति नवानि देही
verses.english_translation: As a man casts off worn-out garments and puts on others that are new so does the embodied self cast off worn-out bodies and enter into others that are new.

verses.original_text:
नैनं छिन्दन्ति शस्त्राणि नैनं दहति पावकः । 
न चैनं क्लेदयन्त्यापो न शोषयति मारुतः
verses.english_translation: Weapons do not cleave It (the self), fire does not burn It, waters do not wet it, and wind does not dry It.

verses.original_text:
अच्छेद्योऽयमदाह्योऽयमक्लेद्योऽशोष्य एव च । 
नित्यः सर्वगतः स्थाणुरचलोऽयं सनातनः
verses.english_translation: It cannot be cleft; It cannot be burnt; It cannot be wetted and It cannot be dried, It is eternal, all-pervading, stable, immovable and primeval.

verses.original_text:
अव्यक्तोऽयमचिन्त्योऽयमविकार्योऽयमुच्यते । 
तस्मादेवं विदित्वैनं नानुशोचितुमर्हसि
verses.english_translation: The (self) is said to be unmanifest, inconceivable and unchanging. Therefore, knowing It thus, it does not befit you to grieve.

verses.original_text:
अथ चैनं नित्यजातं नित्यं वा मन्यसे मृतम् । 
तथापि त्वं महाबाहो नैवं शोचितुमर्हसि
verses.english_translation: Or if you hold this self as being constantly born and as constantly dying, even then, O mighty-armed one, it does not become you to feel grief.

verses.original_text:
जातस्य हि ध्रुवो मृत्युर्ध्रुवं जन्म मृतस्य च । 
तस्मादपरिहार्येऽर्थे न त्वं शोचितुमर्हसि
verses.english_translation: For, death is certain for the born, and rebirth is certain for the dead; therefore you should not feel grief for what is inevitable.

verses.original_text:
अव्यक्तादीनि भूतानि व्यक्तमध्यानि भारत । 
अव्यक्तनिधनान्येव तत्र का परिदेवना
verses.english_translation: O Arjuna, being have an unknown beginning a known middle and an unknown end. What is there to grieve over in all this?

verses.original_text:
आश्चर्यवत्पश्यति कश्चिदेनं आश्चर्यवद्वदति तथैव चान्यः । 
आश्चर्यवच्चैनमन्यः शृणोति श्रुत्वाप्येनं वेद न चैव कश्चित्
verses.english_translation: One looks upon This (self) as a wonder; likewise another speaks of It as a wonder; still another hears of It as a wonder; and even after hearing of It, one knows It not.

verses.original_text:
देही नित्यमवध्योऽयं देहे सर्वस्य भारत । 
तस्मात्सर्वाणि भूतानि न त्वं शोचितुमर्हसि
verses.english_translation: The self in the body, O Arjuna, is eternal and indestructible. This is so in the case of the selves in all bodies. Therefore, it is not fit for you to feel grief for any being.

verses.original_text:
स्वधर्ममपि चावेक्ष्य न विकम्पितुमर्हसि । 
धर्म्याद्धि युद्धाच्छ्रेयोऽन्यत्क्षत्रियस्य न विद्यते
verses.english_translation: Further considering your own duty, it does not befit you to waver. For, to a Kshthriya, there is no greater good than a righteous war.

verses.original_text:
यदृच्छया चोपपन्नं स्वर्गद्वारमपावृतम् । 
सुखिनः क्षत्रियाः पार्थ लभन्ते युद्धमीदृशम्
verses.english_translation: Happy are Kshtriyas, O Arjuna, to whom a war like this comes of its own accord; it opens the gate to heaven.

verses.original_text:
अथ चेत्त्वमिमं धर्म्यं सङ्ग्रामं न करिष्यसि । 
ततः स्वधर्मं कीर्तिं च हित्वा पापमवाप्स्यसि
verses.english_translation: But if you do not fight this righteous war, you will be turning away from your duty and honored position, and will be incurring sin.

verses.original_text:
अकीर्तिं चापि भूतानि कथयिष्यन्ति तेऽव्ययाम् । 
सम्भावितस्य चाकीर्तिर्मरणादतिरिच्यते
verses.english_translation: Further, people will speak ill of you for all time, and for one accustomed to be honored, dishonor is worse than death.

verses.original_text:
भयाद्रणादुपरतं मंस्यन्ते त्वां महारथाः । 
येषां च त्वं बहुमतो भूत्वा यास्यसि लाघवम्
verses.english_translation: The great warriors will think that you have fled from battle in fear. These men who held you in high esteem will speak lightly of you now.

verses.original_text:
अवाच्यवादांश्च बहून्वदिष्यन्ति तवाहिताः । 
निन्दन्तस्तव सामर्थ्यं ततो दुःखतरं नु किम्
verses.english_translation: Your enemies, slandering your prowess, will use words which should never be uttered. What could be more painful than that?

verses.original_text:
हतो वा प्राप्स्यसि स्वर्गं जित्वा वा भोक्ष्यसे महीम् । 
तस्मादुत्तिष्ठ कौन्तेय युद्धाय कृतनिश्चयः
verses.english_translation: If slain, you shall win heaven; or if victorious, you shall enjoy the earth. Therefore, arise, O Arjuna, resolved to fight.

verses.original_text:
सुखदुःखे समे कृत्वा लाभालाभौ जयाजयौ । 
ततो युद्धाय युज्यस्व नैवं पापमवाप्स्यसि
verses.english_translation: Holding pleasure and pain, gain and loss, victory and defeat as alike gird yourself up for the battle. Thus, you shall not incur any sin.

verses.original_text:
एषा तेऽभिहिता साङ्ख्ये बुद्धिर्योगे त्विमां शृणु । 
बुद्ध्या युक्तो यया पार्थ कर्मबन्धं प्रहास्यसि
verses.english_translation: This Buddhi concerning the self (Sankhya) has been imparted to you. Now listen to this with regard to Yoga, by following which you will get rid of the bondage of Karma.

verses.original_text:
नेहाभिक्रमनाशोऽस्ति प्रत्यवायो न विद्यते । 
स्वल्पमप्यस्य धर्मस्य त्रायते महतो भयात्
verses.english_translation: Here, there is no loss of effort, nor any accrual of evil. Even a little of this dharma (called karma Yoga) protects a man from the great fear.

verses.original_text:
व्यवसायात्मिका बुद्धिरेकेह कुरुनन्दन । 
बहुशाखा ह्यनन्ताश्च बुद्धयोऽव्यवसायिनाम्
verses.english_translation: In this (Karma Yoga), O Arjuna, the resolute mind is one-pointed; the minds of the irresolute are many-branched and endless.

verses.original_text:
यामिमां पुष्पितां वाचं प्रवदन्त्यविपश्चितः । 
वेदवादरताः पार्थ नान्यदस्तीति वादिनः
verses.english_translation: O ! Partha, the unwise, who rejoice in the letter of the Vedas say, 'There is nothing else.' They are full only of worldly desire and they hanker for heaven. They speak flowery words which offer rebirth as the fruit of work. They look upon the Vedas of consisting entirely of varied rites for the attainment of pleasure and power. Those who cling so to pleasure and power are attracted by that speech ( offering heavenly rewards) and are unable to develop the resolute will of a concentrated mind.

verses.original_text:
कामात्मानः स्वर्गपरा जन्मकर्मफलप्रदाम् । 
क्रियाविशेषबहुलां भोगैश्वर्यगतिं प्रति
verses.english_translation: O ! Partha, the unwise, who rejoice in the letter of the Vedas say, 'There is nothing else.' They are full only of worldly desire and they hanker for heaven. They speak flowery words which offer rebirth as the fruit of work. They look upon the Vedas of consisting entirely of varied rites for the attainment of pleasure and power. Those who cling so to pleasure and power are attracted by that speech ( offering heavenly rewards) and are unable to develop the resolute will of a concentrated mind.

verses.original_text:
भोगैश्वर्यप्रसक्तानां तयापहृतचेतसाम् । 
व्यवसायात्मिका बुद्धिः समाधौ न विधीयते
verses.english_translation: O ! Partha, the unwise, who rejoice in the letter of the Vedas say, 'There is nothing else.' They are full only of worldly desire and they hanker for heaven. They speak flowery words which offer rebirth as the fruit of work. They look upon the Vedas of consisting entirely of varied rites for the attainment of pleasure and power. Those who cling so to pleasure and power are attracted by that speech ( offering heavenly rewards) and are unable to develop the resolute will of a concentrated mind.

verses.original_text:
त्रैगुण्यविषया वेदा निस्त्रैगुण्यो भवार्जुन । 
निर्द्वन्द्वो नित्यसत्त्वस्थो निर्योगक्षेम आत्मवान्
verses.english_translation: The Vedas have the three Gunas for their sphere, O Arjuna. You must be free from the three Gunas and be free from pairs of opposites. Abide in pure Sattva; never care to acquire things and to protect what has been acquired , but be established in the self.

verses.original_text:
यावानर्थ उदपाने सर्वतः सम्प्लुतोदके । 
तावान्सर्वेषु वेदेषु ब्राह्मणस्य विजानतः
verses.english_translation: What use a thirsty person has for a water reservoir when all sides of it are flooded- that much alone is the use of all the Vedas for Brahmana who knows.

verses.original_text:
कर्मण्येवाधिकारस्ते मा फलेषु कदाचन । 
मा कर्मफलहेतुर्भूर्मा ते सङ्गोऽस्त्वकर्मणि
verses.english_translation: To work alone you have the right, and not to the fruits. Do not be impelled by the fruits of work. Nor have attachment to inaction.

verses.original_text:
योगस्थः कुरु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा धनञ्जय । 
सिद्ध्यसिद्ध्योः समो भूत्वा समत्वं योग उच्यते
verses.english_translation: Abandoning attachment and established in Yoga, perform works, viewing success and failure with even mind. Evenness of mind is said to be Yoga.

verses.original_text:
दूरेण ह्यवरं कर्म बुद्धियोगाद्धनञ्जय ।
बुद्धौ शरणमन्विच्छ कृपणाः फलहेतवः
verses.english_translation: Action with attachment is far inferior, O Arjuna, to action done with evenness of mind. Seek refuge in evenness of mind. Miserable are they who act with a motive for results.

verses.original_text:
बुद्धियुक्तो जहातीह उभे सुकृतदुष्कृते । 
तस्माद् योगाय युज्यस्व योगः कर्मसु कौशलम्
verses.english_translation: A man with evenness of mind discards here and now good and evil. Therefore endeavor for Yoga. Yoga is skill in action.

verses.original_text:
कर्मजं बुद्धियुक्ता हि फलं त्यक्त्वा मनीषिणः । 
जन्मबन्धविनिर्मुक्ताः पदं गच्छन्त्यनामयम्
verses.english_translation: The wise who possess evenness of mind, relinquishing the fruits born action, are freed from the bondage of rebirth, and go to the region beyond all ills.

verses.original_text:
यदा ते मोहकलिलं बुद्धिर्व्यतितरिष्यति । 
तदा गन्तासि निर्वेदं श्रोतव्यस्य श्रुतस्य च
verses.english_translation: When your intellect has passed beyond the tangle of delusion, you will yourself feel disgusted regarding what you shall hear and what you have already heard.

verses.original_text:
श्रुतिविप्रतिपन्ना ते यदा स्थास्यति निश्चला । 
समाधावचला बुद्धिस्तदा योगमवाप्स्यसि
verses.english_translation: When your intellect, well enlightened by hearing from me and firmly placed, stands unshaken in a concentrated mind, then you will attain vision of the self.

verses.original_text:
अर्जुन उवाच 
स्थितप्रज्ञस्य का भाषा समाधिस्थस्य केशव । 
स्थितधीः किम्प्रभाषेत किमासीत व्रजेत किम्
verses.english_translation: Arjuna said: What is the mode of speech of him who is of firm wisdom, who is established in the control of the mind? What will man of firm wisdom speak, O Krishna? How does he sit? How does he move?

verses.original_text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच 
प्रजहाति यदा कामान्सर्वान्पार्थ मनोगतान् । 
आत्मन्येवात्मना तुष्टः स्थितप्रज्ञस्तदोच्यते
verses.english_translation: The Lord said: When a man renounces all the desire of the mind, O Arjuna, when he is satisfied in himself with himself, then he is said to be of firm wisdom.

verses.original_text:
दुःखेष्वनुद्विग्नमनाः सुखेषु विगतस्पृहः । 
वीतरागभयक्रोधः स्थितधीर्मुनिरुच्यते
verses.english_translation: He whose mind is not perturbed in pain, who has no longing for pleasures, who is free from desire, fear and anger- he is called a sage of firm wisdom.

verses.original_text:
यः सर्वत्रानभिस्नेहस्तत्तत्प्राप्य शुभाशुभम् । 
नाभिनन्दति न द्वेष्टि तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता
verses.english_translation: He who has no love on any side, who, when he finds good or evil, neither rejoices nor hates- his wisdom is firmly set.

verses.original_text:
यदा संहरते चायं कूर्मोऽङ्गानीव सर्वशः । 
इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेभ्यस्तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता
verses.english_translation: When one is able to draw his senses from the objects of sense on every side, as a tortoise draws in its limbs, then his wisdom is firmly set.

verses.original_text:
विषया विनिवर्तन्ते निराहारस्य देहिनः । 
रसवर्जं रसोऽप्यस्य परं दृष्ट्वा निवर्तते
verses.english_translation: The objects of sense, excepting relish for the objects, turn away from the abstinent dweller in the body. Even the relish turns away from him when what is supreme over the senses i.e., the self, is seen.

verses.original_text:
यततो ह्यपि कौन्तेय पुरुषस्य विपश्चितः । 
इन्द्रियाणि प्रमाथीनि हरन्ति प्रसभं मनः
verses.english_translation: The turbulent senses, O Arjuna, do carry away perforce the mind of even a wise man, though he is ever striving.

verses.original_text:
तानि सर्वाणि संयम्य युक्त आसीत मत्परः । 
वशे हि यस्येन्द्रियाणि तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता
verses.english_translation: Having controlled all the senses, let him remain in contemplation, regarding Me as supreme; for, his knowledge is firmly set whose senses are under control.

verses.original_text:
ध्यायतो विषयान्पुंसः सङ्गस्तेषूपजायते । 
सङ्गात्सञ्जायते कामः कामात्क्रोधोऽभिजायते
verses.english_translation: To a man thinking about sense-objects, there arises attachment to them; from attachment arises desire, from desire arises anger.

verses.original_text:
क्रोधाद्भवति सम्मोहः सम्मोहात् स्मृतिविभ्रमः । 
स्मृतिभ्रंशाद्बुद्धिनाशः बुद्धिनाशात्प्रणश्यति
verses.english_translation: From anger there comes delusion; from delusion the loss of memory; from the loss of memory, the destruction of discrimination; and with the destruction of discrimination, he is lost.

verses.original_text:
रागद्वेषवियुक्तैस्तु विषयानिन्द्रियैश्चरन् । 
आत्मवश्यैर्विधेयात्मा प्रसादमधिगच्छति
verses.english_translation: But he who goes through the sense-objects with the senses free from love and hate, disciplined and controlled attains serenity.

verses.original_text:
प्रसादे सर्वदुःखानां हानिरस्योपजायते । 
प्रसन्नचेतसो ह्याशु बुद्धिः पर्यवतिष्ठते
verses.english_translation: In that serenity there is loss of all sorrow; for in the case of the person with a serene mind, the Buddhi soon becomes well established.

verses.original_text:
नास्ति बुद्धिरयुक्तस्य न चायुक्तस्य भावना । 
न चाभावयतः शान्तिरशान्तस्य कुतः सुखम्
verses.english_translation: There is no Buddhi for the un integrated, nor for him is there contemplation of the self, and for him without contemplation of the self, there is no peace; and for one lacking peace, where is happiness?

verses.original_text:
इन्द्रियाणां हि चरतां यन्मनोऽनुविधीयते । 
तदस्य हरति प्रज्ञां वायुर्नावमिवाम्भसि
verses.english_translation: For, when the mind follows the senses experiencing their objects, his understanding is carried away by them as the wind carries away a ship on the waters.

verses.original_text:
तस्माद्यस्य महाबाहो निगृहीतानि सर्वशः । 
इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेभ्यस्तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता
verses.english_translation: Therefore, O mighty-armed, he whose senses are restrained from going after their objects on all sides, his wisdom is firmly set.

verses.original_text:
या निशा सर्वभूतानां तस्यां जागर्ति संयमी । 
यस्यां जाग्रति भूतानि सा निशा पश्यतो मुनेः
verses.english_translation: What is night for all beings, in it the controlled one is awake; when all beings are awake, that is the night to the sage who sees.

verses.original_text:
आपूर्यमाणमचलप्रतिष्ठम् समुद्रमापः प्रविशन्ति यद्वत् । 
तद्वत्कामा यं प्रविशन्ति सर्वे स शान्तिमाप्नोति न कामकामी
verses.english_translation: He into whom all desires enter as the waters enter the full and undisturbed sea, attains to peace, and not he who longs after objects of desire.

verses.original_text:
विहाय कामान्यः सर्वान् पुमांश्चरति निस्स्पृहः । 
निर्ममो निरहङ्कारः स शान्तिमधिगच्छति
verses.english_translation: The man who, abandoning all desires, abides without longing and possession and the sense of 'I' and 'mine', wins peace.

verses.original_text:
एषा ब्राह्मी स्थितिः पार्थ नैनां प्राप्य विमुह्यति । 
स्थित्वास्यामन्तकालेऽपि ब्रह्मनिर्वाणमृच्छति
verses.english_translation: This is the Brahmi-state, O Arjuna. None attaining to this is deluded. By abiding in this state even at the hour of death, one wins the self.

verses.original_text:
अर्जुन उवाच 
ज्यायसी चेत् कर्मणस्ते मता बुद्धिर्जनार्दन । 
तत् किं कर्मणि घोरे मां नियोजयसि केशव
verses.english_translation: Arjuna said: If , O Krishna, you consider that Buddhi (knowledge) is superior to works, why do you engage me in this terrible deed.

verses.original_text:
व्यामिश्रेणेव वाक्येन बुद्धिं मोहयसीव मे ।
 तदेकं वद निश्चित्य येन श्रेयोऽहमाप्नुयाम्
verses.english_translation: You confuse me with statements that seem to contradict each other; tell me for certain that one way by which I could reach the highest good.

verses.original_text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच 
लोकेऽस्मिन् द्विविधा निष्ठा पुरा प्रोक्ता मयानघ । 
ज्ञानयोगेन साङ्ख्यानां कर्मयोगेन योगिनाम्
verses.english_translation: The Lord said: In this world a two-fold way was of yore laid down by Me, O sinless one: by Jnana Yoga for the Sankhyas and by Karma Yoga for the Yogins.

verses.original_text:
न कर्मणामनारम्भान्नैष्कर्म्यं पुरुषोऽश्नुते । 
न च सन्न्यसनादेव सिद्धिं समधिगच्छति
verses.english_translation: No man experiences freedom from activity (Naiskarmya) by abstaining from works; and no man ever attains success by mere renunciation of works.

verses.original_text:
न हि कश्चित्क्षणमपि जातु तिष्ठत्यकर्मकृत् । 
कार्यते ह्यवशः कर्म सर्वः प्रकृतिजैर्गुणैः
verses.english_translation: No man can, even for a moment, rest without doing work; for everyone is caused to act, in spite of himself, by the Gunas born of Nature.

verses.original_text:
कर्मेन्द्रियाणि संयम्य य आस्ते मनसा स्मरन् । 
इन्द्रियार्थान्विमूढात्मा मिथ्याचारः स उच्यते
verses.english_translation: He who, controlling the organs of action, lets his mind dwell on the objects of senses, in a deluded person and a hypocrite.

verses.original_text:
यस्त्विन्द्रियाणि मनसा नियम्यारभतेऽर्जुन । 
कर्मेन्द्रियैः कर्मयोगमसक्तः स विशिष्यते
verses.english_translation: But he who, subduing his senses by the mind, O Arjuna, begins to practice Karma Yoga through the organs of action and who is free from attachment- he excels.

verses.original_text:
नियतं कुरु कर्म त्वं कर्म ज्यायो ह्यकर्मणः । 
शरीरयात्रापि च ते न प्रसिद्ध्येदकर्मणः
verses.english_translation: You must perform your obligatory action; for action is superior to non-action (Jnana Yoga). For a person following non-action not even the sustentation of the body is possible.

verses.original_text:
यज्ञार्थात्कर्मणोऽन्यत्र लोकोऽयं कर्मबन्धनः । 
तदर्थं कर्म कौन्तेय मुक्तसङ्गः समाचर
verses.english_translation: This world is held in the bondage of work only when work is not performed as sacrifice. O Arjuna, you must perform work to this end, free from attachment.

verses.original_text:
सहयज्ञाः प्रजाः सृष्ट्वा पुरोवाच प्रजापतिः । 
अनेन प्रसविष्यध्वमेष वोऽस्त्विष्टकामधुक्
verses.english_translation: In the beginning the lord of all beings, creating man along with the sacrifice, said: 'By this shall you prosper; this shall be the cow of plenty granting all your wants.'

verses.original_text:
देवान्भावयतानेन ते देवा भावयन्तु वः । 
परस्परं भावयन्तः श्रेयः परमवाप्स्यथ
verses.english_translation: By this, please the gods, and the gods will support you. Thus nourishing one another, may you obtain the highest good.

verses.original_text:
इष्टान्भोगान्हि वो देवा दास्यन्ते यज्ञभाविताः । 
तैर्दत्तानप्रदायैभ्यो यो भुङ्क्ते स्तेन एव सः
verses.english_translation: The gods, pleased by the sacrifice, will bestow on you the enjoyments you desire. He who enjoys the bounty of the gods without giving them anything in return, is but a thief.

verses.original_text:
यज्ञशिष्टाशिनः सन्तो मुच्यन्ते सर्वकिल्बिषैः । 
भुञ्जते ते त्वघं पापा ये पचन्त्यात्मकारणात्
verses.english_translation: Pious men who eat the remnants of sacrifice are freed from all sins. But the sinful ones who cook only for their own sake earn only sin.

verses.original_text:
अन्नाद्भवन्ति भूतानि पर्जन्यादन्नसम्भवः । 
यज्ञाद्भवति पर्जन्यो यज्ञः कर्मसमुद्भवः
verses.english_translation: From food arise all beings (i.e., their bodies); from rain food is produced; from sacrifice comes rain; and sacrifice springs from activity.

verses.original_text:
कर्म ब्रह्मोद्भवं विद्धि ब्रह्माक्षरसमुद्भवम् । 
तस्मात्सर्वगतं ब्रह्म नित्यं यज्ञे प्रतिष्ठितम्
verses.english_translation: Know that activity springs from 'Brahman', i.e. the physical body, 'Brahman' arises from the imperishable (self); therefore the all-pervading 'Brahman' is ever established in sacrifice.

verses.original_text:
एवं प्रवर्तितं चक्रं नानुवर्तयतीह यः । 
अघायुरिन्द्रियारामो मोघं पार्थ स जीवति
verses.english_translation: He who does not follow the wheel thus set in motion here, lives in sin, satisfying the senses, O Arjuna. He lives in vain.

verses.original_text:
यस्त्वात्मरतिरेव स्यादात्मतृप्तश्च मानवः । 
आत्मन्येव च सन्तुष्टस्तस्य कार्यं न विद्यते
verses.english_translation: But the man whose delight is only in the self, who is satisfied with the self, who rejoices in the self, for him nothing remains to be accomplished.

verses.original_text:
नैव तस्य कृतेनार्थो नाकृतेनेह कश्चन । 
न चास्य सर्वभूतेषु कश्चिदर्थव्यपाश्रयः
verses.english_translation: He has no purpose to gain by work done or left undone, nor has he to rely on any end.

verses.original_text:
तस्मादसक्तः सततं कार्यं कर्म समाचर । 
असक्तो ह्याचरन्कर्म परमाप्नोति पूरुषः
verses.english_translation: Therefore without attachment do your work which ought to be done. For, a man who works without attachment attains to Supreme.

verses.original_text:
कर्मणैव हि संसिद्धिमास्थिता जनकादयः । 
लोकसङ्ग्रहमेवापि सम्पश्यन्कर्तुमर्हसि
verses.english_translation: Indeed by Karma Yoga alone did Janaka and others reach perfection. Even recognizing its necessity for the guidance of the world, you must perform action.

verses.original_text:
यद्यदाचरति श्रेष्ठस्तत्तदेवेतरो जनः । 
स यत्प्रमाणं कुरुते लोकस्तदनुवर्तते
verses.english_translation: Whatever a great man does, other men also do. Whichever standard he sets, the world follows it.

verses.original_text:
न मे पार्थास्ति कर्तव्यं त्रिषु लोकेषु किञ्चन । 
नानवाप्तमवाप्तव्यं वर्त एव च कर्मणि
verses.english_translation: For me, Arjuna, there is nothing in all the three worlds which ought to be done, nor is there anything un-acquired that ought to be acquired. Yet I go on working.

verses.original_text:
यदि ह्यहं न वर्तेयं जातु कर्मण्यतन्द्रितः । 
मम वर्त्मानुवर्तन्ते मनुष्याः पार्थ सर्वशः
verses.english_translation: If I did not continue to work unwearied, O Arjuna, men would follow my path.

verses.original_text:
उत्सीदेयुरिमे लोका न कुर्यां कर्म चेदहम् । 
सङ्करस्य च कर्ता स्यामुपहन्यामिमाः प्रजाः
verses.english_translation: If I do not work, these men would be lost; and I will causing chaos in life and thereby ruining all these people.

verses.original_text:
सक्ताः कर्मण्यविद्वांसो यथा कुर्वन्ति भारत । 
कुर्याद्विद्वांस्तथासक्तश्चिकीर्षुर्लोकसङ्ग्रहम्
verses.english_translation: Just as the ignorant, attached to their work, act, O Arjuna, so too the learned should act without any attachment, and only for the welfare of the world.

verses.original_text:
न बुद्धिभेदं जनयेदज्ञानां कर्मसङ्गिनाम् । 
जोषयेत्सर्वकर्माणि विद्वान्युक्तः समाचरन्
verses.english_translation: He should not bewilder the minds of the ignorant who are attached to work; rather himself performing work with devotion, he should cause others to do so.

verses.original_text:
प्रकृतेः क्रियमाणानि गुणैः कर्माणि सर्वशः । 
अहङ्कारविमूढात्मा कर्ताहमिति मन्यते
verses.english_translation: Actions are being performed in every way by the Gunas of Prakrti. He whose nature is deluded by egoism, thinks, 'I am the doer.'

verses.original_text:
तत्त्ववित्तु महाबाहो गुणकर्मविभागयोः । 
गुणा गुणेषु वर्तन्त इति मत्वा न सज्जते
verses.english_translation: But he who knows the truth about the Division of the Gunas and works, O mighty armed one, through his knowledge that 'Gunas operate on their products,' is not attached.

verses.original_text:
प्रकृतेर्गुणसम्मूढाः सज्जन्ते गुणकर्मसु । 
तानकृत्स्नविदो मन्दान्कृत्स्नविन्न विचालयेत्
verses.english_translation: Those who are deluded by the Gunas of Prakrti are attached to the works of the Gunas. But he who knows the whole truth should not unsettle the ignorant who do not know the whole truth.

verses.original_text:
मयि सर्वाणि कर्माणि सन्न्यस्याध्यात्मचेतसा । 
निराशीर्निर्ममो भूत्वा युध्यस्व विगतज्वरः
verses.english_translation: Surrendering all your actions to Me with a mind focused on the self, free from desire and selfishness, fight with the heat of excitement abated.

verses.original_text:
ये मे मतमिदं नित्यमनुतिष्ठन्ति मानवाः । 
श्रद्धावन्तोऽनसूयन्तो मुच्यन्ते तेऽपि कर्मभिः
verses.english_translation: Those men who, full of faith, ever practice this teaching of Mine and those who receive it without cavil- even they are released from Karma.

verses.original_text:
ये त्वेतदभ्यसूयन्तो नानुतिष्ठन्ति मे मतम् । 
सर्वज्ञानविमूढांस्तान् विद्धि नष्टानचेतसः
verses.english_translation: But those who calumniate it , and those who do not practice this teaching of mine- know them to be absolutely senseless and devoid of all knowledge, and therefore lost.

verses.original_text:
सदृशं चेष्टते स्वस्याः प्रकृतेर्ज्ञानवानपि । 
प्रकृतिं यान्ति भूतानि निग्रहः किं करिष्यति
verses.english_translation: Even the man of knowledge acts according to his nature; all beings follow their nature. What will repression do?

verses.original_text:
इन्द्रियस्येन्द्रियस्यार्थे रागद्वेषौ व्यवस्थितौ । 
तयोर्न वशमागच्छेत्तौ ह्यस्य परिपन्थिनौ
verses.english_translation: Each sense has fixed attachment to, and aversion for, its corresponding object. But no one should come under their sway; for they are hisfoes.

verses.original_text:
श्रेयान्स्वधर्मो विगुणः परधर्मात्स्वनुष्ठितात् । 
स्वधर्मे निधनम् श्रेयः परधर्मो भयावहः
verses.english_translation: Better is one's own duty, though ill-done, than the duty of another well performed. Better is death in one's own duty; the duty of anotheris fraught with fear.

verses.original_text:
अर्जुन उवाच 
अथ केन प्रयुक्तोऽयं पापं चरति पूरुषः । 
अनिच्छन्नपि वार्ष्णेय बलादिव नियोजितः
verses.english_translation: Arjuna said: But, impelled by what, O Krishna, does one (practicing Jnana Yoga),commit sin even against his own will, constrained as it were, by force?

verses.original_text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच 
काम एष क्रोध एष रजोगुणसमुद्भवः । 
महाशनो महापाप्मा विद्ध्येनमिह वैरिणम्
verses.english_translation: The Lord said: It is desire, it is wrath, born of the Guna of Rajas; it is a great devourer, an impeller to sin. Know this to be foe here.

verses.original_text:
धूमेनाव्रियते वह्निर्यथादर्शो मलेन च । 
यथोल्बेनावृतो गर्भः तथा तेनेदमावृतम्
verses.english_translation: As a fire is enveloped by smoke, as a mirror is covered by dust, and as an embryo is encased in the membrane, so is this ( world) envelopedby it (desire).

verses.original_text:
आवृतं ज्ञानमेतेन ज्ञानिनो नित्यवैरिणा । 
कामरूपेण कौन्तेय दुष्पूरेणानलेन च
verses.english_translation: The knowledge of the intelligent self is enveloped by this constant enemy, O Arjuna, which is of nature of desire, and which is difficultto gratify and is insatiable.

verses.original_text:
इन्द्रियाणि मनो बुद्धिरस्याधिष्ठानमुच्यते । 
एतैर्विमोहयत्येष ज्ञानमावृत्य देहिनम्
verses.english_translation: The senses, the mind and the intellect are said to be its instruments By these it overpowers the embodied self after enveloping Its knowledge.

verses.original_text:
तस्मात्त्वमिन्द्रियाण्यादौ नियम्य भरतर्षभ । 
पाप्मानं प्रजहिह्येनं ज्ञानविज्ञाननाशनम्
verses.english_translation: Therefore, O Arjuna, controlling the senses in the very beginning, slay this sinful thing destroys both knowledge and discrimination.

verses.original_text:
इन्द्रियाणि पराण्याहुरिन्द्रियेभ्यः परं मनः । 
मनसस्तु परा बुद्धिर्यो बुद्धेः परतस्तु सः
verses.english_translation: The senses are high, they say: the mind is higher than senses; the intellect is higher than the mind; but what is greater than intellectis that (desire).

verses.original_text:
एवं बुद्धेः परं बुद्ध्वा संस्तभ्यात्मानमात्मना । 
जहि शत्रुं महाबाहो कामरूपं दुरासदम्
verses.english_translation: Thus knowing that which is higher than the intellect and fixing the mind with the help of the intellect in Karma Yoga, O Arjuna, slay thisenemy which wears the form of desire, and which is difficult to overcome

verses.original_text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच 
इमं विवस्वते योगं प्रोक्तवानहमव्ययम् । 
विवस्वान्मनवे प्राह मनुरिक्ष्वाकवेऽब्रवीत्
verses.english_translation: The Lord said: I taught this imperishable Yoga to Vivasan; Vivasan taught it toManu; Manu declared it to Iksvaku.

verses.original_text:
एवं परम्पराप्राप्तमिमं राजर्षयो विदुः । 
स कालेनेह महता योगो नष्टः परन्तप
verses.english_translation: Thus handed down in succession, the royal sages knew this( Karma Yoga). But with long lapse of time, O Arjuna, that Yoga was lost tothe world.

verses.original_text:
स एवायं मया तेऽद्य योगः प्रोक्तः पुरातनः । 
भक्तोऽसि मे सखा चेति रहस्यं ह्येतदुत्तमम्
verses.english_translation: It is the same ancient Yoga which is now taught to you by Me, as you are My devotee and my friend. For, this is a supreme mystery.

verses.original_text:
अर्जुन उवाच 
अपरं भवतो जन्म परं जन्म विवस्वतः । 
कथमेतद्विजानीयां त्वमादौ प्रोक्तवानिति
verses.english_translation: Later was your birth, and earlier the birth of Vivasvan. How then am I to understand that you taught it in the beginning?

verses.original_text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच
बहूनि मे व्यतीतानि जन्मानि तव चार्जुन । 
तान्यहं वेद सर्वाणि न त्वं वेत्थ परन्तप
verses.english_translation: Many births of mine have passed, O Arjuna, and so is it with you also. I know them all, but you do not know them.

verses.original_text:
अजोऽपि सन्नव्ययात्मा भूतानामीश्वरोऽपि सन् । 
प्रकृतिं स्वामधिष्ठाय सम्भवाम्यात्ममायया
verses.english_translation: Though I am birthless and of immutable nature, though I am the Lord of all beings, yet by employing My own Nature (Prakrti) I am bornout of My own free will.

verses.original_text:
यदा यदा हि धर्मस्य ग्लानिर्भवति भारत । 
अभ्युत्थानमधर्मस्य तदात्मानं सृजाम्यहम्
verses.english_translation: Whenever there is a decline of Dharma, O Arjuna, and uprising of Adharma, then I incarnate MySelf.

verses.original_text:
परित्राणाय साधूनां विनाशाय च दुष्कृताम् । 
धर्मसंस्थापनार्थाय सम्भवामि युगे युगे
verses.english_translation: For the protection of the good and also for the destruction of the wicked, for the establishment of Dharma, am I born from age to age.

verses.original_text:
जन्म कर्म च मे दिव्यमेवं यो वेत्ति तत्त्वतः । 
त्यक्त्वा देहं पुनर्जन्म नैति मामेति सोऽर्जुन
verses.english_translation: He who thus knows in truth My divine birth and actions does not get rebirth after leaving the body; he will come to Me. O Arjuna.

verses.original_text:
वीतरागभयक्रोधा मन्मया मामुपाश्रिताः । 
बहवो ज्ञानतपसा पूता मद्भावमागताः
verses.english_translation: Freed from desire, fear and wrath, absorbed in Me, depending upon Me, purified by the austerity of knowledge, many have attained my state.

verses.original_text:
ये यथा मां प्रपद्यन्ते तांस्तथैव भजाम्यहम् । 
मम वर्त्मानुवर्तन्ते मनुष्याः पार्थ सर्वशः
verses.english_translation: Whoever resort to Me in any manner , in the same manner do I favor them; men experience Me alone in different ways, O Arjuna.

verses.original_text:
काङ्क्षन्तः कर्मणां सिद्धिं यजन्त इह देवताः । 
क्षिप्रं हि मानुषे लोके सिद्धिर्भवति कर्मजा
verses.english_translation: Those who desire the fruits of their ritualistic acts, sacrifice to the gods here; for, success born of such acts quickly accrues in theworld of men.

verses.original_text:
चातुर्वर्ण्यं मया सृष्टं गुणकर्मविभागशः । 
तस्य कर्तारमपि मां विद्ध्यकर्तारमव्ययम्
verses.english_translation: The system of four stations was created by Me according to distinction of Gunas and Karma. Though I am their creator, know Me as non-agentand immutable.

verses.original_text:
न मां कर्माणि लिम्पन्ति न मे कर्मफले स्पृहा । 
इति मां योऽभिजानाति कर्मभिर्न स बध्यते
verses.english_translation: Works do not contaminate Me. In me there is no desire for fruits of actions. He who understands Me thus is not bound by actions.

verses.original_text:
एवं ज्ञात्वा कृतं कर्म पूर्वैरपि मुमुक्षुभिः । 
कुरु कर्मैव तस्मात्त्वं पूर्वैः पूर्वतरं कृतम्
verses.english_translation: Knowing thus, even ancient seekers for liberation did work. Therefore, do your work only as the ancients did in olden times.

verses.original_text:
किं कर्म किमकर्मेति कवयोऽप्यत्र मोहिताः । 
तत्ते कर्म प्रवक्ष्यामि यज्ज्ञात्वा मोक्ष्यसेऽशुभात्
verses.english_translation: What is action? what is non-action? Even the wise are puzzled in respect of these. I shall declare to you that kind of action byknowing which you will be freed from evil.

verses.original_text:
कर्मणो ह्यपि बोद्धव्यं बोद्धव्यं च विकर्मणः । 
अकर्मणश्च बोद्धव्यं गहना कर्मणो गतिः
verses.english_translation: For, there is what ought to be known in action. Likewise there is what ought to be understood in non-action. And there is what oughtto be understood in non-action. Thus mysterious is the way of action.

verses.original_text:
कर्मण्यकर्म यः पश्येदकर्मणि च कर्म यः । 
स बुद्धिमान्मनुष्येषु स युक्तः कृत्स्नकर्मकृत्
verses.english_translation: He who sees non-action in action and also action in non-action is wise among men. he is fit for release and has carried out all actions.

verses.original_text:
यस्य सर्वे समारम्भाः कामसङ्कल्पवर्जिताः । 
ज्ञानाग्निदग्धकर्माणं तमाहुः पण्डितं बुधाः
verses.english_translation: He whose every undertaking is free from desire and delusive identification (of the body with the self), whose actions are burntup in the fire of knowledge-him the wise described as a sage.

verses.original_text:
त्यक्त्वा कर्मफलासङ्गं नित्यतृप्तो निराश्रयः । 
कर्मण्यभिप्रवृत्तोऽपि नैव किञ्चित्करोति सः
verses.english_translation: Having renounced attachment to the fruits of his actions, ever contented with the eternal self, and dependent on none, one doesnot act at all, even though engaged in action.

verses.original_text:
निराशीर्यतचित्तात्मा त्यक्तसर्वपरिग्रहः । 
शारीरं केवलं कर्म कुर्वन्नाप्नोति किल्बिषम्
verses.english_translation: Free from desire, his intellect and mind controlled, giving up all possessions, and doing bodily work only, he is not subject to evil:

verses.original_text:
यदृच्छालाभसन्तुष्टो द्वन्द्वातीतो विमत्सरः । 
समः सिद्धावसिद्धौ च कृत्वापि न निबध्यते
verses.english_translation: Content with what chance may bring, rising above the pairs of opposites, free from ill-will, even-minded in success and failure,though he acts, he is not bound.

verses.original_text:
गतसङ्गस्य मुक्तस्य ज्ञानावस्थितचेतसः । 
यज्ञायाचरतः कर्म समग्रं प्रविलीयते
verses.english_translation: Of one whose attachments are gone, who is free, whose mind is established in knowledge, who works only for sacrifices, his Karmais entirely dissolved.

verses.original_text:
ब्रह्मार्पणं ब्रह्म हविर्ब्रह्माग्नौ ब्रह्मणा हुतम् । 
ब्रह्मैव तेन गन्तव्यं ब्रह्मकर्मसमाधिना
verses.english_translation: Brahman is the instrument to offer with; Brahman is the oblation By Brahman is the oblation offered into the fire of Brahman; Brahmanalone is to be reached by him who meditates on Him in his works.

verses.original_text:
दैवमेवापरे यज्ञं योगिनः पर्युपासते । 
ब्रह्माग्नावपरे यज्ञं यज्ञेनैवोपजुह्वति
verses.english_translation: Some Yogins resort only to the sacrifice relating to gods. Others offer sacrifice into the fire of Brahman solely by means of sacrifice.

verses.original_text:
श्रोत्रादीनीन्द्रियाण्यन्ये संयमाग्निषु जुह्वति । 
शब्दादीन्विषयानन्य इन्द्रियाग्निषु जुह्वति
verses.english_translation: Others offer as oblations hearing and other senses in the fires of restraint. Some others offer as oblations the objects of the sensessuch as sound and the rest, into the fires of their senses.

verses.original_text:
सर्वाणीन्द्रियकर्माणि प्राणकर्माणि चापरे । 
आत्मसंयमयोगाग्नौ जुह्वति ज्ञानदीपिते
verses.english_translation: Some again offer as oblation the functions of the senses and the activity of the vital breaths into the fire of the Yoga of restraintof the mind kindled by knowledge.

verses.original_text:
द्रव्ययज्ञास्तपोयज्ञा योगयज्ञास्तथापरे । 
स्वाध्यायज्ञानयज्ञाश्च यतयः संशितव्रताः
verses.english_translation: Self controlled and firm of resolve, others perform the sacrifice of material objects or austerities or Yoga; while others offer theirscriptural study and knowledge.

verses.original_text:
अपाने जुह्वति प्राणं प्राणेऽपानं तथापरे । 
प्राणापानगती रुद्ध्वा प्राणायामपरायणाः
verses.english_translation: Others, with restricted diet, are devoted to the control of breath. Some sacrifice the inward breath in the outward breath. Similarlyothers sacrifice the outward breath in the inward breath. Some others stopping, the flow of both the inward breath and the outward ,sacrificethe inward breaths and outward breaths.

verses.original_text:
अपरे नियताहाराः प्राणान्प्राणेषु जुह्वति । 
सर्वेऽप्येते यज्ञविदो यज्ञक्षपितकल्मषाः
verses.english_translation: All these know the meaning of sacrifices and through sacrifices are their sins eradicated. Those who subsist on the ambrosial food, the remnantsof sacrifices, go to eternal Brahman.

verses.original_text:
यज्ञशिष्टामृतभुजो यान्ति ब्रह्म सनातनम् । 
नायं लोकोऽस्त्ययज्ञस्य कुतोऽन्यः कुरुसत्तम
verses.english_translation: This world is not for him who makes no sacrifice. How then the other, O Arjuna?

verses.original_text:
एवं बहुविधा यज्ञा वितता ब्रह्मणो मुखे । 
कर्मजान्विद्धि तान्सर्वानेवं ज्ञात्वा विमोक्ष्यसे
verses.english_translation: Thus many forms of sacrifices have been spread out as means of reaching Brahman (individual self in its own nature).Know that all these areborn of actions. Knowing thus, you shall be free.

verses.original_text:
श्रेयान्द्रव्यमयाद्यज्ञाज्ज्ञानयज्ञः परन्तप । 
सर्वं कर्माखिलं पार्थ ज्ञाने परिसमाप्यते
verses.english_translation: The sacrifice of knowledge is superior to material sacrifice. O Arjuna all actions and everything else culminate in knowledge.

verses.original_text:
तद्विद्धि प्रणिपातेन परिप्रश्नेन सेवया । 
उपदेक्ष्यन्ति ते ज्ञानं ज्ञानिनस्तत्त्वदर्शिनः
verses.english_translation: Know this by prostration, questioning and by service. The wise, who have realized the truth, will instruct you in knowledge.

verses.original_text:
यज्ज्ञात्वा न पुनर्मोहमेवं यास्यसि पाण्डव । 
येन भूतान्यशेषेण द्रक्ष्यस्यात्मन्यथो मयि
verses.english_translation: Knowing which, O Arjuna, you will not fall again into delusion in this way- by that knowledge you will see all beings without exceptionin your self and then in Me.

verses.original_text:
अपि चेदसि पापेभ्यः सर्वेभ्यः पापकृत्तमः । 
सर्वंज्ञानप्लवेनैव वृजिनं सन्तरिष्यसि
verses.english_translation: Even if you be the most sinful of all sinners, you will cross over all sins by the boat of knowledge alone.

verses.original_text:
यथैधांसि समिद्धोऽग्निर्भस्मसात्कुरुतेऽर्जुन । 
ज्ञानाग्निः सर्वकर्माणि भस्मसात्कुरुते तथा
verses.english_translation: Just as burning fire turns fuel to ashes, O Arjuna, so does the fire of Knowledge turn all Karma to ashes.

verses.original_text:
न हि ज्ञानेन सदृशं पवित्रमिह विद्यते । 
तत्स्वयं योगसंसिद्धः कालेनात्मनि विन्दति
verses.english_translation: For there is no purifier here equal to knowledge; he that is perfected in Karma Yoga finds this (knowledge) of his own accord in himself indue time.

verses.original_text:
श्रद्धावाँल्लभते ज्ञानं तत्परः संयतेन्द्रियः । 
ज्ञानं लब्ध्वा परां शान्तिमचिरेणाधिगच्छति
verses.english_translation: He who has faith, who is intent on it, and who has mastered his senses, attains knowledge. Having attained knowledge, he goes soonto supreme peace.

verses.original_text:
अज्ञश्चाश्रद्धधानश्च संशयात्मा विनश्यति । 
नायं लोकोऽस्ति न परो न सुखं संशयात्मनः
verses.english_translation: The ignorant, the faithless and the doubting one perish; for doubting one there is neither this world, nor that beyond, nor happiness.

verses.original_text:
योगसन्न्यस्तकर्माणं ज्ञानसञ्छिन्नसंशयम् । 
आत्मवन्तं न कर्माणि निबध्नन्ति धनञ्जय
verses.english_translation: Actions do not bind him, O Arjuna, who has renounced them through Karma Yoga and whose doubts are sundered by knowledge, and whotherefore possesses a steady mind.

verses.original_text:
तस्मादज्ञानसम्भूतं हृत्स्थं ज्ञानासिनात्मनः । 
छित्त्वैनं संशयं योगमातिष्ठोत्तिष्ठ भारत
verses.english_translation: Therefore, sunder, with the sword of knowledge, this doubt present in your heart resulting from ignorance concerning the self.Practice this Yoga, Arjuna, and rise up.

verses.original_text:
अर्जुन उवाच 
संन्यासं कर्मणां कृष्ण पुनर्योगं च शंससि । 
यच्छ्रेय एतयोरेकं तन्मे ब्रूहि सुनिश्चितम्
verses.english_translation: Arjuna said: You praise, O Krishna, the renunciation of actions and then praiseKarma Yoga also. Tell me with certainty which of these is the superior one leading to the ultimate good.

verses.original_text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच 
संन्यासः कर्मयोगश्च निश्श्रेयसकरावुभौ । 
तयोस्तु कर्मसन्न्यासात्कर्मयोगो विशिष्यते
verses.english_translation: Renunciation of actions and Karma Yoga, both lead to the highest excellence. But, of the two, Karma Yoga excels the renunciation ofactions.

verses.original_text:
ज्ञेयः स नित्यसन्न्यासी यो न द्वेष्टि न काङ्क्षति । 
निर्द्वन्द्वो हि महाबाहो सुखं बन्धात्प्रमुच्यते
verses.english_translation: He who neither hates nor desires and is beyond the pairs of opposites is to be understood as an ever-renouncer. Hence, he is easily setfree from bondage.

verses.original_text:
साङ्ख्ययोगौ पृथग्बालाः प्रवदन्ति न पण्डिताः । 
एकमप्यास्थितः सम्यगुभयोर्विन्दते फलम्
verses.english_translation: Children, not the learned, speak of Sankhya (Jnana Yoga) and Yoga (Karma Yoga) as distinct; he who is firmly set in one, attains the fruit ofboth.

verses.original_text:
यत्साङ्ख्यैः प्राप्यते स्थानं तद्योगैरपि गम्यते । 
एकं साङ्ख्यं च योगं च यः पश्यति स पश्यति
verses.english_translation: That state which is reached by Sankhyans, the same is reached by the Yogins, i.e., the same state is attained also by those who are KarmaYogins. He alone is wise who sees that the Sankhya and the Yoga are one and the same because of their having the same result.

verses.original_text:
संन्यासस्तु महाबाहो दुःखमाप्तुमयोगतः । 
योगयुक्तो मुनिर्ब्रह्म न चिरेणाधिगच्छति
verses.english_translation: But renunciation, O mighty-armed, is hard to attain without (following) Yoga. The contemplating sage who follows Yoga reachesthe Brahman (the self or Atman) soon.

verses.original_text:
योगयुक्तो विशुद्धात्मा विजितात्मा जितेन्द्रियः । 
सर्वभूतात्मभूतात्मा कुर्वन्नपि न लिप्यते
verses.english_translation: He who follows the Yoga and is pure in self (mind), who has subdued his self and has conquered his senses and whose self has become theself of all beings, even while he is acting, he is untainted.

verses.original_text:
नैव किञ्चित्करोमीति युक्तो मन्येत तत्त्ववित् । 
पश्यन्शृण्वन्स्पृशन्जिघ्रन्नश्नन्गच्छन्स्वपन्श्वसन्
verses.english_translation: The knower of the truth, who is devoted to Yoga should think, 'I do not at all do anything' even though he is seeing, hearing, touchingsmelling, eating, moving, sleeping, breathing;

verses.original_text:
प्रलपन्विसृजन्गृह्णन्नुन्मिषन्निमिषन्नपि । 
इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेषु वर्तन्त इति धारयन्
verses.english_translation: Speaking, discharging, grasping, opening, closing his eyes etc. He should always bear in mind that the senses operate among sense-objects.

verses.original_text:
ब्रह्मण्याधाय कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा करोति यः । 
लिप्यते न स पापेन पद्मपत्रमिवाम्भसा
verses.english_translation: He who acts without attachment, reposing all actions on Brahman (Prakrti), is untouched by evil, as a lotus-leaf by water.

verses.original_text:
कायेन मनसा बुद्ध्या केवलैरिन्द्रियैरपि ।
 योगिनः कर्म कुर्वन्ति सङ्गं त्यक्त्वात्मशुद्धये
verses.english_translation: Merely with the body, the mind, the intellect and the senses, Yogins do actions, renouncing attachment, for the purification of the self.

verses.original_text:
युक्तः कर्मफलं त्यक्त्वा शान्तिमाप्नोति नैष्ठिकीम् । 
अयुक्तः कामकारेण फले सक्तो निबध्यते
verses.english_translation: A Yogin, renouncing the fruits of his actions, attains lasting peace. But the unsteady man who is attached to fruits of actions, beingimpelled by desire, is bound.

verses.original_text:
सर्वकर्माणि मनसा सन्न्यस्यास्ते सुखं वशी । 
नवद्वारे पुरे देही नैव कुर्वन्न कारयन्
verses.english_translation: The embodied self, mentally resigning all actions as belonging to the city of nine gates(i.e., the body)and becoming self controlled, dwellshappily, neither himself acting nor causing the body to act.

verses.original_text:
न कर्तृत्वं न कर्माणि लोकस्य सृजति प्रभुः । 
न कर्मफलसंयोगं स्वभावस्तु प्रवर्तते
verses.english_translation: The lord of the body (the self i.e., the Jiva) does not create agency, nor actions, nor union with the fruits of actions in relationto the world of selves. It is only the inherent tendencies that function.

verses.original_text:
नादत्ते कस्यचित् पापं न चैव सुकृतं विभुः । 
अज्ञानेनावृतं ज्ञानं तेन मुह्यन्ति जन्तवः
verses.english_translation: The all-pervading One takes away neither the sin nor the merit of any one. Knowledge is enveloped by ignorance. Creatures are thereby deluded.

verses.original_text:
ज्ञानेन तु तदज्ञानं येषां नाशितमात्मनः । 
तेषामादित्यवज्ज्ञानम् प्रकाशयति तत्परम्
verses.english_translation: But for those in whom this ignorance is destroyed by the knowledge of the self, that knowledge, in their case, is supreme and shines likethe sun.

verses.original_text:
तद्बुद्धयस्तदात्मानस्तन्निष्ठास्तत्परायणाः । 
गच्छन्त्यपुनरावृत्तिं ज्ञाननिर्धूतकल्मषाः
verses.english_translation: Those whose intellects pursue It (the self), whose minds think about It, who undergo discipline for It, and who hold It as their highestobject, have their impurities cleansed by knowledge and go whence there is no return.

verses.original_text:
विद्याविनयसम्पन्ने ब्राह्मणे गवि हस्तिनि । 
शुनि चैव श्वपाके च पण्डिताः समदर्शिनः
verses.english_translation: The sages look with an equal eye on one endowed with learning and humanity, a Brahmana, a cow, an elephant, a dog and a dog-eater

verses.original_text:
इहैव तैर्जितः सर्गो येषां साम्ये स्थितं मनः । 
निर्दोषं हि समं ब्रह्म तस्माद्ब्रह्मणि ते स्थिताः
verses.english_translation: Here itself Samsara is overcome by those whose minds rest in equalness For the Brahman (individual self), when uncontaminated by Prakrti,is the same everywhere. Therefore they abide in Brahman.

verses.original_text:
न प्रहृष्येत्प्रियं प्राप्य नोद्विजेत्प्राप्य चाप्रियम् । 
स्थिरबुद्धिरसम्मूढो ब्रह्मविद्ब्रह्मणि स्थितः
verses.english_translation: He who knows Brahman (individual self) and abides in Brahman, whose mind is steadfastly on the self and undeluded by the bodyconsciousness- he neither rejoices at gaining what is pleasant, nor gives on obtaining what is unpleasant.

verses.original_text:
बाह्यस्पर्शेष्वसक्तात्मा विन्दत्यात्मनि यत्सुखम् । 
स ब्रह्मयोगयुक्तात्मा सुखमक्षयमश्नुते
verses.english_translation: He whose mind is detached from external contact, and finds happiness in the self- he has his mind engaged in the contemplation of Brahmanand he enjoys undecaying bliss.

verses.original_text:
ये हि संस्पर्शजा भोगा दुःखयोनय एव ते । 
आद्यन्तवन्तः कौन्तेय न तेषु रमते बुधः
verses.english_translation: For those pleasures that are born of contact are wombs of pain. They have a beginning and an end, O Arjuna. The wise do not rejoice in them.

verses.original_text:
शक्नोतीहैव यः सोढुं प्राक्शरीरविमोक्षणात् । 
कामक्रोधोद्भवं वेगं स युक्तः स सुखी नरः
verses.english_translation: He who is able, even here, before he is released from the body, to bear the impulse generated by desire and wrath, he is a Yogin(competent for self-realization); he is the happy man.

verses.original_text:
योऽन्तःसुखोऽन्तरारामस्तथान्तर्ज्योतिरेव यः । 
स योगी ब्रह्मनिर्वाणं ब्रह्मभूतोऽधिगच्छति
verses.english_translation: He whose joy is within, pleasure is within, and similarly light is within- he is a Yogin, who having become the Brahman, attains thebliss of the Brahman.

verses.original_text:
लभन्ते ब्रह्मनिर्वाणमृषयः क्षीणकल्मषाः । 
छिन्नद्वैधा यतात्मानः सर्वभूतहिते रताः
verses.english_translation: The sages who are free from the pairs of opposites, whose minds are well subdued and who are devoted to the welfare of all beings, becomecleansed of all impurities and attain the bliss of the Brahman.

verses.original_text:
कामक्रोधवियुक्तानां यतीनां यतचेतसाम् । 
अभितो ब्रह्मनिर्वाणं वर्तते विदितात्मनाम्
verses.english_translation: To those who are free from desire and wrath, who are wont to exert themselves, whose thought is controlled, and who have conquered it-the beatitude of the Brahman is close at hand.

verses.original_text:
स्पर्शान्कृत्वा बहिर्बाह्यांश्चक्षुश्चैवान्तरे भ्रुवोः । 
प्राणापानौ समौ कृत्वा नासाभ्यन्तरचारिणौ
verses.english_translation: Shutting off outward contacts, fixing the gaze between the eye-brows, equalizing inward and outward breaths moving in the nostrils;

verses.original_text:
यतेन्द्रियमनोबुद्धिर्मुनिर्मोक्षपरायणः । 
विगतेच्छाभयक्रोधो यः सदा मुक्त एव सः
verses.english_translation: The sage who has controlled his senses, mind and intellect, who is intent on release as his final goal, freed for eve from desire,fear and wrath- is indeed liberated forever.

verses.original_text:
भोक्तारं यज्ञतपसां सर्वलोकमहेश्वरम् । 
सुहृदं सर्वभूतानां ज्ञात्वा मां शान्तिमृच्छति
verses.english_translation: Knowing Me as the enjoyer of all sacrifices and austerities, as the Supreme Lord of all the worlds, as the Friend of every being, heattains peace.

verses.original_text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच 
अनाश्रितः कर्मफलं कार्यं कर्म करोति यः । 
स सन्न्यासी च योगी च न निरग्निर् न चाक्रियः
verses.english_translation: He who performs works that ought to be one without seeking their fruits- he is a Sannyasin and Yogin, an no he who maintains nosacred fires and performs no actions.

verses.original_text:
यं संन्यासमिति प्राहुर्योगं तं विद्धि पाण्डव । 
न ह्यसन्न्यस्तसङ्कल्पो योगी भवति कश्चन
verses.english_translation: That which is called Sannyasa (Jnana Yoga), know that to be Yoga (Karma Yoga), O Arjuna. For (among Karma Yogins) no one whosedelusive identification of the body with the self is not abandoned, becomes a true Karma Yogin.

verses.original_text:
आरुरुक्षोर्मुनेर्योगं कर्म कारणमुच्यते । 
योगारूढस्य तस्यैव शमः कारणमुच्यते
verses.english_translation: Action is said to be the means for the sage who seek to climb the heights of Yoga; but when he has climbed the heights of Yoga,tranquility is said to be the means.

verses.original_text:
यदा हि नेन्द्रियार्थेषु न कर्मस्वनुषज्जते । 
सर्वसङ्कल्पसन्न्यासी योगारूढस्तदोच्यते
verses.english_translation: For, when one loses attachment for the things of the senses and to actions, then has he abandoned all desires and is said to haveclimbed the heights of Yoga.

verses.original_text:
उद्धरेदात्मनात्मानं नात्मानमवसादयेत् । 
आत्मैव ह्यात्मनो बन्धुरात्मैव रिपुरात्मनः
verses.english_translation: One should raise the self by his own mind and not allow the self to sink; for the mind alone is the friend of the self, and the mind aloneis the foe of the self.

verses.original_text:
बन्धुरात्मात्मनस्तस्य येनात्मैवात्मना जितः । 
अनात्मनस्तु शत्रुत्वे वर्तेतात्मैव शत्रुवत्
verses.english_translation: The mind is the friend of him by whom the mind has been conquered. But for him whose mind is not conquered, the mind, like an enemy,remains hostile.

verses.original_text:
जितात्मनः प्रशान्तस्य परमात्मा समाहितः । 
शीतोष्णसुखदुःखेषु तथा मानापमानयोः
verses.english_translation: Of him whose mind is conquered and who is serene, the great self is well secured in heat and cold, in pleasure and pain. and in honorand dishonor.

verses.original_text:
ज्ञानविज्ञानतृप्तात्मा कूटस्थो विजितेन्द्रियः । 
युक्त इत्युच्यते योगी समलोष्टाश्मकाञ्चनः
verses.english_translation: The Yogin whose mind is content with knowledge of the self and also of knowledge of the difference of the self from Prakrti, who isestablished in the self, whose senses are subdued and to whom earth, stone and gold seem all alike, is called integrated.

verses.original_text:
सुहृन्मित्रार्युदासीनमध्यस्थद्वेष्यबन्धुषु । 
साधुष्वपि च पापेषु समबुद्धिर्विशिष्यते
verses.english_translation: He who regards with an equal eye well-wishers, friends, foes, the indifferent, neutrals, the hateful, the relations, and even goodand sinful- he excels.

verses.original_text:
योगी युञ्जीत सततमात्मानं रहसि स्थितः । 
एकाकी यतचित्तात्मा निराशीरपरिग्रहः
verses.english_translation: The Yogin should constantly fix his mind on Yoga, remaining in a solitary place all alone, controlling his thought and mind, freefrom desire and sense of possession.

verses.original_text:
शुचौ देशे प्रतिष्ठाप्य स्थिरमासनमात्मनः । 
नात्युच्छ्रितं नातिनीचं चैलाजिनकुशोत्तरम्
verses.english_translation: Having established for himself, in a clean spot, a firm seat, which is neither too high nor too low, and covering it with cloth, deerskin and Kusas grass in the reverse order.

verses.original_text:
तत्रैकाग्रम् मनः कृत्वा यतचित्तेन्द्रियक्रियः । 
उपविश्यासने युञ्ज्याद्योगमात्मविशुद्धये
verses.english_translation: There, sitting on the seat, with the mind concentrated and holding the mind and senses in check, he should practice Yoga for thepurification of the self.

verses.original_text:
समं कायशिरोग्रीवं धारयन्नचलं स्थिरः । 
संप्रेक्ष्य नासिकाग्रं स्वं दिशश्चानवलोकयन्
verses.english_translation: Holding the trunk, head and neck erect, motionless and steady, gazing at the tip of the nose, and looking not in any direction;

verses.original_text:
प्रशान्तात्मा विगतभीर्ब्रह्मचारिव्रते स्थितः । 
मनः संयम्य मच्चित्तो युक्त आसीत मत्परः
verses.english_translation: Serene and fearless, firm in the vow of celibacy, holding the mind in check and fixing the thought on Me, he should sit I Yoga,intent on Me.

verses.original_text:
युञ्जन्नेवं सदात्मानं योगी नियतमानसः । 
शान्तिं निर्वाणपरमां मत्संस्थामधिगच्छति
verses.english_translation: Ever applying his mind in this way, the Yogin of controlled mind, attains the peace which is the summit of beatitude and which abidesin Me.

verses.original_text:
नात्यश्नतस्तु योगोऽस्ति न चैकान्तमनश्नतः । 
न चातिस्वप्नशीलस्य जाग्रतो नैव चार्जुन
verses.english_translation: Yoga is not for him who over-eats, nor for him who fasts excessively; not for him, O Arjuna, who sleeps too much, nor for him who staysawake too long.

verses.original_text:
युक्ताहारविहारस्य युक्तचेष्टस्य कर्मसु । 
युक्तस्वप्नावबोधस्य योगो भवति दुःखहा
verses.english_translation: Yoga becomes the destroyer of sorrows to him who is temperate in food and recreation, who is temperate in actions, who is temperatein sleep and wakefulness.

verses.original_text:
यदा विनियतं चित्तमात्मन्येवावतिष्ठते । 
निःस्पृहः सर्वकामेभ्यो युक्त इत्युच्यते तदा
verses.english_translation: When the subdued mind rests on the self alone, then free of all yearning for objects of desire, one is said to be fit for Yoga.

verses.original_text:
यथा दीपो निवातस्थो नेङ्गते सोपमा स्मृता । 
योगिनो यतचित्तस्य युञ्जतो योगमात्मनः
verses.english_translation: 'A lamp does not flicker in a windless place'- that is the simile employed for the subdued mind of a Yogin who practices Yoga.

verses.original_text:
यत्रोपरमते चित्तं निरुद्धं योगसेवया । 
यत्र चैवात्मनात्मानं पश्यन्नात्मनि तुष्यति
verses.english_translation: Where the mind, controlled by the practice of Yoga, rests and where seeing the self by the self one is delighted by the self only;

verses.original_text:
सुखमात्यन्तिकं यत् तत् बुद्धिग्राह्यमतीन्द्रियम् । 
वेत्ति यत्र न चैवायं स्थितश्चलति तत्त्वतः
verses.english_translation: Where one knows that infinite happiness which can be grasped by the intellect but is beyond the grasp of the senses, wherein establishedone swerves not from that condition;

verses.original_text:
यं लब्ध्वा चापरं लाभं मन्यते नाधिकं ततः । 
यस्मिन्स्थितो न दुःखेन गुरुणापि विचाल्यते
verses.english_translation: Which, having gained, one holds there is no greater gain beyond it; wherein established, one is not moved even by the heaviestsorrow-

verses.original_text:
तं विद्याद्दुःखसंयोगवियोगं योगसञ्ज्ञितम् । 
स निश्चयेन योक्तव्यो योगोऽनिर्विण्णचेतसा
verses.english_translation: Know this deliverance from association with misery to be Yoga. This Yoga must be practiced with determination and with a mind free fromdespondency.

verses.original_text:
सङ्कल्पप्रभवान्कामांस्त्यक्त्वा सर्वानशेषतः । 
मनसैवेन्द्रियग्रामं विनियम्य समन्ततः
verses.english_translation: Renouncing entirely all desires born of violation and restraining the mind from all the senses on all sides;

verses.original_text:
शनैः शनैरुपरमेद्बुद्ध्या धृतिगृहीतया । 
आत्मसंस्थं मनः कृत्वा न किञ्चिदपि चिन्तयेत्
verses.english_translation: Little by little one should withdraw oneself from the objects, other than the self with the help of the intellect held by firm resolution;and then one should think of nothing else, having fixed the mind upon the self.

verses.original_text:
यतो यतो निश्चरति मनश्चञ्चलमस्थिरम् । 
ततस्ततो नियम्यैतदात्मन्येव वशं नयेत्
verses.english_translation: Wherever the fickle and unsteady mind wanders, he should subdue it then and there and bring it back under the control of the self alone.

verses.original_text:
प्रशान्तमनसं ह्येनं योगिनं सुखमुत्तमम् । 
उपैति शान्तरजसं ब्रह्मभूतमकल्मषम्
verses.english_translation: For supreme happiness comes to the Yogin whose mind is at peace, who is free of evil, from whom the Rajas has departed, and who becomethe Brahman.

verses.original_text:
युञ्जन्नेवं सदात्मानं योगी विगतकल्मषः । 
सुखेन ब्रह्मसंस्पर्शमत्यन्तं सुखमश्नुते
verses.english_translation: Thus devoting himself to the Yoga of the self, freed from impurities, the Yogin easily attains the supreme bliss of contact with the Brahman.

verses.original_text:
सर्वभूतस्थमात्मानं सर्वभूतानि चात्मनि । 
ईक्षते योगयुक्तात्मा सर्वत्र समदर्शनः
verses.english_translation: He whose mind is fixed in Yoga sees equality everywhere; he sees his self as abiding in all beings and all beings in his self.

verses.original_text:
यो मां पश्यति सर्वत्र सर्वं च मयि पश्यति । 
तस्याहं न प्रणश्यामि स च मे न प्रणश्यति
verses.english_translation: To him who sees Me in every self and sees every self in Me- I am not lost to him and he is not lost to Me.

verses.original_text:
सर्वभूतस्थितं यो मां भजत्येकत्वमास्थितः । 
सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि स योगी मयि वर्तते
verses.english_translation: The Yogin who, fixed in oneness, worships Me dwelling in all beings he abides in Me, Howsoever he may live.

verses.original_text:
आत्मौपम्येन सर्वत्र समं पश्यति योऽअर्जुन । 
सुखं वा यदि वा दुःखं स योगी परमो मतः
verses.english_translation: He who, by reason of the similarity of selves everywhere, sees the pleasure or pain as the same everywhere- that Yogin, O Arjuna, isdeemed as the highest.

verses.original_text:
अर्जुन उवाच 
योऽयं योगस्त्वया प्रोक्तः साम्येन मधुसूदन । 
एतस्याहं न पश्यामि चञ्चलत्वात्स्थितिं स्थिराम्
verses.english_translation: Arjuna said: This Yoga of equality, which has been declared by you, O Krishna, I donot see that it can be steady because of the fickleness of the mind.

verses.original_text:
चञ्चलं हि मनः कृष्ण प्रमाथि बलवद्दृढम् ।
 तस्याहं निग्रहं मन्ये वायोरिव सुदुष्करम्
verses.english_translation: For the mind is fickle, O Krishna, impetuous, powerful and stubborn. I think that restraint of it is as difficult as that of the wind.

verses.original_text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच 
असंशयं महाबाहो मनो दुर्निग्रहं चलम् । 
अभ्यासेन तु कौन्तेय वैराग्येण च गृह्यते
verses.english_translation: The Lord said: The mind is hard to subdue and fickle, no doubt, O mighty-armed one,but O son of Kunti, by practice and by the exercise of dispassion it can be brought under control.

verses.original_text:
असंयतात्मना योगो दुष्प्राप इति मे मतिः । 
वश्यात्मना तु यतता शक्योऽवाप्तुमुपायतः
verses.english_translation: In my opinion Yoga is hard to attain by person of unrestrained mind. However, it can be attained through right means by him, who strives forit and has a subdued mind.

verses.original_text:
अर्जुन उवाच 
अयतिः श्रद्धयोपेतो योगाच्चलितमानसः । 
अप्राप्य योगसंसिद्धिं कां गतिं कृष्ण गच्छति
verses.english_translation: Arjuan said: If a person, who is possessed of faith but has put in only inadequateeffort, finds his mind wandering away from Yoga, and then fails to attain perfection- what way does he go, O Krishna?

verses.original_text:
कच्चिन्नोभयविभ्रष्टश्छिन्नाभ्रमिव नश्यति । 
अप्रतिष्ठो महाबाहो विमूढो ब्रह्मणः पथि
verses.english_translation: Without any support, confused in the path leading to the Brahman, and thus fallen from both, does he not perish, O mighty armed, like ariven cloud?

verses.original_text:
एतन्मे संशयं कृष्ण छेत्तुमर्हस्यशेषतः । 
त्वदन्यः संशयस्यास्य छेत्ता न ह्युपपद्यते
verses.english_translation: You should altogether remove this doubt of mine, O Krishna, for there is no other remover of this doubt than You.

verses.original_text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच 
पार्थ नैवैह नामुत्र विनाशस्तस्य विद्यते । 
न हि कल्याणकृत्कश्चिद्दुर्गतिं तात गच्छति
verses.english_translation: The lord said: Neither here (in this world) nor there (in the next), Arjuna, is theredestruction for him. For, no one who does good ever comes to an evil end.

verses.original_text:
प्राप्य पुण्यकृतां लोकानुषित्वा शाश्वतीः समाः । 
शुचीनां श्रीमतां गेहे योगभ्रष्टोऽभिजायते
verses.english_translation: He who has fallen away from Yoga is born again in the house of the pure and prosperous after having attained to the worlds of doers ofgood deeds and dwelt there for many long years.

verses.original_text:
अथवा योगिनामेव कुले भवति धीमताम् । 
एतद्धि दुर्लभतरं लोके जन्म यदीदृशम्
verses.english_translation: Or he is born in a family of wise Yogins. But such a birth in this world is a rarer to get.

verses.original_text:
तत्र तं बुद्धिसंयोगं लभते पौर्वदेहिकम् । 
यतते च ततो भूयः संसिद्धौ कुरुनन्दन
verses.english_translation: There he regains the disposition of mind which he had in his former body, O Arjuna, and from there he strives much more for success inYoga.

verses.original_text:
पूर्वाभ्यासेन तेनैव ह्रियते ह्यवशोऽपि सः । 
जिज्ञासुरपि योगस्य शब्दब्रह्मातिवर्तते
verses.english_translation: By the power of his earlier practice, he is carried forward even against his will. Even though he is an Enquirer about Yoga, hetranscends the Sabda-brahman i.e., Prakrti or matter.

verses.original_text:
प्रयत्नाद्यतमानस्तु योगी संशुद्धकिल्बिषः । 
अनेकजन्मसंसिद्धस्ततो याति परां गतिम्
