verses.english_translation: But the Yogin striving earnestly, cleansed of all his stains, and perfected through many births, reaches the supreme state.

verses.original_text:
तपस्विभ्योऽधिको योगी ज्ञानिभ्योऽपि मतोऽधिकः । 
कर्मिभ्यश्चाधिको योगी तस्माद्योगी भवार्जुन
verses.english_translation: Greater than the austere, greater than those who possess knowledge, greater than the ritualists is the Yogin. There fore, O Arjuna, becomea Yogin.

verses.original_text:
योगिनामपि सर्वेषां मद्गतेनान्तरात्मना । 
श्रद्धावान्भजते यो मां स मे युक्ततमो मतः
verses.english_translation: He who with faith worships ME, whose inmost self is fixed in Me, I consider him as the greatest of the Yogins.

verses.original_text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच 
मय्यासक्तमनाः पार्थ योगं युञ्जन्मदाश्रयः । 
असंशयं समग्रं मां यथा ज्ञास्यसि तच्छृणु
verses.english_translation: The lord said; With your mind focussed on Me, having Me for your support andpracticing Yoga- how you can without doubt know me fully, hear O Arjuna.

verses.original_text:
ज्ञानं तेऽहं सविज्ञानमिदं वक्ष्याम्यशेषतः । 
यज्ज्ञात्वा नेह भूयोऽन्यज्ज्ञातव्यमवशिष्यते
verses.english_translation: I will declare to you full, this knowledge (of god) along with the knowledge which makes it distinguished (Vijnana) knowing whichnothing else remains to be known.

verses.original_text:
मनुष्याणां सहस्रेषु कश्चिद्यतति सिद्धये । 
यततामपि सिद्धानां कश्चिन्मां वेत्ति तत्त्वतः
verses.english_translation: Among thousands of men, some one strives for perfection; even among those who strive for perfection, some one only knows Me; and amongthose who know Me, some one only knows Me in reality.

verses.original_text:
भूमिरापोऽनलो वायुः खं मनो बुद्धिरेव च । 
अहङ्कार इतीयं मे भिन्ना प्रकृतिरष्टधा
verses.english_translation: Earth, water, fire, air, ether, manas, Buddhi and ego-sense- Thus My Prakrti is divided eightfold.

verses.original_text:
अपरेयमितस्त्वन्यां प्रकृतिं विद्धि मे पराम् । 
जीवभूतां महाबाहो ययेदं धार्यते जगत्
verses.english_translation: This is My lower Prakrti. But, O mighty-armed One, know that My higher nature is another. It is the life-principle (Jiva-bhuta), by whichthis universe is sustained.

verses.original_text:
एतद्योनीनि भूतानि सर्वाणीत्युपधारय । 
अहं कृत्स्नस्य जगतः प्रभवः प्रलयस्तथा
verses.english_translation: Know that all beings have these two for the source of their birth. Therefore, I am the origin and the dissolution of the whole universe.

verses.original_text:
मत्तः परतरं नान्यत्किञ्चिदस्ति धनञ्जय । 
मयि सर्वमिदं प्रोतं सूत्रे मणिगणा इव
verses.english_translation: There is nothing higher than myself, O Arjuna. All this is strung on Me as rows of gems on a thread.

verses.original_text:
रसोऽहमप्सु कौन्तेय प्रभास्मि शशिसूर्ययोः । 
प्रणवः सर्ववेदेषु शब्दः खे पौरुषं नृषु
verses.english_translation: I am the taste in the waters, O Arjuna! I am the light in the sun and the moon; the sacred Om in all the Vedas; sound in the ether, andmanhood in men am I.

verses.original_text:
पुण्यो गन्धः पृथिव्यां च तेजश्चास्मि विभावसौ । 
जीवनं सर्वभूतेषु तपश्चास्मि तपस्विषु
verses.english_translation: I am the pure smell in the earth; I am brilliance in the fire; I am the life-principle in all beings, and austerity in ascetics.

verses.original_text:
बीजं मां सर्वभूतानां विद्धि पार्थ सनातनम् । 
बुद्धिर्बुद्धिमतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम्
verses.english_translation: Know Me to be, O Arjuna, the primeval seed of all beings. I am the intelligence of the discerning, and the brilliance of the brilliant.

verses.original_text:
बलं बलवतां चाहं कामरागविवर्जितम् । 
धर्माविरुद्धो भूतेषु कामोऽस्मि भरतर्षभ
verses.english_translation: In the strong, I am strength, devoid of desire and passion. In all beings, I am the desire which is not forbidden by law (Dharma), OArjuna.

verses.original_text:
ये चैव सात्त्विका भावा राजसास्तामसाश्च ये । 
मत्त एवेति तान्विद्धि न त्वहं तेषु ते मयि
verses.english_translation: Know that all those states of Sattva, Rajas and Tamas are from Me alone. But I am not in them; they are in me.

verses.original_text:
त्रिभिर्गुणमयैर्भावैरेभिः सर्वमिदं जगत् । 
मोहितं नाभिजानाति मामेभ्यः परमव्ययम्
verses.english_translation: The entire universe is deluded by these three states originating from Gunas(of Prakrti), and fails to recognize Me, who am beyond themand immutable.

verses.original_text:
दैवी ह्येषा गुणमयी मम माया दुरत्यया । 
मामेव ये प्रपद्यन्ते मायामेतां तरन्ति ते
verses.english_translation: For this divine Maya of Mine consisting of the three Gunas (assumed for purpose of sport) is hard to overcome. But those who take refugein Me (Prapadyante) alone shall pass beyond the Maya.

verses.original_text:
न मां दुष्कृतिनो मूढाः प्रपद्यन्ते नराधमाः । 
माययापहृतज्ञाना आसुरं भावमाश्रिताः
verses.english_translation: The evil doers, the foolish, the lowest of men, those persons deprived of knowledge by delusion (Maya) and those who are dominated bydemoniac nature-they do not seek refuge in Me.

verses.original_text:
चतुर्विधा भजन्ते मां जनाः सुकृतिनोऽर्जुन । 
आर्तो जिज्ञासुरर्थार्थी ज्ञानी च भरतर्षभ
verses.english_translation: Four types of men of good deeds worship Me, O Arjuna, These are the distressed, the seekers after knowledge, the wealth-seekers, and themen of knowledge.

verses.original_text:
तेषां ज्ञानी नित्ययुक्त एकभक्तिर्विशिष्यते । 
प्रियो हि ज्ञानिनोऽत्यर्थमहं स च मम प्रियः
verses.english_translation: Of these, the man of knowledge, being ever with Me in Yoga and devoted to the One only, is the foremost; for I am very dear to theman of knowledge and he too is dear to Me.

verses.original_text:
उदाराः सर्व एवैते ज्ञानी त्वात्मैव मे मतम् । 
आस्थितः स हि युक्तात्मा मामेवानुत्तमां गतिम्
verses.english_translation: All these are indeed generous (udarah), but I deem the man of knowledge to be My very self; for he, integrated, is devoted to Mealone as the heights end.

verses.original_text:
बहूनां जन्मनामन्ते ज्ञानवान् मां प्रपद्यते । 
वासुदेवः सर्वमिति स महात्मा सुदुर्लभः
verses.english_translation: At the end of many births, the man of knowledge finds refuge in Me, realizing that 'Vasudeva is all.' It is very hard to find such agreat- souled person.

verses.original_text:
कामैस्तैस्तैर्हृतज्ञानाः प्रपद्यन्तेऽन्यदेवताः । 
तं तं नियममास्थाय प्रकृत्या नियताः स्वया
verses.english_translation: Controlled by their inherent nature, and deprived of knowledge by various desires, wordily-minded men resort to other gods, observingvarious disciplines.

verses.original_text:
यो यो यां यां तनुं भक्तः श्रद्धयार्चितुमिच्छति । 
तस्य तस्याचलां श्रद्धां तामेव विदधाम्यहम्
verses.english_translation: Whichever devotee seek to worship with faith whatever form, I make that very faith steadfast.

verses.original_text:
स तया श्रद्धया युक्तस्तस्या राधनमीहते । 
लभते च ततः कामान् मयैव विहितान्हि तान्
verses.english_translation: Endowed with that faith, he worships that form and thence gets the objects of his desire, granted in reality by Me alone.

verses.original_text:
अन्तवत्तु फलं तेषां तद्भवत्यल्पमेधसाम् । 
देवान्देवयजो यान्ति मद्भक्ता यान्ति मामपि
verses.english_translation: Bu limited is the fruit gained by these men of small understanding. The worshippers of the gods will go to the gods but My devotees willcome to Me.

verses.original_text:
अव्यक्तं व्यक्तिमापन्नं मन्यन्ते मामबुद्धयः । 
परम्भावमजानन्तो ममाव्ययमनुत्तमम्
verses.english_translation: Not knowing My higher nature, immutable and unsurpassed, the ignorant think of Me as an unmanifest entity who has now become manifest.

verses.original_text:
नाहं प्रकाशः सर्वस्य योगमायासमावृतः । 
मूढोऽयं नाभिजानाति लोको मामजमव्ययम्
verses.english_translation: Veiled by My Maya, I am not manifest to all. This deluded world does not recognize Me as the unborn and immutable.

verses.original_text:
वेदाहं समतीतानि वर्तमानानि चार्जुन । 
भविष्याणि च भूतानि मां तु वेद न कश्चन
verses.english_translation: I Know all beings, O Arjuna, past, present and those to come; but no one knows Me.

verses.original_text:
इच्छाद्वेषसमुत्थेन द्वन्द्वमोहेन भारत । 
सर्वभूतानि सम्मोहं सर्गे यान्ति परन्तप
verses.english_translation: By the delusion of the pairs of opposites springing from desire and hate, O Arjuna, all beings are deluded as soon as they are born.

verses.original_text:
येषां त्वन्तगतं पापं जनानां पुण्यकर्मणाम् । 
ते द्वन्द्वमोहनिर्मुक्ता भजन्ते मां दृढव्रताः
verses.english_translation: But the doers of good deeds, whose sins have come to an end, are freed from delusion of the pairs of opposites. They worship Me,steadfast in their vows.

verses.original_text:
जरामरणमोक्षाय मामाश्रित्य यतन्ति ये । 
ते ब्रह्म तद्विदुः कृत्स्नमध्यात्मं कर्म चाखिलम्
verses.english_translation: Those who take refuge in Me and strive for deliverance from old age and death, know Brahman (or the self) all about the nature of thatself, and the entire Karma (or activities leading to rebirth).

verses.original_text:
साधिभूताधिदैवं मां साधियज्ञं च ये विदुः । 
प्रयाणकालेऽपि च मां ते विदुर्युक्तचेतसः
verses.english_translation: And those who know Me with the Adhibhuta, Adhidaiva and the Adhiyajna they too, with their minds fixed in meditation, know Me even at thehour of death.

verses.original_text:
अर्जुन उवाच 
किं तद्ब्रह्म किमध्यात्मं किं कर्म पुरुषोत्तम । 
अधिभूतं च किं प्रोक्तमधिदैवं किमुच्यते
verses.english_translation: What is Brahman? What is Adhyatma? What is Karma? What is said to be Adhibhuta? O supreme Person, who is said to be Adhidaiva?

verses.original_text:
अधियज्ञः कथं कोऽत्र देहेऽस्मिन्मधुसूदन । 
प्रयाणकाले च कथं ज्ञेयोऽसि नियतात्मभिः
verses.english_translation: Who is Adhiyajna in this body, and how is he adhiyajna, O Krishna? and how are you to be known at the time of death by the self-controlled

verses.original_text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच 
अक्षरं ब्रह्म परमं स्वभावोऽध्यात्ममुच्यते ।
भूतभावोद्भवकरो विसर्गः कर्मसंज्ञितः
verses.english_translation: The lord said: The Brahman is the Aksara or the supreme and imperishable self. Nature(Svabhava) is spoken as that which dwells with the self. Karma is that creative forces which produces the organization of material beings.

verses.original_text:
अधिभूतं क्षरो भावः पुरुषश्चाधिदैवतम् । 
अधियज्ञोऽहमेवात्र देहे देहभृतां वर
verses.english_translation: Adhibhuta is perishable existence, O best of the embodied men; the Adhidaivata is the Purusa (individual self). I am the Adhyajna, herein the body.

verses.original_text:
अन्तकाले च मामेव स्मरन् मुक्त्वा कलेवरम् । 
यः प्रयाति स मद्भावं याति नास्त्यत्र संशयः
verses.english_translation: And he who, at the last moment, while leaving the body, departs, remembering Me alone, attains My being; of this there is no doubt.

verses.original_text:
यं यं वापि स्मरन्भावं त्यजत्यन्ते कलेवरम् ।
 तं तमेवैति कौन्तेय सदा तद्भावभावितः
verses.english_translation: Remembering whatsoever thought one abandons the body at the end, to that alone goes, O Arjuna, ever dwelling in the thought thereof.

verses.original_text:
तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु मामनुस्मर युध्य च । 
मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्मामेवैष्यस्यसंशयः
verses.english_translation: Therefore, remember Me at all times and fight; with your mind and intellect set upon Me, you shall surely come to Me.

verses.original_text:
अभ्यासयोगयुक्तेन चेतसा नान्यगामिना । 
परमं पुरुषं दिव्यं याति पार्थानुचिन्तयन्
verses.english_translation: Meditating with a mind trained by constant practice and not moving towards anything else, thinking of the Supreme Divine Person, onereaches Me, O Arjuna! 8.9 He who, at the time of death, remembers with devotion- witha mind unwavering by the power of Yoga and with Prana fixed between the eyebrows-, the Omniscient, the Primeval, the Ruler, one subtlerthan the subtle, the creator of all, whose nature is inconceivable, who is sun-colored, and who is beyond darkness, reaches that samedivine Supreme person.

verses.original_text:
कविं पुराणमनुशासितारम् अणोरणीयांसमनुस्मरेद्यः । 
सर्वस्य धातारमचिन्त्यरूपम् आदित्यवर्णं तमसः परस्तात्
verses.english_translation: He who, at the time of death, remembers with devotion- with a mind unwavering by the power of Yoga and with Prana fixed betweenthe eyebrows-, the Omniscient, the Primeval, the Ruler, one subtler than the subtle, the creator of all, whose nature is inconceivable,who is sun-colored, and who is beyond darkness, reaches that same divine Supreme person.

verses.original_text:
प्रयाणकाले मनसाचलेन भक्त्या युक्तो योगबलेन चैव । 
भ्रुवोर्मध्ये प्राणमावेश्य सम्यक् स तं परं पुरुषमुपैति दिव्यम्
verses.english_translation: He who, at the time of death, remembers with devotion- with a mind unwavering by the power of Yoga and with Prana fixed betweenthe eyebrows-, the Omniscient, the Primeval, the Ruler, one subtler than the subtle, the creator of all, whose nature is inconceivable,who is sun-colored, and who is beyond darkness, reaches that same divine Supreme person.

verses.original_text:
यदक्षरं वेदविदो वदन्ति विशन्ति यद्यतयो वीतरागाः । 
यदिच्छन्तो ब्रह्मचर्यं चरन्ति तत्ते पदं सङ्ग्रहेण प्रवक्ष्ये
verses.english_translation: I shall tell you briefly that goal, which the knowers of the Veda call the imperishable, which ascetics, free from passion, enter,and desiring which they practice the vow of continence(Brahmacarya).

verses.original_text:
सर्वद्वाराणि संयम्य मनो हृदि निरुध्य च । 
मूर्ध्न्याधायात्मनः प्राणमास्थितो योगधारणाम्
verses.english_translation: Who, controlling all the doors (senses), holding the mind within the heart, fixing his life-breath within the head, maintainshimself in steady concentration.

verses.original_text:
ओमित्येकाक्षरं ब्रह्म व्याहरन्मामनुस्मरन् । 
यः प्रयाति त्यजन्देहं स याति परमां गतिम्
verses.english_translation: Uttering the sacred syllable Om which connotes Brahman, thinking of Me constantly- one who abandons the body and departs, he reaches thehighest state.

verses.original_text:
अनन्यचेताः सततं यो मां स्मरति नित्यशः । 
तस्याहं सुलभः पार्थ नित्ययुक्तस्य योगिनः
verses.english_translation: I am easy of access, O Arjuna, to that Yogin who is ever integrated with Me, whose mind is not in anything else but Me and who ceaselesslyrecollects Me at all times.

verses.original_text:
मामुपेत्य पुनर्जन्म दुःखालयमशाश्वतम् । 
नाप्नुवन्ति महात्मानः संसिद्धिं परमां गताः
verses.english_translation: Having attained Me, great soulless are never again subject to birth which is transient and abode of sorrow. They have found the highestperfection.

verses.original_text:
आब्रह्मभुवनाल्लोकाः पुनरावर्तिनोऽर्जुन । 
मामुपेत्य तु कौन्तेय पुनर्जन्म न विद्यते
verses.english_translation: All the worlds, down from the realm of Brahma, are subject to return, O Arjuna. But on reaching Me there is no rebirth.

verses.original_text:
सहस्रयुगपर्यन्तमहर्यद्ब्रह्मणो विदुः । 
रात्रिं युगसहस्रान्तां तेऽहोरात्रविदो जनाः
verses.english_translation: Those who know the duration of the day and night understand a day of Brahma to last for a thousand Yugas, and a night of Brahman tolast for another thousand Yugas.

verses.original_text:
अव्यक्ताद्व्यक्तयः सर्वाः प्रभवन्त्यहरागमे ।
 रात्र्यागमे प्रलीयन्ते तत्रैवाव्यक्तसंज्ञके
verses.english_translation: All the manifested entities come forth from the unmanifest (Avvakta) at the coming of his night they are dissolved into the same whichis known also as the unmanifest.

verses.original_text:
भूतग्रामः स एवायं भूत्वा भूत्वा प्रलीयते । 
रात्र्यागमेऽवशः पार्थ प्रभवत्यहरागमे
verses.english_translation: The same multitude of beings come forth again and again irresistibly, and is dissolved at the coming of the night. And again it comes forthat the coming of the day.

verses.original_text:
परस्तस्मात्तु भावोऽन्योऽव्यक्तोऽव्यक्तात्सनातनः । 
यः स सर्वेषु भूतेषु नश्यत्सु न विनश्यति
verses.english_translation: There is however, another non-manifest being than this non-manifest entity, which is eternal; this is not destroyed when all entities aredestroyed.

verses.original_text:
अव्यक्तोऽक्षर इत्युक्तस्तमाहुः परमां गतिम् । 
यं प्राप्य न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम
verses.english_translation: This has been called unmanifest (Avyakta) and imperishable (Akshara). This they say, is the highest goal. This is My highest abode, reachingwhich the selves do not return to Samsara.

verses.original_text:
पुरुषः स परः पार्थ भक्त्या लभ्यस्त्वनन्यया । 
यस्यान्तःस्थानि भूतानि येन सर्वमिदं ततम्
verses.english_translation: But the Supreme Person in whom all beings abide and by whom all this is pervaded is to be attained by undivided devotion, O Arjuna.

verses.original_text:
यत्र काले त्वनावृत्तिमावृत्तिं चैव योगिनः । 
प्रयाता यान्ति तं कालं वक्ष्यामि भरतर्षभ
verses.english_translation: Now, I declare to you the time departing in which the Yogins do not return and also the time departing in which, they return, O Arjuna.

verses.original_text:
अग्निर्ज्योतिरहः शुक्लः षण्मासा उत्तरायणम् । 
तत्र प्रयाता गच्छन्ति ब्रह्म ब्रह्मविदो जनाः
verses.english_translation: Light in the form of fire, the day, the bright fortnight, the six months of the northern course of the sun- the knowers of Brahman whotake this path go to the Brahman.

verses.original_text:
धूमो रात्रिस्तथा कृष्णः षण्मासा दक्षिणायनम् । 
तत्र चान्द्रमसं ज्योतिर्योगी प्राप्य निवर्तते
verses.english_translation: Smoke, night, the dark fortnight, the six months of the southern course of the sun- the Yogin who take this path reaches the night ofthe moon and returns.

verses.original_text:
शुक्लकृष्णे गती ह्येते जगतः शाश्वते मते । 
एकया यात्यनावृत्तिमन्ययावर्तते पुनः
verses.english_translation: These two paths, the bright and the dark, are said to be eternal. By the former one, a man goes to the plane of no-return, by the other,he returns again.

verses.original_text:
नैते सृती पार्थ जानन्योगी मुह्यति कश्चन । 
तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु योगयुक्तो भवार्जुन
verses.english_translation: No Yogin who knows the two paths is ever deluded. Therefore, O Arjuna, be integrated with Yoga always.

verses.original_text:
वेदेषु यज्ञेषु तपःसु चैव दानेषु यत्पुण्यफलं प्रदिष्टम् । 
अत्येति तत्सर्वमिदं विदित्वा योगी परं स्थानमुपैति चाद्यम्
verses.english_translation: Whatever fruit of merit is prescribed for the study of the Vedas, for the performance of sacrifices, for the practice of austeritiesand gifts, all this does the Yogin transcended. Knowing this teaching of Mine, he reaches the supreme, primal abode.

verses.original_text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच 
इदं तु ते गुह्यतमं प्रवक्ष्याम्यनसूयवे । 
ज्ञानं विज्ञानसहितं यज्ज्ञात्वा मोक्ष्यसेऽशुभात्
verses.english_translation: The Lord said: I shall declare to you, who does not cavil, this most mysteriousknowledge together with special knowledge, knowing which you would be freed from evil.

verses.original_text:
राजविद्या राजगुह्यं पवित्रमिदमुत्तमम् । 
प्रत्यक्षावगमं धर्म्यं सुसुखं कर्तुमव्ययम्
verses.english_translation: This is the royal science, royal mystery, the supreme purifier, It is realized by direct experience. It is in accord with Dharma, it ispleasant to practice and is abiding.

verses.original_text:
अश्रद्दधानाः पुरुषा धर्मस्यास्य परन्तप । 
अप्राप्य मां निवर्तन्ते मृत्युसंसारवर्त्मनि
verses.english_translation: Men devoid of faith in this Dharma, O scorcher of foes, ever remain without attaining Me, in the mortal pathway of Samsara.

verses.original_text:
मया ततमिदं सर्वं जगदव्यक्तमूर्तिना । 
मत्स्थानि सर्वभूतानि न चाहं तेष्ववस्थितः
verses.english_translation: This entire universe is pervaded by Me, in an unmanifest from. All beings abide in Me, but I do not abide in them.

verses.original_text:
न च मत्स्थानि भूतानि पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम् । 
भूतभृन्न च भूतस्थो ममात्मा भूतभावनः
verses.english_translation: And Yet being do not abide in Me. Behold My Divine Yoga. I am the upholder of all beings and yet I am not in them. My will alonecauses their existence.

verses.original_text:
यथाकाशस्थितो नित्यं वायुः सर्वत्रगो महान् । 
तथा सर्वाणि भूतानि मत्स्थानीत्युपधारय
verses.english_translation: As the powerful element air moving everywhere ever remains in the ether, know that so too all being abide in Me.

verses.original_text:
सर्वभूतानि कौन्तेय प्रकृतिं यान्ति मामिकाम् । 
कल्पक्षये पुनस्तानि कल्पादौ विसृजाम्यहम्
verses.english_translation: All beings, O Arjuna, enter into My Prakrti at the end of a cycle of time. Again I send forth at the beginning of a cycle of time.

verses.original_text:
प्रकृतिं स्वामवष्टभ्य विसृजामि पुनः पुनः । 
भूतग्राममिमं कृत्स्नमवशं प्रकृतेर्वशात्
verses.english_translation: Controlling the Prakrti, which is My own, I send forth again and again this multitude of beings, helpless under the sway of Prakrti.

verses.original_text:
न च मां तानि कर्माणि निबध्नन्ति धनञ्जय । 
उदासीनवदासीनमसक्तं तेषु कर्मसु
verses.english_translation: But these actions do not bind Me, O Arjuna, for I remain detached from them like one unconcerned.

verses.original_text:
मयाध्यक्षेण प्रकृतिः सूयते सचराचरम् । 
हेतुनानेन कौन्तेय जगद्विपरिवर्तते
verses.english_translation: Under My supervision, Prakrti gives birth to all mobile and immobile entities. Because of this, O Arjuna, does the world revolve.

verses.original_text:
अवजानन्ति मां मूढा मानुषीं तनुमाश्रितम् । 
परं भावमजानन्तो मम भूतमहेश्वरम्
verses.english_translation: Fools disregard Me, dwelling in human form, not knowing My higher nature, as the Supreme Lord of all beings.

verses.original_text:
मोघाशा मोघकर्माणो मोघज्ञाना विचेतसः । 
राक्षसीमासुरीं चैव प्रकृतिं मोहिनीं श्रिताः
verses.english_translation: Senseless men entertain a nature which is deluding and akin to that of Raksasas (fiends) and Asuras (monsters). Their hopes are vain, actsare vain and knowledge is vain.

verses.original_text:
महात्मानस्तु मां पार्थ दैवीं प्रकृतिमाश्रिताः । 
भजन्त्यनन्यमनसो ज्ञात्वा भूतादिमव्ययम्
verses.english_translation: But the great-souled ones, O Arjuna, who are associated with My divine nature, worship Me with unwavering mind, knowing Me to be theimmutable source of beings.

verses.original_text:
सततं कीर्तयन्तो मां यतन्तश्च दृढव्रताः । 
नमस्यन्तश्च मां भक्त्या नित्ययुक्ता उपासते
verses.english_translation: aspiring for eternal communion with Me, they worship Me, always singing My praises, striving with steadfast resolution and bowing down to Me indevotion.

verses.original_text:
ज्ञानयज्ञेन चाप्यन्ये यजन्तो मामुपासते । 
एकत्वेन पृथक्त्वेन बहुधा विश्वतोमुखम्
verses.english_translation: Others, too, besides offering the sacrifice of knowledge, worship Me as One, who, characterized by diversity in numberless ways, ismultiformed (in My Cosmic aspect).

verses.original_text:
अहं क्रतुरहं यज्ञः स्वधाहमहमौषधम् । 
मन्त्रोऽहमहमेवाज्यमहमग्निरहं हुतम्
verses.english_translation: I am the Kratu. I am the sacrifice. I am offering to the manes. I am the Mantra. I am Myself the clarified butter. I am the fire. I amthe oblation.

verses.original_text:
पिताहमस्य जगतो माता धाता पितामहः । 
वेद्यं पवित्रमोंकार ऋक्साम यजुरेव च
verses.english_translation: I am the father, mother, creator and grandfather of the universe. I am the purifier. I am the syllable Om and also Rk, Saman and the Yajus.

verses.original_text:
गतिर्भर्ता प्रभुः साक्षी निवासः शरणं सुहृत् । 
प्रभवः प्रलयः स्थानं निधानं बीजमव्ययम्
verses.english_translation: I am the goal, supporter, the lord, the witness, the abode, the refuge and the friend. I am the seat of origin and dissolution, the base forpreservation and imperishable seed.

verses.original_text:
तपाम्यहमहं वर्षं निगृह्णाम्युत्सृजामि च । 
अमृतं चैव मृत्युश्च सदसच्चाहमर्जुन
verses.english_translation: I give heat. I hold back and send forth the rain. I am immortality as well as death, O Arjuna. I am the being, as also the non-being.

verses.original_text:
त्रैविद्या मां सोमपाः पूतपापाः यज्ञैरिष्ट्वा स्वर्गतिं प्रार्थयन्ते । 
ते पुण्यमासाद्य सुरेन्द्रलोकम् अश्नन्ति दिव्यान्दिवि देवभोगान्
verses.english_translation: Those who are versed in the Vedas, being purified from sin by drinking the Soma juice, pray for the passage to heaven and worship Meby sacrifices. Reaching the holy realm of the chief of the gods, they enjoy in heaven celestial pleasure of the gods.

verses.original_text:
ते तं भुक्त्वा स्वर्गलोकं विशालम् क्षीणे पुण्ये मर्त्यलोकं विशन्ति ।
 एवं त्रयीधर्म्यमनुप्रपन्नाः गतागतं कामकामा लभन्ते
verses.english_translation: Having enjoyed the spacious world of heaven, they return to the world of mortals when their merit is exhausted. Thus, those who follow theVedic rituals and are drawn by desires, come and go.

verses.original_text:
अनन्याश्चिन्तयन्तो मां ये जनाः पर्युपासते । 
तेषां नित्याभियुक्तानां योगक्षेमं वहाम्यहम्
verses.english_translation: There are those who, excluding all else, think of Me and worship Me aspiring after eternal union with Me. Their prosperity and welfare(Yoga and Kshema) are looked after by Me.

verses.original_text:
येऽप्यन्यदेवता भक्ता यजन्ते श्रद्धयान्विताः ।
 तेऽपि मामेव कौन्तेय यजन्त्यविधिपूर्वकम्
verses.english_translation: Even those who are devoted to other divinities with faith in their hearts, worship Me alone, O Arjuna, though not as sanctioned by theSastras.

verses.original_text:
अहम् हि सर्वयज्ञानाम् भोक्ता च प्रभुरेव च । 
न तु मामभिजानन्ति तत्त्वेनातश्च्यवन्ति ते
verses.english_translation: For, I am the only enjoyer and the only Lord of all sacrifices. They do not recognize Me in My nature; hence they fall.

verses.original_text:
यान्ति देवव्रता देवान्पितॄन् यान्ति पितृव्रताः । 
भूतानि यान्ति भूतेज्या यान्ति मद्याजिनोऽपि माम्
verses.english_translation: Devotees of gods go to the gods. The manes-worshippers go to the manes. The worshippers of Bhutas go to the Bhutas. And those whoworship Me come to Me.

verses.original_text:
पत्रं पुष्पं फलं तोयं यो मे भक्त्या प्रयच्छति । 
तदहं भक्त्युपहृतमश्नामि प्रयतात्मनः
verses.english_translation: Whoever offers Me with true devotion a leaf, a flower, a fruit or some water, I accept this offering made with devotion by him who ispure of heart.

verses.original_text:
यत्करोषि यदश्नासि यज्जुहोषि ददासि यत् । 
यत्तपस्यसि कौन्तेय तत्कुरुष्व मदर्पणम्
verses.english_translation: Whatsoever you do, whatsoever you eat, whatsoever you offer, whatsoever you give away, whatsoever austerity you practice, O Arjuna,do that as an offering to Me.

verses.original_text:
शुभाशुभफलैरेवं मोक्ष्यसे कर्मबन्धनैः । 
संन्यासयोगयुक्तात्मा विमुक्तो मामुपैष्यसि
verses.english_translation: Thus equipped in mind with the Yoga of renunciation, you will free yourself from the bonds of Karma, productive of auspicious as well asinauspicious fruits. Thus liberated, you will come to Me.

verses.original_text:
समोऽहं सर्वभूतेषु न मे द्वेष्योऽस्ति न प्रियः । 
ये भजन्ति तु मां भक्त्या मयि ते तेषु चाप्यहम्
verses.english_translation: I am the same to all creation. There is none hateful or dear to Me. But those who worship Me with devotion abide in me and I do abidein them.

verses.original_text:
अपि चेत्सुदुराचारो भजते मामनन्यभाक् । 
साधुरेव स मन्तव्यः सम्यग्व्यवसितो हि सः
verses.english_translation: If even the most sinful man worships Me with undivided devotion, he must be regarded as holy, for he has rightly resolved.

verses.original_text:
क्षिप्रं भवति धर्मात्मा शश्वच्छान्तिं निगच्छति । 
कौन्तेय प्रतिजानीहि न मे भक्तः प्रणश्यति
verses.english_translation: Quickly he becomes righteous and obtain everlasting peace. Affirm on My behalf, O Arjuna, My devotee never perishes.

verses.original_text:
मां हि पार्थ व्यपाश्रित्य येऽपि स्युः पापयोनयः । 
स्त्रियो वैश्यास्तथा शूद्रास्तेऽपि यान्ति परां गतिम्
verses.english_translation: By taking refuge in Me even men of evil birth, women, Vaisyas and also Sudras attain the supreme state.

verses.original_text:
किं पुनर्ब्राह्मणाः पुण्या भक्ता राजर्षयस्तथा । 
अनित्यमसुखं लोकमिमं प्राप्य भजस्व माम्
verses.english_translation: How much more then Brahmanas and royal sages who are pure and are My devotees! Having obtained this transient, joyless world, worship Me.

verses.original_text:
मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु । 
मामेवैष्यसि युक्त्वैवमात्मानं मत्परायणः
verses.english_translation: Focus your mind on Me, be My devotee, be my worshipper. Bow down to Me Engaging your mind in this manner and regarding Me as the Supreme goal,you will come to Me.

verses.original_text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच 
भूय एव महाबाहो शृणु मे परमं वचः । 
यत्तेऽहं प्रीयमाणाय वक्ष्यामि हितकाम्यया
verses.english_translation: The Lord said: Further, O Arjuna, listen to My Supreme word. Desirous of your good,I shall speak to you who love Me.

verses.original_text:
न मे विदुः सुरगणाः प्रभवं न महर्षयः । 
अहमादिर्हि देवानां महर्षीणां च सर्वशः
verses.english_translation: Neither the host of the gods nor the great seers know My power. indeed, I am the only source of the gods and of the great seers.

verses.original_text:
यो मामजमनादिं च वेत्ति लोकमहेश्वरम् । 
असम्मूढः स मर्त्येषु सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते
verses.english_translation: He who knows Me as unborn and without a beginning and the great Lord of the worlds- he among the mortal is undeluded and is releasedfrom every sin.

verses.original_text:
बुद्धिर्ज्ञानमसम्मोहः क्षमा सत्यं दमः शमः । 
सुखं दुःखं भवोऽभावो भयं चाभयमेव च
verses.english_translation: Intelligence, knowledge, non-delusion, forbearance truth, restraint, self-control, pleasure, pain, exaltation depression, fear andfearlessness;

verses.original_text:
अहिंसा समता तुष्टिस्तपो दानं यशोऽयशः । 
भवन्ति भावा भूतानां मत्त एव पृथग्विधाः
verses.english_translation: Non-violence, equality, cheerfulness, austerity, beneficence, fame and infamy- these different qualities of beings arise from Me alone.

verses.original_text:
महर्षयः सप्त पूर्वे चत्वारो मनवस्तथा । 
मद्भावा मानसा जाता येषां लोक इमाः प्रजाः
verses.english_translation: The seven great seers of yore and similarity the four Manus, all possessing My mental disposition, were born of My mind. All thesecreatures of the world are descended from them.

verses.original_text:
एतां विभूतिं योगं च मम यो वेत्ति तत्त्वतः । 
सोऽविकम्पेन योगेन युज्यते नात्र संशयः
verses.english_translation: He who in truth knows this supernal manifestation and splendour of auspicious attributes of mine, becomes, united with theunshakable Yoga of Bhakti. Of this, there is no doubt.

verses.original_text:
अहं सर्वस्य प्रभवो मत्तः सर्वं प्रवर्तते । 
इति मत्वा भजन्ते मां बुधा भावसमन्विताः
verses.english_translation: I am the origin of all; from Me proceed everything; thinking thus the wise worship Me with all devotion (Bhava).

verses.original_text:
मच्चित्ता मद्गतप्राणा बोधयन्तः परस्परम् । 
कथयन्तश्च मां नित्यं तुष्यन्ति च रमन्ति च
verses.english_translation: With their minds focussed on Me, with their Pranas centered in Me inspiring one another and always speaking of Me, they live incontentment and bliss at all times.

verses.original_text:
तेषां सततयुक्तानां भजतां प्रीतिपूर्वकम् । 
ददामि बुद्धियोगं तं येन मामुपयान्ति ते
verses.english_translation: To those, who are ceaselessly united with Me and who worship Me with immense love, I lovingly grant that mental disposition(Buddhi-yoga) by which they come to Me.

verses.original_text:
तेषामेवानुकम्पार्थमहमज्ञानजं तमः । 
नाशयाम्यात्मभावस्थो ज्ञानदीपेन भास्वता
verses.english_translation: Out of compassion for them alone, I, abiding in their mental activity as its object, dispel the darkness born of ignorance by thebrilliant lamp of knowledge. 10.12 You are Supreme Brahman, the Supreme Light, and the SupremeSanctifier, All the seers proclaim You as the eternal, divine Person, the Primal Lord, the unborn and all pervading. So also proclaim thedivine sages Narada, Asita. Devala and Vyasa. You Yourself also proclaim this.

verses.original_text:
अर्जुन उवाच 
परं ब्रह्म परं धाम पवित्रं परमं भवान् । 
पुरुषं शाश्वतं दिव्यमादिदेवमजं विभुम्
verses.english_translation: You are Supreme Brahman, the Supreme Light, and the Supreme Sanctifier, All the seers proclaim You as the eternal, divine Person,the Primal Lord, the unborn and all pervading. So also proclaim the divine sages Narada, Asita. Devala and Vyasa. You Yourself alsoproclaim this.

verses.original_text:
आहुस्त्वामृषयः सर्वे देवर्षिर्नारदस्तथा । 
असितो देवलो व्यासः स्वयं चैव ब्रवीषि मे
verses.english_translation: You are Supreme Brahman, the Supreme Light, and the Supreme Sanctifier, All the seers proclaim You as the eternal, divine Person,the Primal Lord, the unborn and all pervading. So also proclaim the divine sages Narada, Asita. Devala and Vyasa. You Yourself alsoproclaim this.

verses.original_text:
सर्वमेतदृतं मन्ये यन्मां वदसि केशव । 
न हि ते भगवन्व्यक्तिं विदुर्देवा न दानवाः
verses.english_translation: I deem as true all this that you say to Me, O Krishna. Verily O Lord, neither the gods nor the demons know Your manifestation.

verses.original_text:
स्वयमेवात्मनात्मानं वेत्थ त्वं पुरुषोत्तम । 
भूतभावन भूतेश देवदेव जगत्पते
verses.english_translation: O Supreme Person, O Creator of beings, O Lord of beings, O God of gods , O Ruler of the universe, You Yourself know Yourself byYourself.

verses.original_text:
वक्तुमर्हस्यशेषेण दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतयः । 
याभिर्विभूतिभिर्लोकानिमांस्त्वं व्याप्य तिष्ठसि
verses.english_translation: You should tell Me without reserve Your divine manifestations whereby You abide pervading all these worlds.

verses.original_text:
कथं विद्यामहं योगिंस्त्वां सदा परिचिन्तयन् । 
केषु केषु च भावेषु चिन्त्योऽसि भगवन्मया
verses.english_translation: How can I, Your devotee, know You by constantly meditating on You? And in what modes, O Lord, are you to be meditated upon Me.

verses.original_text:
विस्तरेणात्मनो योगं विभूतिं च जनार्दन । 
भूयः कथय तृप्तिर्हि शृण्वतो नास्ति मेऽमृतम्
verses.english_translation: Speak to me again in full, O Krishna, about Your attributes and glories. For I am not satiated by hearing Your ambrosial words.

verses.original_text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच 
हन्त ते कथयिष्यामि दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतयः । 
प्राधान्यतः कुरुश्रेष्ठ नास्त्यन्तो विस्तरस्य मे
verses.english_translation: The Lord said: Indeed I shall tell you, O Arjuna, My auspicious manifestations(Vibhutis)- those that are prominent among these. There is no end to their extent.

verses.original_text:
अहमात्मा गुडाकेश सर्वभूताशयस्थितः । 
अहमादिश्च मध्यं च भूतानामन्त एव च
verses.english_translation: I am the Self, O Arjuna, dwelling in the hearts of all beings. I am the beginning, the middle and the end of all beings.

verses.original_text:
आदित्यानामहं विष्णुर्ज्योतिषां रविरंशुमान् । 
मरीचिर्मरुतामस्मि नक्षत्राणामहं शशी
verses.english_translation: Of Adityas I am Vishnu, of luminous bodies I am the radiant sun. Of the Maruts I am Marici, and among constellation I am the moon.

verses.original_text:
वेदानां सामवेदोऽस्मि देवानामस्मि वासवः । 
इन्द्रियाणां मनश्चास्मि भूतानामस्मि चेतना
verses.english_translation: Of the Vedas I am Samaveda. Of gods, I am Indra. Of sense-organs I am the Manas(mind), and of living beings I am consciousness.

verses.original_text:
रुद्राणां शङ्करश्चास्मि वित्तेशो यक्षरक्षसाम् । 
वसूनां पावकश्चास्मि मेरुः शिखरिणामहम्
verses.english_translation: Of the Rudras I am Sankara. Of the Yaksas and Raksasas, I am the Lord of wealth (Kubera). Of the Vasus, I am Agni; of the mountains,I am Meru.

verses.original_text:
पुरोधसां च मुख्यं मां विद्धि पार्थ बृहस्पतिम् । 
सेनानीनामहं स्कन्दः सरसामस्मि सागरः
verses.english_translation: Among family priests, O Arjuna, know Me to be the chief Brahaspati. Of generals, I am Skanda. Of reservoirs of water, I am the ocean.

verses.original_text:
महर्षीणां भृगुरहं गिरामस्म्येकमक्षरम् । 
यज्ञानां जपयज्ञोऽस्मि स्थावराणां हिमालयः
verses.english_translation: Of the great seers, I am Bhrgu. Of words, I am the single-lettered word Om. Of sacrifices, I am the sacrifice of Japa. Of immovablethings I am the Himalayas.

verses.original_text:
अश्वत्थः सर्ववृक्षाणां देवर्षीणां च नारदः । 
गन्धर्वाणां चित्ररथः सिद्धानां कपिलो मुनिः
verses.english_translation: Of trees I am the Asvatha. Of celestial seers, I am Narada. Of the Gandharvas I am Chitraratha. Of the perfected, I am Kapila.

verses.original_text:
उच्चैःश्रवसमश्वानां विद्धि माममृतोद्भवम् । 
ऐरावतं गजेन्द्राणां नराणां च नराधिपम्
verses.english_translation: Of horses know Me to be Uccaishravas the nectar-born. Of lordly elephants, I am Airavata, and of men, I am the monarch.

verses.original_text:
आयुधानामहं वज्रं धेनूनामस्मि कामधुक् । 
प्रजनश्चास्मि कन्दर्पः सर्पाणामस्मि वासुकिः
verses.english_translation: Of weapons, I am Vajra (thunderbolt). Of cows, I am Kamadhuk. I am Kandarpa, the cause of progeny. Of serpents, I am Vasuki.

verses.original_text:
अनन्तश्चास्मि नागानां वरुणो यादसामहम् । 
पितॄणामर्यमा चास्मि यमः संयमतामहम्
verses.english_translation: Of snakes, I am Ananta. Of aquatic-beings I am Varuna. Of manes, I am Aryama. Of subduers, I am Yama.

verses.original_text:
प्रह्लादश्चास्मि दैत्यानां कालः कलयतामहम् । 
मृगाणां च मृगेन्द्रोऽहं वैनतेयश्च पक्षिणाम्
verses.english_translation: Of Daityas, I am Prahlada. Of reckoners, I am death. Of beasts, I am the lion, and of birds I am Garuda and the son of Vinata.

verses.original_text:
पवनः पवतामस्मि रामः शस्त्रभृतामहम् । 
झषाणां मकरश्चास्मि स्रोतसामस्मि जाह्नवी
verses.english_translation: Of moving things, I am the wind. Of those who bear weapons, I am Rama. Of fishes, I am Makara, and of rivers, I am Ganaga.

verses.original_text:
सर्गाणामादिरन्तश्च मध्यं चैवाहमर्जुन । 
अध्यात्मविद्या विद्यानां वादः प्रवदतामहम्
verses.english_translation: Of creatures, I am the beginning and the end, and also the middle, O Arjuna. Of science I am the science of self (of the individualand Universal Self). Of those who argue, I am the fair reasoning.

verses.original_text:
अक्षराणामकारोऽस्मि द्वन्द्वः सामासिकस्य च । 
अहमेवाक्षयः कालो धाताहं विश्वतोमुखः
verses.english_translation: Of letters, I am alphabet 'a'. Of compound words I am the Dvandva (copulative). I am Myself imperishable Time. I am the Creator, facingevery side.

verses.original_text:
मृत्युः सर्वहरश्चाहमुद्भवश्च भविष्यताम् । 
कीर्तिः श्रीर्वाक्च नारीणां स्मृतिर्मेधा धृतिः क्षमा ।।
बृहत्साम तथा साम्नां गायत्री छन्दसामहम् । 
मासानां मार्गशीर्षोऽहमृतूनाम् कुसुमाकरः
verses.english_translation: I am also death which snatches all away. I am the origin of all that shall be born. Among women, I am fame, prosperity, speech, memory, intelligence, endurance and forgiveness.

verses.original_text:
द्यूतं छलयतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम् । 
जयोऽस्मि व्यवसायोऽस्मि सत्त्वं सत्त्ववतामहम्
verses.english_translation: Of Saman hymns, I am the Brhatsaman. Of meters, I am the Gayatri. Of months, I am Margasirsa( Nov-Dec). And of seasons I am the seasonof flowers.

verses.original_text:
वृष्णीनां वासुदेवोऽस्मि पाण्डवानाम् धनञ्जयः । 
मुनीनामप्यहं व्यासः कवीनामुशना कविः
verses.english_translation: Of the fraudulent, I am gambling. I am the brilliance of the brilliant. I am victory, I am effort. I am the magnanimity ofthe magnanimous.

verses.original_text:
दण्डो दमयतामस्मि नीतिरस्मि जिगीषताम् । 
मौनं चैवास्मि गुह्यानां ज्ञानं ज्ञानवतामहम्
verses.english_translation: Of Vrsnis I am Vasudeva. Of Pandavas, I am Arjuna. Of sages I am Vyasa and of seers, I am Usana(Sukra).

verses.original_text:
यच्चापि सर्वभूतानां बीजं तदहमर्जुन । 
न तदस्ति विना यत्स्यान्मया भूतं चराचरम्
verses.english_translation: Of those that punish, I am the principle of punishment. Of these that seek victory, I am policy. Of secrets, I am also silence. And of thosewho are wise, I am wisdom.

verses.original_text:
नान्तोऽस्ति मम दिव्यानां विभूतीनां परन्तप । 
एष तूद्देशतः प्रोक्तो विभूतेर्विस्तरो मया
verses.english_translation: I am also that which is the seed of all beings, O Arjuna. Nothing that moves or does not move, exists without Me.

verses.original_text:
यद्यद्विभूतिमत्सत्त्वं श्रीमदूर्जितमेव वा । 
तत्तदेवावगच्छ त्वं मम तेजोंऽशसम्भवम्
verses.english_translation: There is no limit to My divine manifestations. Here the extent of such manifestations has been made in brief by Me.

verses.original_text:
अथवा बहुनैतेन किं ज्ञातेन तवार्जुन । 
विष्टभ्याहमिदं कृत्स्नमेकांशेन स्थितो जगत्
verses.english_translation: Whatever being is possessed of power, or of splendour, or of energy, know that as coming from fragment of my power.

verses.original_text:
अर्जुन उवाच 
मदनुग्रहाय परमं गुह्यमध्यात्मसञ्ज्ञितम् । 
यत्त्वयोक्तं वचस्तेन मोहोऽयं विगतो मम
verses.english_translation: Arjuna said; To show favor to me, You have told me that most profound mysteryconcerning the self; by that, this delusion of mine is dispelled.

verses.original_text:
भवाप्ययौ हि भूतानां श्रुतौ विस्तरशो मया । 
त्वत्तः कमलपत्राक्ष माहात्म्यमपि चाव्ययम्
verses.english_translation: The origination and dissolution of all beings, O Krishna,(as issuing from you) have been heard verily by me at length as also Yourimmutable greatness.

verses.original_text:
एवमेतद्यथात्थ त्वमात्मानम् परमेश्वर । 
द्रष्टुमिच्छामि ते रूपमैश्वरं पुरुषोत्तम
verses.english_translation: O Supreme Lord, how You described Yourself, even so are You. I wish to see Your Lordly form, O Supreme Person.

verses.original_text:
मन्यसे यदि तच्छक्यं मया द्रष्टुमिति प्रभो । 
योगेश्वर ततो मे त्वं दर्शयात्मानमव्ययम्
verses.english_translation: If you think, O Lord, that it can be seen by me, then O Lord of Yoga, reveal Yourself to me completely.

verses.original_text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच पश्य मे पार्थ रूपाणि शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः । 
नानाविधानि दिव्यानि नानावर्णाकृतीनि च
verses.english_translation: The lord said; Behold My forms, O Arjuna, hundreds upon thousands, manifold, divinevaried in hue and shape.

verses.original_text:
पश्यादित्यान्वसून्रुद्रानश्विनौ मरुतस्तथा । 
बहून्यदृष्टपूर्वाणि पश्याश्चर्याणि भारत
verses.english_translation: Behold the Adityas, the Vasus, the Rudras, the two Asvins and the Maruts. Behold, O Arjuna, many marvels never seen before.

verses.original_text:
इहैकस्थं जगत्कृत्स्नं पश्याद्य सचराचरम् । 
मम देहे गुडाकेश यच्चान्यद्द्रष्टुमिच्छसि
verses.english_translation: Behold here, O Arjuna, the whole universe with its mobile and immobile things centered in My body and whatever else you desireto see.

verses.original_text:
न तु मां शक्यसे द्रष्टुमनेनैव स्वचक्षुषा । 
दिव्यं ददामि ते चक्षुः पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम्
verses.english_translation: But you will not be able to see Me with your own eye. I give you a divine eye. Behold My Lordly Yoga!

verses.original_text:
सञ्जय उवाच 
एवमुक्त्वा ततो राजन् महायोगेश्वरो हरिः । 
दर्शयामास पार्थाय परमं रूपमैश्वरम्
verses.english_translation: Sanjaya said; Having spoken, O King, Sri Krishna, the great Lord of Yoga, thenrevealed to Arjuna the Supreme Lordly Form.

verses.original_text:
अनेकवक्त्रनयनमनेकाद्भुतदर्शनम् । 
अनेकदिव्याभरणं दिव्यानेकोद्यतायुधम्
verses.english_translation: With innumerable mouths and eyes, many marvelous aspects, many divine ornaments and many divine weapons.

verses.original_text:
दिव्यमाल्याम्बरधरं दिव्यगन्धानुलेपनम् । 
सर्वाश्चर्यमयं देवमनन्तं विश्वतोमुखम्
verses.english_translation: Wearing celestial garlands and raiments, anointed with divine perfumes, full of all wonders, resplendent, boundless and facingall directions.

verses.original_text:
दिवि सूर्यसहस्रस्य भवेद्युगपदुत्थिता । 
यदि भाः सदृशी सा स्याद्भासस्तस्य महात्मनः
verses.english_translation: If a thousand suns were to rise at once in the sky, the resulting splendour may be like the splendour of that mighty One.

verses.original_text:
तत्रैकस्थं जगत्कृत्स्नं प्रविभक्तमनेकधा । 
अपश्यद्देवदेवस्य शरीरे पाण्डवस्तदा
verses.english_translation: There (in that form) Arjuna beheld the whole universe, with its manifold divisions gathered together in one single spot within thebody of the God of gods.

verses.original_text:
ततः स विस्मयाविष्टो हृष्टरोमा धनञ्जयः । 
प्रणम्य शिरसा देवं कृताञ्जलिरभाषत
verses.english_translation: Then he , Arjuna, overcome with amazement, his hairs standing erect, bowed his head to the Lord, and with folded hands spoke.

verses.original_text:
अर्जुन उवाच 
पश्यामि देवांस्तव देव देहे सर्वांस्तथा भूतविशेषसङ्घान् । 
ब्रह्माणामीशं कमलासनस्थम् ऋषींश्च सर्वानुरगांश्च दिव्यान्
verses.english_translation: Arjuna said: I behold, O Lord, in Your body all the gods and all the diversehosts of beings, Brahma, Shiva (Isa) who is in Brahma, the seers and the lustrous snakes.

verses.original_text:
अनेकबाहूदरवक्त्रनेत्रम् पश्यामि त्वां सर्वतोऽनन्तरूपम् । 
नान्तं न मध्यं न पुनस्तवादिम् पश्यामि विश्वेश्वर विश्वरूप
verses.english_translation: With manifold arms, stomachs, mouths and eyes, I behold Your infinite form of all sides. I see no end, no middle nor thebeginning too of You, O Lord of the universe, O You of Universal form.

verses.original_text:
किरीटिनं गदिनं चक्रिणं च तेजोराशिं सर्वतोदीप्तिमन्तम् । 
पश्यामि त्वां दुर्निरीक्ष्यं समन्तात् दीप्तानलार्कद्युतिमप्रमेयम्
verses.english_translation: I behold You as a mass of light shining everywhere, with diadem, mace and discus, hard to behold, blazing like a burning fire andthe sun, and immeasurable.

verses.original_text:
त्वमक्षरं परमं वेदितव्यम् त्वमस्य विश्वस्य परं निधानम् । 
त्वमव्ययः शाश्वतधर्मगोप्ता सनातनस्त्वं पुरुषो मतो मे
verses.english_translation: You are the Imperishable, Supreme One to be realized. You are the Supreme Substratum of this universe. You are immutable, theguardian of the eternal law, I know You are the Supreme person who is everlasting.

verses.original_text:
अनादिमध्यान्तमनन्तवीर्यम् अनन्तबाहुं शशिसूर्यनेत्रम् । 
पश्यामि त्वां दीप्तहुताशवक्त्रम् स्वतेजसा विश्वमिदं तपन्तम्
verses.english_translation: I behold You as without beginning, middle and end. Your might is infinite. You are endowed with the endless number of arms. The sunand moon are Your eyes. Your mouth is emitting burning fire. With Your own radiance You are warming the whole universe.

verses.original_text:
द्यावापृथिव्योरिदमन्तरं हि व्याप्तं त्वयैकेन दिशश्च सर्वाः । 
दृष्ट्वाद्भुतं रूपमुग्रं तवेदम् लोकत्रयं प्रव्यथितं महात्मन्
verses.english_translation: You alone have pervaded the interspace between heaven and earth, and all the quarters. Beholding Your marvelous and terrible form,O mahatman, the three worlds are greatly overwhelmed with fear.

verses.original_text:
अमी हि त्वा सुरसङ्घा विशन्ति केचिद्भीताः प्राञ्जलयो गृणन्ति । 
स्वस्तीत्युक्त्वा महर्षिसिद्धसङ्घाः स्तुवन्ति त्वां स्तुतिभिः पुष्कलाभिः
verses.english_translation: Verily into You the hosts of Devas enter. Some in fear extol You with clasped hands. Crying 'Hail' the bands of great seers andSiddhas prasie You with meaningful hymns.

verses.original_text:
रुद्रादित्या वसवो ये च साध्याः विश्वेऽश्विनौ मरुतश्चोष्मपाश्च । 
गन्धर्वयक्षासुरसिद्धसङ्घाः वीक्षन्ते त्वां विस्मिताश्चैव सर्वे
verses.english_translation: The Rudras, the Aditya, the Vasus, the Sandhyas, the Visvas, the Asvins, the Maruts and the manes , and the hosts of Gandhrava,Yaksas, Asuras, and Siddhas- all gaze upon You in amazement.

verses.original_text:
रूपं महत्ते बहुवक्त्रनेत्रम् महाबाहो बहुबाहूरुपादम् । 
बहूदरं बहुदंष्ट्राकरालम् दृष्ट्वा लोकाः प्रव्यथितास्तथाहम्
verses.english_translation: Beholding Your great form with many mouths and eyes with many arms, thighs, and feet, with many stomachs and terrible with many teeth,the worlds tremble, and I too quake, O mighty-armed.

verses.original_text:
नभःस्पृशं दीप्तमनेकवर्णम् व्यात्ताननं दीप्तविशालनेत्रम् । 
दृष्ट्वा हि त्वां प्रव्यथितान्तरात्मा धृतिं न विन्दामि शमं च विष्णो
verses.english_translation: When I behold You touching the Supreme heaven, shining, multicolored with yawning mouths and large resplendent eyes, my inner beingtrembles in fear. I am unable to find support or peace, O Vishnu.

verses.original_text:
दंष्ट्राकरालानि च ते मुखानि दृष्ट्वैव कालानलसन्निभानि । 
दिशो न जाने न लभे च शर्म प्रसीद देवेश जगन्निवास
verses.english_translation: Viewing Your mouths, presenting awe-generating fangs and looking like the consuming fire of final destruction, I know not the quartersof the globe nor do I find repose. Be gracious, O Lord of the Devas! O Abode of the universe.

verses.original_text:
अमी च त्वां धृतराष्ट्रस्य पुत्राः सर्वे सहैवावनिपालसङ्घैः । 
भीष्मो द्रोणः सूतपुत्रस्तथासौ सहास्मदीयैरपि योधमुख्यैः
verses.english_translation: All these sons of Dhratarastra together with the hosts of monarchs , Bishma, Drona and Karna along with the leading warriors of ourside.

verses.original_text:
वक्त्राणि ते त्वरमाणा विशन्ति दंष्ट्राकरालानि भयानकानि । 
केचिद्विलग्ना दशनान्तरेषु सन्दृश्यन्ते चूर्णितैरुत्तमाङ्गैः
verses.english_translation: Hasten to enter Your fearful mouths with terrible fangs. Some, caught between the teeth are seen with their heads crushed to powder.

verses.original_text:
यथा नदीनां बहवोऽम्बुवेगाः समुद्रमेवाभिमुखा द्रवन्ति । 
तथा तवामी नरलोकवीराः विशन्ति वक्त्राण्यभिविज्वलन्ति
verses.english_translation: As many torrents of rivers flow towards the ocean, so do these heroes of the world of men enter Your flaming mouths.

verses.original_text:
यथा प्रदीप्तं ज्वलनं पतङ्गाः विशन्ति नाशाय समृद्धवेगाः । 
तथैव नाशाय विशन्ति लोकाः तवापि वक्त्राणि समृद्धवेगाः
verses.english_translation: As mouths rush swiftly into a blazing fire to their destruction, so do these men swiftly rush into Your mouths to meet their destruction.

verses.original_text:
लेलिह्यसे ग्रसमानः समन्तात् लोकान्समग्रान्वदनैर्ज्वलद्भिः । 
तेजोभिरापूर्य जगत्समग्रम् भासस्तवोग्राः प्रतपन्ति विष्णो
verses.english_translation: Devouring all the worlds on every side with your flaming mouths, You lick them up. Your fiery rays, filling the whole universe with theirradiance, scorch it, O Vishnu.

verses.original_text:
आख्याहि मे को भवानुग्ररूपो नमोस्तु ते देववर प्रसीद । 
विज्ञातुमिच्छामि भवन्तमाद्यम् न हि प्रजानामि तव प्रवृत्तिम्
verses.english_translation: Tell me who You are with this terrible form? Salutation to You, O Supreme God. Be gracious. I desire to know You, the Primal One.I do not know Your activity.

verses.original_text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच 
कालोऽस्मि लोकक्षयकृत्प्रवृद्धो लोकान्समाहर्तुमिह प्रवृत्तः । 
ऋतेऽपि त्वां न भविष्यन्ति सर्वे येऽवस्थिताः प्रत्यनीकेषु योधाः
verses.english_translation: The Lord said: I am the world-destroying Time. Manifesting Myself fully, I havebegun to destroy the worlds here. Even without You, none of the warriors arrayed in the hostile ranks shall survive.

verses.original_text:
तस्मात्त्वमुत्तिष्ठ यशो लभस्व जित्वा शत्रून्भुङ्क्ष्व राज्यं समृद्धम् । 
मयैवैते निहताः पूर्वमेव निमित्तमात्रं भव सव्यसाचिन्
verses.english_translation: Therefore arise, win glory. Conquering your foes, enjoy a prosperous kingdom. By me they have been slain already. You be merely aninstrument, O Arjuna, you great Bowman!

verses.original_text:
द्रोणं च भीष्मं च जयद्रथं च कर्णं तथान्यानपि योधवीरान् । 
मया हतांस्त्वं जहि मा व्यथिष्ठाः युध्यस्व जेतासि रणे सपत्नान्
verses.english_translation: Slay Drona, Bhishma, Jayadratha, Karna as well as other mighty warriors, who have been doomed by Me. Do not feel distressed.Fight. You shall conquer your rivals in the battle.

verses.original_text:
सञ्जय उवाच 
एतच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं केशवस्य कृताञ्जलिर्वेपमानः किरीटी । 
नमस्कृत्वा भूय एवाह कृष्णम् सगद्गदम् भीतभीतः प्रणम्य
verses.english_translation: Sanjaya said: Having heard this speech of Krishna, Arjuna did Him obeisance; andtrembling with awe, he bowed down again, and with folded palms and trembling, he spoke to Krishna in a choked voice.

verses.original_text:
अर्जुन उवाच 
स्थाने हृषीकेश तव प्रकीर्त्या जगत्प्रहृष्यत्यनुरज्यते च । 
रक्षांसि भीतानि दिशोद्रवन्ति सर्वे नमस्यन्ति च सिद्धसङ्घाः
verses.english_translation: Arjuna said: Rightly it is, O Krishna, that Your praise should move the world tojoy and love. The Raksasas flee in fear on all sides, and all the hosts of Siddhas bow down to You.

verses.original_text:
कस्माच्च ते न नमेरन् महात्मन् गरीयसे ब्रह्मणोऽप्यादिकर्त्रे । 
अनन्त देवेश जगन्निवास त्वमक्षरं सदसत्तत्परं यत्
verses.english_translation: And why should they not, O Mahatman, bow down to You who are great, being the first Creator, even of Brahma? O Infinite, Lord of gods,O You who have the universe for Your abode! You are the imperishable individual self, the existent and the non-existent, and that whichbeyond both.

verses.original_text:
त्वमादिदेवः पुरुषः पुराणः त्वमस्य विश्वस्य परं निधानम् । 
वेत्तासि वेद्यं च परं च धाम त्वया ततं विश्वमनन्तरूप
verses.english_translation: You are the Primal God and the Ancient Person. You are the Supreme resting place of the universe. You are the knower and that whichmust be known, and the Supreme abode. By You, O infinite of form, is this universe pervaded.

verses.original_text:
वायुर्यमोऽग्निर्वरुणः शशाङ्कः प्रजापतिस्त्वं प्रपितामहश्च । 
नमो नमस्तेऽस्तु सहस्रकृत्वः पुनश्च भूयोऽपि नमो नमस्ते
verses.english_translation: You are Vayu, Yama, Agni, Varuna, Sasanka, Prajapati and the great- grandsire..... Hail, Hail unto You, a thousand times! Hail unto You'again and yet again!

verses.original_text:
नमः पुरस्तादथ पृष्ठतस्ते नमोऽस्तु ते सर्वत एव सर्व । 
अनन्तवीर्यामितविक्रमस्त्वम् सर्वं समाप्नोषि ततोऽसि सर्वः
verses.english_translation: Salutation to you from before and behind! Salutation to You from all sides, O All!.. O You of infinite prowess and heroic actionwhich are measureless! You pervade all beings and therefore are all.

verses.original_text:
सखेति मत्वा प्रसभं यदुक्तम् हे कृष्ण हे यादव हे सखेति । 
अजानता महिमानं तवेदम् मया प्रमादात्प्रणयेन वापि
verses.english_translation: Unaware of this majesty of Yours, and either from negligence or love, or considering You to be a friend, whatever I have rudely said asO Krishna, O Yadava, O Comrade.

verses.original_text:
यच्चावहासार्थमसत्कृतोऽसि विहारशय्यासनभोजनेषु । 
एकोऽथवाप्यच्युत तत्समक्षम् तत्क्षामये त्वामहमप्रमेयम्
verses.english_translation: And whatever disrespect has been shown to you in jest, while playing resting, while sitting or eating, while alone or in the sight ofothers, O Acyuta- I implore You for forgiveness, You who are incomprehensible.

verses.original_text:
पितासि लोकस्य चराचरस्य त्वमस्य पूज्यश्च गुरुर्गरीयान् । 
न त्वत्समोऽस्त्यभ्यधिकः कुतोऽन्यो लोकत्रयेऽप्यप्रतिमप्रभाव
verses.english_translation: You are the father of the world, of all that moves and that does not move. You are its teacher and the one most worthy of reverence.There is none equal to You. How then could there be in the three worlds another greater than You, O being of matchless greatness.

verses.original_text:
तस्मात्प्रणम्य प्रणिधाय कायम् प्रसादये त्वामहमीशमीड्यम् । 
पितेव पुत्रस्य सखेव सख्युः प्रियः प्रियायार्हसि देव सोढुम्
verses.english_translation: Therefore, bowing down, prostrating the body, I implore Your mercy O adorable Lord. As a father bears his son or a friend with hisfriend, it is meet, O lord, that you, who are dear to me, should bear with me who am dear to You.

verses.original_text:
अदृष्टपूर्वं हृषितोऽस्मि दृष्ट्वा भयेन च प्रव्यथितम् मनो मे । 
तदेव मे दर्शय देव रूपम् प्रसीद देवेश जगन्निवास
verses.english_translation: Seeing what was never seen before, I am delighted. But my mind is also agog with awe. Show me, O Lord! Your other form. O Lord of thegods! Be gracious, O Abode of the universe!

verses.original_text:
किरीटिनं गदिनं चक्रहस्तम् इच्छामि त्वां द्रष्टुमहं तथैव । 
तेनैव रूपेण चतुर्भुजेन सहस्रबाहो भव विश्वमूर्ते
verses.english_translation: I wish to see You as before, with crown and with mace and discus in hand. Assume again that four-armed shape, O thou the thousand-armedof Universal Form!

verses.original_text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच 
मया प्रसन्नेन तवार्जुनेदम् रूपं परं दर्शितमात्मयोगात् । 
तेजोमयं विश्वमनन्तमाद्यम् यन्मे त्वदन्येन न दृष्टपूर्वम्
verses.english_translation: The Lord said: By My grace, O Arjuna, this Supreme Form, luminous, universal,infinite, primal, never seen before by anyone but you, has been revealed to you through My own free will.

verses.original_text:
न वेदयज्ञाध्ययनैर्न दानैः न च क्रियाभिर्न तपोभिरुग्रैः । 
एवंरूपः शक्य अहं नृलोके द्रष्टुं त्वदन्येन कुरुप्रवीर
verses.english_translation: Neither through the study of the Vedas, nor by sacrifices, nor by strict austerities can I be realized in a form like this in theworld of men by any one else but you, O Arjuna.

verses.original_text:
मा ते व्यथा मा च विमूढभावो दृष्ट्वा रूपं घोरमीदृङ्ममेदम् । 
व्यपेतभीः प्रीतमनाः पुनस्त्वम् तदेव मे रूपमिदम् प्रपश्य
verses.english_translation: You need not fear any more, nor be perplexed, looking on this awesome form of Mine. Free from fear and with a gladdened heart, behold againthat other form of Mine.

verses.original_text:
सञ्जय उवाच 
इत्यर्जुनं वासुदेवस्तथोक्त्वा स्वकं रूपं दर्शयामास भूयः । 
आश्वासयामास च भीतमेनम् भूत्वा पुनः सौम्यवपुर्महात्मा
verses.english_translation: Sanjaya said: Having spoken thus to Arjuna. Sri Krishna revealed to him once morehis own form. The mahatman assuming again a benign form, reassured him who had been struck with awe.

verses.original_text:
अर्जुन उवाच 
दृष्ट्वेदं मानुषं रूपं तव सौम्यं जनार्दन । 
इदानीमस्मि संवृत्तः सचेताः प्रकृतिं गतः
verses.english_translation: Arjuna said; having beheld the human and pleasing form of Yours, O Krishna, Ihave now become composed in mind and I am restored to my normal nature.

verses.original_text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच 
सुदुर्दर्शमिदं रूपं दृष्टवानसि यन्मम । 
देवा अप्यस्य रूपस्य नित्यं दर्शनकाङ्क्षिणः ।।
नाहं वेदैर्न तपसा न दानेन न चेज्यया । 
शक्य एवंविधो द्रष्टुं दृष्टवानसि मां यथा
verses.english_translation: It is very hard to behold this form of Mine which you have seen. Even the gods ever long to behold this form.

verses.original_text:
भक्त्या त्वनन्यया शक्य अहमेवंविधोऽर्जुन । 
ज्ञातुं द्रष्टुं च तत्त्वेन प्रवेष्टुं च परन्तप
verses.english_translation: Not by the Vedas, nor by austerities, nor by gifts, nor by sacrifice, can I be seen in such a form as You have seen me.

verses.original_text:
मत्कर्मकृन्मत्परमो मद्भक्तः सङ्गवर्जितः । 
निर्वैरः सर्वभूतेषु यः स मामेति पाण्डव
verses.english_translation: But by single -minded devotion, O Arjuna, it is possible to truly know, to see and to enter into Me, who am of this form,O harasser of the foes.

verses.original_text:
अर्जुन उवाच 
एवं सततयुक्ता ये भक्तास्त्वां पर्युपासते । 
ये चाप्यक्षरमव्यक्तं तेषां के योगवित्तमाः
verses.english_translation: Those devotees, who, ever integrated, thus meditate on You, and those again, who meditate on the Imperishable and the Unmanifest- whichof these have greater knowledge of Yoga?

verses.original_text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच 
मय्यावेश्य मनो ये मां नित्ययुक्ता उपासते । 
श्रद्धया परयोपेतास्ते मे युक्ततमा मताः
verses.english_translation: Those who, ever integrated with Me and possessed of supreme faith worship Me, focusing their minds on Me- these are considered by Methe highest among the Yogins.

verses.original_text:
ये त्वक्षरमनिर्देश्यमव्यक्तं पर्युपासते । 
सर्वत्रगमचिन्त्यं च कूटस्थमचलं ध्रुवम्
verses.english_translation: But those who meditate on the Imperishable (i.e., the self)the indefinable, the unmanifest, omnipresent, unthinkable, common to allbeings, immovable and constant.

verses.original_text:
सन्नियम्येन्द्रियग्रामं सर्वत्र समबुद्धयः । 
ते प्राप्नुवन्ति मामेव सर्वभूतहिते रताः
verses.english_translation: Having subdued all the senses, being even-minded engaged in the welfare of all beings- they too come to Me only .

verses.original_text:
क्लेशोऽधिकतरस्तेषामव्यक्तासक्तचेतसाम् । 
अव्यक्ता हि गतिर्दुःखं देहवद्भिरवाप्यते
verses.english_translation: Greater is the difficulty of those whose minds are thus attached to the unmanifest. For the way of the unmanifest is hard to reach byembodied beings.

verses.original_text:
ये तु सर्वाणि कर्माणि मयि सन्न्यस्य मत्पराः । 
अनन्येनैव योगेन मां ध्यायन्त उपासते
verses.english_translation: For those who dedicate all actions to Me, hold Me as their supreme goal, intent on Me, and worship Me meditating on Me with exclusivedevotion;

verses.original_text:
तेषामहं समुद्धर्ता मृत्युसंसारसागरात् । 
भवामि न चिरात् पार्थ मय्यावेशितचेतसाम्
verses.english_translation: Of those whose minds are thus focused on Me, I become soon their savior from the ocean of mortal life.

verses.original_text:
मय्येव मन आधत्स्व मयि बुद्धिं निवेशय । 
निवसिष्यसि मय्येव अत ऊर्ध्वं न संशयः
verses.english_translation: Focus on me alone; and let your Buddhi enter into Me. Then, you will live in Me alone; there is no doubt.

verses.original_text:
अथ चित्तं समाधातुं न शक्नोषि मयि स्थिरम् । 
अभ्यासयोगेन ततो मामिच्छाप्तुं धनञ्जय
verses.english_translation: If now you are unable to focus you mind on Me, then seek to reach Me, O Arjuna, by the practice or repetition.

verses.original_text:
अभ्यासेऽप्यसमर्थोऽसि मत्कर्मपरमो भव । 
मदर्थमपि कर्माणि कुर्वन्सिद्धिमवाप्स्यसि
verses.english_translation: If you are incapable of even this practice of repetition, then devote yourself to My deeds (service). For even by working for Mysake, you will attain perfection.

verses.original_text:
अथैतदप्यशक्तोऽसि कर्तुं मद्योगमाश्रितः । 
सर्वकर्मफलत्यागं ततः कुरु यतात्मवान्
verses.english_translation: If you are unable to do even this, i.e., taking refuge in My Yoga, then, with your self controlled, renounce the fruits of everyaction.

verses.original_text:
श्रेयो हि ज्ञानमभ्यासाज्ज्ञानाद्ध्यानं विशिष्यते । 
ध्यानात्कर्मफलत्यागस्त्यागाच्छान्तिरनन्तरम्
verses.english_translation: Far better is knowledge of the self than the repeated practice (of remembrance of the Lord). Better is meditation than thisknowledge; Better is renunciation of fruits of action than meditation. From such renunciation, peace ensues.

verses.original_text:
अद्वेष्टा सर्वभूतानां मैत्रः करुण एव च । 
निर्ममो निरहङ्कारः समदुःखसुखः क्षमी
verses.english_translation: He who never hates any being, who is friendly and compassionate, who is free from feelings of I and mine, who looks upon all pain andpleasure the same as and who is enduring;

verses.original_text:
सन्तुष्टः सततं योगी यतात्मा दृढनिश्चयः । 
मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्यो मद्भक्तः स मे प्रियः
verses.english_translation: He who is content, who ever meditates and is self-restrained and who is firm in his convictions, who has his mind and reason dedicated toMe- he is dear to Me.

verses.original_text:
यस्मान्नोद्विजते लोको लोकान्नोद्विजते च यः । 
हर्षामर्षभयोद्वेगैर्मुक्तो यः स च मे प्रियः
verses.english_translation: He from whom the world has no cause to be frightened, who is not frightened by the world, who is free from joy and impatience, fear andrepulsion- he is dear to me.

verses.original_text:
अनपेक्षः शुचिर्दक्ष उदासीनो गतव्यथः । 
सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी यो मद्भक्तः स मे प्रियः
verses.english_translation: He who is free from desires, who is pure, expert, indifferent and free from agony, who has renounced every undertaking- he is dear to Me.

verses.original_text:
यो न हृष्यति न द्वेष्टि न शोचति न काङ्क्षति । 
शुभाशुभपरित्यागी भक्तिमान्यः स मे प्रियः
verses.english_translation: He who rejoices not, nor hates, nor grieves, nor desires, who renounces good and evil, who is full of devotion to me- dear to meis such a devotee.

verses.original_text:
समः शत्रौ च मित्रे च तथा मानापमानयोः । 
शीतोष्णसुखदुःखेषु समः सङ्गविवर्जितः
verses.english_translation: He who is same to foe and friend, honor and dishonor, who is alike to both cold and heat, pleasure and pain, and who is free from allattachments;

verses.original_text:
तुल्यनिन्दास्तुतिर्मौनी सन्तुष्टो येन केनचित् । 
अनिकेतः स्थिरमतिर्भक्तिमान्मे प्रियो नरः
verses.english_translation: He who regards alike both blame and praise, who is silent and content with any lot, who has no home, who is firm of mind, and who isdevoted to Me- dear to Me is such a man.

verses.original_text:
ये तु धर्म्यामृतमिदं यथोक्तम् पर्युपासते । 
श्रद्दधाना मत्परमा भक्तास्तेऽतीव मे प्रियाः
verses.english_translation: But those devotees who follow this nectar of virtuous duty as taught above, who are full of faith and who regard Me as the Supreme- theyare exceedingly dear to Me.

verses.original_text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच 
इदं शरीरं कौन्तेय क्षेत्रमित्यभिधीयते । 
एतद्यो वेत्ति तं प्राहुः क्षेत्रज्ञ इति तद्विदः
verses.english_translation: The Lord said: This body, O Arjuna, is called the Field, Ksetra. He who knows it iscalled Field-knower, Ksetrajna, by those who know the self.

verses.original_text:
क्षेत्रज्ञं चापि मां विद्धि सर्वक्षेत्रेषु भारत । 
क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोर्ज्ञानं यत्तज्ज्ञानं मतं मम
verses.english_translation: And know Me also as the Field-knower in all Fields, O Arjuna. The Knowledge of the field and its Knower is , in My view, the trueknowledge.

verses.original_text:
तत्क्षेत्रं यच्च यादृक्च यद्विकारि यतश्च यत् । 
स च यो यत्प्रभावश्च तत्समासेन मे शृणु
verses.english_translation: Listen briefly from Me what the Field is, and what it is like, what its modifications are, what purpose it serves, what it is; and whothe self is and what Its power are.

verses.original_text:
ऋषिभिर्बहुधा गीतं छन्दोभिर्विविधैः पृथक् । 
ब्रह्मसूत्रपदैश्चैव हेतुमद्भिर्विनिश्चितैः
verses.english_translation: It has been sung by seers in various ways, in various distinctive hymns, and also in the well-reasoned and conclusive words of theBrahma-sutras.

verses.original_text:
महाभूतान्यहङ्कारो बुद्धिरव्यक्तमेव च । 
इन्द्रियाणि दशैकं च पञ्च चेन्द्रियगोचराः
verses.english_translation: The great elements, the Ahnkara, the Buddhi, the Avyakta, the ten senses and the one, besides, the five objects of the senses;

verses.original_text:
इच्छा द्वेषः सुखं दुःखं सङ्घातश्चेतना धृतिः । 
एतत्क्षेत्रं समासेन सविकारमुदाहृतम्
verses.english_translation: Desire, hatred, pleasure and pain and the combination that constitutes the basis of consciousness (or the individual self). Thusthis Ksetra has been briefly described with its modifications.

verses.original_text:
अमानित्वमदम्भित्वमहिंसा क्षान्तिरार्जवम् । 
आचार्योपासनं शौचं स्थैर्यमात्मविनिग्रहः
verses.english_translation: Modesty, absence of ostentation, non-injury, patience, sincerity, service of the preceptor, purity, firmness and self-restraint;

verses.original_text:
इन्द्रियार्थेषु वैराग्यमनहङ्कार एव च । 
जन्ममृत्युजराव्याधिदुःखदोषानुदर्शनम्
verses.english_translation: Absence of desire with regard to sense-objects, and also absence of egotism, the perception of evil in birth, death, old age, diseaseand sorrow;

verses.original_text:
असक्तिरनभिष्वङ्गः पुत्रदारगृहादिषु । 
नित्यं च समचित्तत्वमिष्टानिष्टोपपत्तिषु
verses.english_translation: Non-attachment, absence of clinging to son, wife, home and the like, and constant even-mindedness to all desirable and undesirable events;

verses.original_text:
मयि चानन्ययोगेन भक्तिरव्यभिचारिणी । 
विविक्तदेशसेवित्वमरतिर्जनसंसदि
verses.english_translation: Constant devotion directed to Me alone, resort to solitary places and dislike for crowds;

verses.original_text:
अध्यात्मज्ञाननित्यत्वं तत्त्वज्ञानार्थदर्शनम् । 
एतज्ज्ञानमिति प्रोक्तमज्ञानं यदतोऽन्यथा
verses.english_translation: Constant contemplation on the knowledge pertaining to the self, reflection for the attainment of knowledge of the truth- this isdeclared to be knowledge, and what is contrary to it is ignorance.

verses.original_text:
ज्ञेयं यत्तत्प्रवक्ष्यामि यज्ज्ञात्वामृतमश्नुते । 
अनादिमत्परं ब्रह्म न सत्तन्नासदुच्यते
verses.english_translation: I shall declare that which is to be known, knowing which one attains the immortal self. It is beginning less Brahman having Me for theHighest (Anadi matparam); it is said to be neither being nor non-being.

verses.original_text:
सर्वतःपाणिपादं तत्सर्वतोऽक्षिशिरोमुखम् । 
सर्वतःश्रुतिमल्लोके सर्वमावृत्य तिष्ठति
verses.english_translation: Everywhere are Its hands and feet; Its eyes, heads and mouths are everywhere; Its ears are on all sides; and It exists encompassingall things.

verses.original_text:
सर्वेन्द्रियगुणाभासं सर्वेन्द्रियविवर्जितम् । 
असक्तं सर्वभृच्चैव निर्गुणं गुणभोक्तृ च
verses.english_translation: Shining by the functions of the senses, and yet devoid of the sense, detached and yet supporting all, devoid of Gunas and yet experiencingthe Gunas;

verses.original_text:
बहिरन्तश्च भूतानामचरं चरमेव च । 
सूक्ष्मत्वात्तदविज्ञेयं दूरस्थं चान्तिके च तत्
verses.english_translation: It is within and without all beings; It is unmoving and yet moving It is so subtle that none can comprehend It; It is far away, and yetIt is very near.

verses.original_text:
अविभक्तं च भूतेषु विभक्तमिव च स्थितम् । 
भूतभर्तृ च तज्ज्ञेयं ग्रसिष्णु प्रभविष्णु च
verses.english_translation: Undivided and yet remaining as if divided among beings, this self is to be known as the supporter of elements. It devours them and causesgeneration.

verses.original_text:
ज्योतिषामपि तज्ज्योतिस्तमसः परमुच्यते । 
ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं ज्ञानगम्यं हृदि सर्वस्य विष्ठितम्
verses.english_translation: The light of all lights, this is said to be beyond Tamas(darkness). It is known to be knowledge. It is to be attained by knowledge.It is present in the heart of all.

verses.original_text:
इति क्षेत्रं तथा ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं चोक्तं समासतः । 
मद्भक्त एतद्विज्ञाय मद्भावायोपपद्यते
verses.english_translation: Thus the Ksetra, knowledge and the object of knowledge have been briefly set forth. On knowing this, My devotee becomes fit to attainMy state of being.

verses.original_text:
प्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव विद्ध्यनादी उभावपि । 
विकारांश्च गुणांश्चैव विद्धि प्रकृतिसम्भवान्
verses.english_translation: Know that both Prakrti and the self (Purusa) are without beginning; know that all modifications and the attributes are born of Prakrti.

verses.original_text:
कार्यकरणकर्तृत्वे हेतुः प्रकृतिरुच्यते । 
पुरुषः सुखदुःखानां भोक्तृत्वे हेतुरुच्यते
verses.english_translation: The Prakrti is said to be the cause of agency to the body (Karya) and sense-organs (Karna). The self is said to be the cause ofexperiencing pleasure and pain.

verses.original_text:
पुरुषः प्रकृतिस्थो हि भुङ्क्ते प्रकृतिजान्गुणान् । 
कारणं गुणसङ्गोऽस्य सदसद्योनिजन्मसु
verses.english_translation: Indeed, the self seated in Prakrti experiences the Gunas born of Prakrti... Its attachment to these Gunas is the cause of birthin good and evil wombs.

verses.original_text:
उपद्रष्टानुमन्ता च भर्ता भोक्ता महेश्वरः । 
परमात्मेति चाप्युक्तो देहेऽस्मिन्पुरुषः परः
verses.english_translation: The self in the body is called spectator, approver, supporter, experiencer, the great lord and also the supreme self in the body.

verses.original_text:
य एवं वेत्ति पुरुषं प्रकृतिं च गुणैः सह । 
सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि न स भूयोऽभिजायते
verses.english_translation: He who understands the self and the Prakrti thus with the Gunas is not born again, in whatever state he may be placed.

verses.original_text:
ध्यानेनात्मनि पश्यन्ति केचिदात्मानमात्मना । 
अन्ये साङ्ख्येन योगेन कर्मयोगेन चापरे
verses.english_translation: Some perceive the self within the self (body) by meditation by the self(mind), others by Sankhya Yoga, and still others by KarmaYoga.

verses.original_text:
अन्ये त्वेवमजानन्तः श्रुत्वान्येभ्य उपासते । 
तेऽपि चातितरन्त्येव मृत्युं श्रुतिपरायणाः
verses.english_translation: But some, who do not know thus, having heard from others, worship accordingly- these too, who are devoted to what they hear, passbeyond death.

verses.original_text:
यावत्सञ्जायते किञ्चित्सत्त्वं स्थावरजङ्गमम् । 
क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञसंयोगात्तद्विद्धि भरतर्षभ
verses.english_translation: Whatever being is born, whether it is moving or stationary, know, O Arjuna, that it is through the combination of the Ksetra(body)and Ksetrajna (knower of the Field).

verses.original_text:
समं सर्वेषु भूतेषु तिष्ठन्तं परमेश्वरम् । 
विनश्यत्स्वविनश्यन्तं यः पश्यति स पश्यति
verses.english_translation: Who sees the supreme ruler dwelling alike in all bodies and never perishing when they perish, he sees indeed.

verses.original_text:
समं पश्यन्हि सर्वत्र समवस्थितमीश्वरम् । 
न हिनस्त्यात्मनात्मानं ततो याति परां गतिम्
verses.english_translation: For seeing the ruler (i.e., self) abiding alike in every place, he does not injure the self by the self(mind) and therefore reachesthe highest goal.

verses.original_text:
प्रकृत्यैव च कर्माणि क्रियमाणानि सर्वशः । 
यः पश्यति तथात्मानमकर्तारं स पश्यति
verses.english_translation: He who sees that all the acts are done universally by Prakrti alone and likewise that the self is not the doer, he sees indeed.

verses.original_text:
यदा भूतपृथग्भावमेकस्थमनुपश्यति । 
तत एव च विस्तारं ब्रह्म सम्पद्यते तदा
verses.english_translation: When he perceive the independent modes of existence of all beings centered in one, and as also their expansion from It alone,then he attains to Brahman.

verses.original_text:
अनादित्वान्निर्गुणत्वात्परमात्मायमव्ययः । 
शरीरस्थोऽपि कौन्तेय न करोति न लिप्यते
verses.english_translation: This supreme self, though dwelling in the body, is immutable, O Arjuna, being without beginning. It neither acts nor is tainted,as It is without Gunas.

verses.original_text:
यथा सर्वगतं सौक्ष्म्यादाकाशं नोपलिप्यते । 
सर्वत्रावस्थितो देहे तथात्मा नोपलिप्यते
verses.english_translation: As the all pervading ether is not tainted because of its subtlety, even so, the self abiding in the body everywhere, is not tainted.

verses.original_text:
यथा प्रकाशयत्येकः कृत्स्नं लोकमिमं रविः । 
क्षेत्रं क्षेत्री तथा कृत्स्नम् प्रकाशयति भारत
verses.english_translation: As the one sun illuminates this whole world, so does the Knower of the Field (Ksetrin, the self), O Arjuna, illumine the wholeField (the body).

verses.original_text:
क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोरेवमन्तरं ज्ञानचक्षुषा । 
भूतप्रकृतिमोक्षं च ये विदुर्यान्ति ते परम्
verses.english_translation: Those who thus discern with the eye of knowledge the difference between the body or the Field(Ksetra) and the knower of the bodyor Field-knower (Ksetranjna), and the means of deliverance from the manifested Prakrti- they attain the Supreme.

verses.original_text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच 
परं भूयः प्रवक्ष्यामि ज्ञानानां ज्ञानमुत्तमम् । 
यज्ज्ञात्वा मुनयः सर्वे परां सिद्धिमितो गताः
verses.english_translation: The lord said: I shall declare again another kind knowledge; It is the best of allforms of knowledge, by knowing which all the sages have attained the state of perfection beyond this world.

verses.original_text:
इदं ज्ञानमुपाश्रित्य मम साधर्म्यमागताः । 
सर्गेऽपि नोपजायन्ते प्रलये न व्यथन्ति च
verses.english_translation: Resorting to this knowledge, partaking of My nature, they are not born at the time of creation, nor do they suffer at the time of dissolution

verses.original_text:
मम योनिर्महद्ब्रह्म तस्मिन्गर्भं दधाम्यहम् । 
सम्भवः सर्वभूतानां ततो भवति भारत
verses.english_translation: My womb is the greatest Brahman ( i.e., Prakrti) In that I lay the germ. From that, O Arjuna, is the birth of all beings.

verses.original_text:
सर्वयोनिषु कौन्तेय मूर्तयः सम्भवन्ति याः ।
 तासां ब्रह्म महद्योनिरहं बीजप्रदः पिता
verses.english_translation: Whatever forms are produced in any womb, O Arjuna, the Prakrti is their great womb and I am the sowing father.

verses.original_text:
सत्त्वं रजस्तम इति गुणाः प्रकृतिसम्भवाः ।
 निबध्नन्ति महाबाहो देहे देहिनमव्ययम्
verses.english_translation: Sattva, Rajas and Tamas are the Gunas that arise from the Prakrti They bind the immutable self in the body, O Arjuna.

verses.original_text:
तत्र सत्त्वं निर्मलत्वात्प्रकाशकमनामयम् । 
सुखसङ्गेन बध्नाति ज्ञानसङ्गेन चानघ
verses.english_translation: Of these, Sattva, being without impurity, is luminous and free from morbidity. It binds, O Arjuna, by attachment to pleasure and toknowledge.

verses.original_text:
रजो रागात्मकं विद्धि तृष्णासङ्गसमुद्भवम् । 
तन्निबध्नाति कौन्तेय कर्मसङ्गेन देहिनम्
verses.english_translation: Know, O Arjuna, that Rajas is of the nature of passion springing from thirst and attachment. It binds the embodied self with attachmentto work.

verses.original_text:
तमस्त्वज्ञानजं विद्धि मोहनं सर्वदेहिनाम् । 
प्रमादालस्यनिद्राभिस्तन्निबध्नाति भारत
verses.english_translation: Know that Tamas is born of false knowledge and deludes all embodied selves. It binds, O Arjuna, with negligence, indolence and sleep.

verses.original_text:
सत्त्वं सुखे सञ्जयति रजः कर्मणि भारत । 
ज्ञानमावृत्य तु तमः प्रमादे सञ्जयत्युत
verses.english_translation: Sattva generates attachment to pleasure, Rajas to action, O Arjuna. But Tamas , veiling knowledge, generates attachment to negligence.

verses.original_text:
रजस्तमश्चाभिभूय सत्त्वं भवति भारत । 
रजः सत्त्वं तमश्चैव तमः सत्त्वं रजस्तथा
verses.english_translation: Prevailing over Rajas and Tamas, Sattva preponderates, O Arjuna. Prevailing over Tamas and Sattva, Rajas preponderates. Prevailingover Rajas and Sattva, Tamas preponderates.

verses.original_text:
सर्वद्वारेषु देहेऽस्मिन्प्रकाश उपजायते । 
ज्ञानं यदा तदा विद्याद्विवृद्धं सत्त्वमित्युत
verses.english_translation: When knowledge as light illumines from all gateways (i.e., the senses), then one should know that Sattva prevails.

verses.original_text:
लोभः प्रवृत्तिरारंभः कर्मणामशमः स्पृहा । 
रजस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे भरतर्षभ
verses.english_translation: Greed, activity, undertaking of work, unrest and longing- these arise, O Arjuna, when Rajas prevails.

verses.original_text:
अप्रकाशोऽप्रवृत्तिश्च प्रमादो मोह एव च । 
तमस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे कुरुनन्दन
verses.english_translation: Non-illumination, inactivity, negligence and even delusion- these arise, O Arjuna, when Tamas prevails.

verses.original_text:
यदा सत्त्वे प्रवृद्धे तु प्रलयं याति देहभृत् । 
तदोत्तमविदां लोकानमलान्प्रतिपद्यते
verses.english_translation: If the embodied self meets with dissolution when Sattva prevails, then It proceeds to the pure worlds of those who know the highest.

verses.original_text:
रजसि प्रलयं गत्वा कर्मसङ्गिषु जायते । 
तथा प्रलीनस्तमसि मूढयोनिषु जायते
verses.english_translation: Meeting with dissolution when Rajas is prevalent, one is born among those attached to work... Similarly, one who has met with dissolutionwhen Tamas prevails, is born in the wombs of being lacking in intelligence.

verses.original_text:
कर्मणः सुकृतस्याहुः सात्त्विकं निर्मलं फलम् । 
रजसस्तु फलम् दुःखमज्ञानं तमसः फलम्
verses.english_translation: The fruits of a good deed, they say, is pure and is of the nature of Sattva. But the fruit of Rajas is pain; and the fruit of Tamas isignorance.

verses.original_text:
सत्त्वात्सञ्जायते ज्ञानं रजसो लोभ एव च । 
प्रमादमोहौ तमसो भवतोऽज्ञानमेव च
verses.english_translation: From the Sattva arises knowledge, and from Rajas greed, from Tamas arises negligence and delusion, and, indeed ignorance.

verses.original_text:
ऊर्ध्वं गच्छन्ति सत्त्वस्था मध्ये तिष्ठन्ति राजसाः । 
जघन्यगुणवृत्तस्था अधो गच्छन्ति तामसाः
verses.english_translation: Those who rest in Sattva rise upwards; those who abide in Rajas remain in the middle; and those, abiding, in the tendencies of Tamas godownwards.

verses.original_text:
नान्यं गुणेभ्यः कर्तारं यदा द्रष्टानुपश्यति । 
गुणेभ्यश्च परं वेत्ति मद्भावं सोऽधिगच्छति
verses.english_translation: When the seer beholds no agent of action other than the Gunas, and knows what transcends the Gunas, he attains to My state.

verses.original_text:
गुणानेतानतीत्य त्रीन्देही देहसमुद्भवान् । 
जन्ममृत्युजरादुःखैर्विमुक्तोऽमृतमश्नुते
verses.english_translation: The embodied self, crossing beyond these three Gunas which arise in the body, and freed from birth, death, age and pain, attainsimmortality.

verses.original_text:
अर्जुन उवाच 
कैर्लिङ्गैस्त्रीन्गुणानेतानतीतो भवति प्रभो । 
किमाचारः कथं चैतांस्त्रीन्गुणानतिवर्तते
verses.english_translation: Arjuna said: What are the marks of a man who has crossed beyond the three Gunas?What is his behavior? And how does he cross beyond the three Gunas?

verses.original_text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच 
प्रकाशं च प्रवृत्तिं च मोहमेव च पाण्डव । 
न द्वेष्टि सम्प्रवृत्तानि न निवृत्तानि काङ्क्षति
verses.english_translation: The lord said: He hates not illumination, nor activity nor even delusion, O Arjuna,while these prevail, nor longs for them when they cease.

verses.original_text:
उदासीनवदासीनो गुणैर्यो न विचाल्यते । 
गुणा वर्तन्त इत्येव योऽवतिष्ठति नेङ्गते
verses.english_translation: He who sits like one unconcerned, undisturbed by the Gunas; who knows, 'It is the Gunas that move,' and so rests unshaken;

verses.original_text:
समदुःखसुखः स्वस्थः समलोष्टाश्मकाञ्चनः । 
तुल्यप्रियाप्रियो धीरस्तुल्यनिन्दात्मसंस्तुतिः
verses.english_translation: He who is alike in pleasure and pain, who dwells in his self, who looks upon a clod, a stone and piece of gold as of equal value,who remains the same towards things dear and hateful and who is intelligent, who regards both blame and praise of himself as equal;

verses.original_text:
मानापमानयोस्तुल्यस्तुल्यो मित्रारिपक्षयोः । 
सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी गुणातीतः स उच्यते
verses.english_translation: He who is the same in honor and dishonor, and the same to friend and foe, and who has abandoned all enterprises- he is saidto have risen above the Gunas.

verses.original_text:
मां च योऽव्यभिचारेण भक्तियोगेन सेवते । 
स गुणान्समतीत्यैतान्ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते
verses.english_translation: And he who, with unswerving Bhakti Yoga, serves Me, he crossing beyond the Gunas, becomes fit for the state of Brahman.

verses.original_text:
ब्रह्मणो हि प्रतिष्ठाहममृतस्याव्ययस्य च । 
शाश्वतस्य च धर्मस्य सुखस्यैकान्तिकस्य च
