verses.english_translation: For I am the ground of Brahman, the immortal and immutable, of eternal Dharma and of perfect bliss.

verses.original_text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच 
ऊर्ध्वमूलमधःशाखमश्वत्थं प्राहुरव्ययम् । 
छन्दांसि यस्य पर्णानि यस्तं वेद स वेदवित्
verses.english_translation: The Lord said: They speak of an immutable Asvattha tree with its roots aboveand branches below. Its leaves are the Vedas. He who knows it knows the Vedas.

verses.original_text:
अधश्चोर्ध्वं प्रसृतास्तस्य शाखाः गुणप्रवृद्धा विषयप्रवालाः । 
अधश्च मूलान्यनुसन्ततानि कर्मानुबन्धीनि मनुष्यलोके
verses.english_translation: It branches extend both above and below, nourishing by the Gunas. Their shoots are sense objects.... And their secondary rootsextend downwards, resulting in acts which bind in the world of men

verses.original_text:
न रूपमस्येह तथोपलभ्यते नान्तो न चादिर्न च संप्रतिष्ठा । 
अश्वत्थमेनं सुविरूढमूलम् असङ्गशस्त्रेण दृढेन छित्त्वा
verses.english_translation: Its form as such is not perceived here, nor its end, nor its beginning, nor its support. Having cut off this firm-rooted Asvatthawith the strong axe of detachment..

verses.original_text:
ततः पदं तत्परिमार्गितव्यम् यस्मिन्गता न निवर्तन्ति भूयः । 
तमेव चाद्यं पुरुषं प्रपद्ये यतः प्रवृत्तिः प्रसृता पुराणी
verses.english_translation: Then, one should seek that goal attaining which one never returns. One should seek refuge with that Primal Person from whom streamedforth this ancient activity.

verses.original_text:
निर्मानमोहा जितसङ्गदोषाः अध्यात्मनित्या विनिवृत्तकामाः । 
द्वन्द्वैर्विमुक्ताः सुखदुःखसञ्ज्ञैः गच्छन्त्यमूढाः पदमव्ययं तत्
verses.english_translation: Without the delusion of perverse notion (concerning the self), victorious over the evil of attachment, ever devoted to the self,turned away from desires and liberated from dualities called pleasure and pain, the undeluded go to that imperishable status.

verses.original_text:
न तद्भासयते सूर्यो न शशाङ्को न पावकः । 
यद्गत्वा न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम
verses.english_translation: That supreme light(i.e., the individual self), reaching which they do not return any more, is Mine; the sun does not illumine It,nor moon, nor the fire.

verses.original_text:
ममैवांशो जीवलोके जीवभूतः सनातनः ।
 मनःषष्ठानीन्द्रियाणि प्रकृतिस्थानि कर्षति
verses.english_translation: An everlasting part of Myself, having become the bound self in the world of life, attracts the senses, of which the mind is the sixthand which abide in Prakrti.

verses.original_text:
शरीरं यदवाप्नोति यच्चाप्युत्क्रामतीश्वरः । 
गृहीत्वैतानि संयाति वायुर्गन्धानिवाशयात्
verses.english_translation: Whatever body Its lord acquires and from whatever body It departs, It goes on its way, taking these senses as the wind carrying scentsfrom their places.

verses.original_text:
श्रोत्रं चक्षुः स्पर्शनं च रसनं घ्राणमेव च । 
अधिष्ठाय मनश्चायं विषयानुपसेवते
verses.english_translation: Presiding over the ear, the eye, the sense of touch, the tongue and the nose, and the mind, It experiences these objects of senses.

verses.original_text:
उत्क्रामन्तं स्थितं वापि भुञ्जानं वा गुणान्वितम् । 
विमूढा नानुपश्यन्ति पश्यन्ति ज्ञानचक्षुषः
verses.english_translation: The deluded do not perceive It (i.e., the self) conjoined with the Gunas when departing or staying or experiencing. They who havethe eye of knowledge see It.

verses.original_text:
यतन्तो योगिनश्चैनं पश्यन्त्यात्मन्यवस्थितम् । 
यतन्तोऽप्यकृतात्मानो नैनं पश्यन्त्यचेतसः
verses.english_translation: The striving Yogins see It established in themselves. But, though striving, those of unrefined minds, devoid of intelligence, perceiveIt not.

verses.original_text:
यदादित्यगतं तेजो जगद्भासयतेऽखिलम् । 
यच्चन्द्रमसि यच्चाग्नौ तत्तेजो विद्धि मामकम्
verses.english_translation: That brilliance in the sun which illumines the whole universe, that in the moon and that in fire, know that brilliance as Mine.

verses.original_text:
गामाविश्य च भूतानि धारयाम्यहमोजसा । 
पुष्णामि चौषधीः सर्वाः सोमो भूत्वा रसात्मकः
verses.english_translation: And entering the earth I uphold all beings by My strength. I nourish all herbs, becoming the juicy Soma.

verses.original_text:
अहं वैश्वानरो भूत्वा प्राणिनां देहमाश्रितः । 
प्राणापानसमायुक्तः पचाम्यन्नं चतुर्विधम्
verses.english_translation: Becoming the digestive fire, I function within the bodies of all living beings. In union with inward and outward breaths, I digestthe four kinds of food.

verses.original_text:
सर्वस्य चाहं हृदि सन्निविष्टो मत्तः स्मृतिर्ज्ञानमपोहनं च । 
वेदैश्च सर्वैरहमेव वेद्यो वेदान्तकृद्वेदविदेव चाहम्
verses.english_translation: And I am seated in the hearts of all. From Me are memory, knowledge and their removal also. Indeed I alone am to be known from all theVedas; I alone am the knower of the Vedas.

verses.original_text:
द्वाविमौ पुरुषौ लोके क्षरश्चाक्षर एव च । 
क्षरः सर्वाणि भूतानि कूटस्थोऽक्षर उच्यते
verses.english_translation: There are two kinds of Persons (Purusas) spoken of in the Sastra- the perishable (Ksara) and the imperishable (Aksara). The perishable is allbeings and the imperishable is called the unchanging (Kutastha).

verses.original_text:
उत्तमः पुरुषस्त्वन्यः परमात्मेत्युदाहृतः । 
यो लोकत्रयमाविश्य बिभर्त्यव्यय ईश्वरः
verses.english_translation: There is the Supreme person other than these. He is named the Supreme Self (Paramatma) in all the Vedas. He who as the immutable one andthe Lord, entering the threefold world, supports it.

verses.original_text:
यस्मात्क्षरमतीतोऽहमक्षरादपि चोत्तमः । 
अतोऽस्मि लोके वेदे च प्रथितः पुरुषोत्तमः
verses.english_translation: Because I transcend the perishable Person and am also higher than the imperishable person, therefore I am styled in the Smrti and theVeda as the Supreme Person (Purusottama).

verses.original_text:
यो मामेवमसम्मूढो जानाति पुरुषोत्तमम् । 
स सर्वविद्भजति मां सर्वभावेन भारत
verses.english_translation: He who, without delusion thus knows Me as the supreme Self, knows all, O Arjuna, and worships Me in every way.

verses.original_text:
इति गुह्यतमं शास्त्रमिदमुक्तं मयानघ । 
एतद्बुद्ध्वा बुद्धिमान्स्यात्कृतकृत्यश्च भारत
verses.english_translation: Thus, O sinless one, has this most mysterious doctrine been imparted by Me. By understanding this a man will become truly wise and willhave fulfilled his duty.

verses.original_text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच 
अभयं सत्त्वसंशुद्धिर्ज्ञानयोगव्यवस्थितिः । 
दानं दमश्च यज्ञश्च स्वाध्यायस्तप आर्जवम्
verses.english_translation: The Lord said: Fearlessness, purity of mind, devotion to meditation on the knowledge(of the self), alms-giving, self-control, worship, study of Vedas, austerity, uprightness:

verses.original_text:
अहिंसा सत्यमक्रोधस्त्यागः शान्तिरपैशुनम् । 
दया भूतेष्वलोलुप्त्वं मार्दवं ह्रीरचापलम्
verses.english_translation: Non-injury, truth, freedom from anger, renunciation, tranquility, nonslandering others, compassion to all beings, freedom from desire,gentleness, the sense of shame, freedom from fickleness;

verses.original_text:
तेजः क्षमा धृतिः शौचमद्रोहो नातिमानिता । 
भवन्ति सम्पदं दैवीमभिजातस्य भारत
verses.english_translation: Grandeur, patience, fortitude, purity, freedom from hatred, and from over-pride- these, O Arjuna, belong to him who is born to a divinedestiny.

verses.original_text:
दम्भो दर्पोऽभिमानश्च क्रोधः पारुष्यमेव च । 
अज्ञानं चाभिजातस्य पार्थ सम्पदमासुरीम्
verses.english_translation: Pomposity, arrogance, self-conceit, wrath, rudeness and ignorance- these, O Arjuna, belong to him who is born to a demoniac destiny.

verses.original_text:
दैवी सम्पद्विमोक्षाय निबन्धायासुरी मता । 
मा शुचः सम्पदं दैवीमभिजातोऽसि पाण्डव
verses.english_translation: The divine destiny id deemed to lead the liberation, the demoniac to bondage. Grieve not, O Arjuna, you are born to a divine destiny.

verses.original_text:
द्वौ भूतसर्गौ लोकेऽस्मिन्दैव आसुर एव च । 
दैवो विस्तरशः प्रोक्त आसुरं पार्थ मे शृणु
verses.english_translation: There are two types of beings in this world- the divine and the demoniac. The divine has been described at length. Hear from Me,O Arjuna, about the demoniac.

verses.original_text:
प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च जना न विदुरासुराः । 
न शौचं नापि चाचारो न सत्यं तेषु विद्यते
verses.english_translation: The demoniac men know neither action nor renunciation. Cleanliness is not in them, nor even right conduct nor truth.

verses.original_text:
असत्यमप्रतिष्ठं ते जगदाहुरनीश्वरम् । 
अपरस्परसम्भूतं किमन्यत्कामहैतुकम्
verses.english_translation: They maintain: 'The universe is without truth, without any foundation and without a Lord( Isvara). What else can exist without mutualcausation? It has lust for its cause.

verses.original_text:
एतां दृष्टिमवष्टभ्य नष्टात्मानोऽल्पबुद्धयः । 
प्रभवन्त्युग्रकर्माणः क्षयाय जगतोऽहिताः
verses.english_translation: Holding this view, these men of lost souls and feeble understanding do cruel deeds for the destruction of the world.

verses.original_text:
काममाश्रित्य दुष्पूरं दम्भमानमदान्विताः । 
मोहाद्गृहीत्वासद्ग्राहान्प्रवर्तन्तेऽशुचिव्रताः
verses.english_translation: Turning to insatiable desires, seizing through delusion unjustly acquired wealth, and following impious vows, they act, full ofostentation, pride and arrogance.

verses.original_text:
चिन्तामपरिमेयां च प्रलयान्तामुपाश्रिताः । 
कामोपभोगपरमा एतावदिति निश्चिताः
verses.english_translation: Obsessed by unlimited cares which end with dissolution, looking upon enjoyment of desires as their highest aim, and convinced thatthis is all;

verses.original_text:
आशापाशशतैर्बद्धाः कामक्रोधपरायणाः । 
ईहन्ते कामभोगार्थमन्यायेनार्थसञ्चयान्
verses.english_translation: Bound by hundreds of fetters of hopes, given over to desire and anger, they strive unjustly to gather wealth for the gratificationof their desires.

verses.original_text:
इदमद्य मया लब्धमिदं प्राप्स्ये मनोरथम् । 
इदमस्तीदमपि मे भविष्यति पुनर्धनम्
verses.english_translation: 'This I have gained today, and this desire I shall attain. This wealth is mine, and this also shall be mine hereafter.

verses.original_text:
असौ मया हतः शत्रुर्हनिष्ये चापरानपि । 
ईश्वरोऽहमहं भोगी सिद्धोऽहं बलवान्सुखी
verses.english_translation: 'This enemy is slain by me; and others also shall slay. I am the Lord, I am the enjoyer, I am successful, I have strength, I have happiness.

verses.original_text:
आढ्योऽभिजनवानस्मि कोऽन्योऽस्ति सदृशो मया । 
यक्ष्ये दास्यामि मोदिष्य इत्यज्ञानविमोहिताः
verses.english_translation: 'I am wealthy and high-born; who else is equal to me? I shall sacrifice, I shall give aims, I shall rejoice.' Thus they think,deluded by ignorance.

verses.original_text:
अनेकचित्तविभ्रान्ता मोहजालसमावृताः । 
प्रसक्ताः कामभोगेषु पतन्ति नरकेऽशुचौ
verses.english_translation: Bewildered by many thoughts, ensnared by the net of delusion, addicted to sensual enjoyments, they fall into a foul Naraka.

verses.original_text:
आत्मसम्भाविताः स्तब्धा धनमानमदान्विताः । 
यजन्ते नामयज्ञैस्ते दम्भेनाविधिपूर्वकम्
verses.english_translation: Self-conceited, self-sufficient, possessed of the intoxication of wealth and pride, they perform sacrifices in name only, withostentation and not according to the injunctions of the Sastras.

verses.original_text:
अहङ्कारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं च संश्रिताः । 
मामात्मपरदेहेषु प्रद्विषन्तोऽभ्यसूयकाः
verses.english_translation: Depending on their egoism, power and pride, and also of desire and wrath, these malicious men hate Me in their own bodies and inthose of others.

verses.original_text:
तानहं द्विषतः क्रूरान्संसारेषु नराधमान् । 
क्षिपाम्यजस्रमशुभानासुरीष्वेव योनिषु
verses.english_translation: Those haters, cruel, the vilest and the most inauspicious of mankind, I hurl forever into the cycles of births and deaths, into the wombsof demons.

verses.original_text:
आसुरीं योनिमापन्ना मूढा जन्मनि जन्मनि । 
मामप्राप्यैव कौन्तेय ततो यान्त्यधमां गतिम्
verses.english_translation: Fallen into demoniac wombs in birth after birth, these deluded men not attaining Me, further sink down to the lowest level, O Arjuna.

verses.original_text:
त्रिविधं नरकस्येदं द्वारं नाशनमात्मनः । 
कामः क्रोधस्तथा लोभस्तस्मादेतत्त्रयं त्यजेत्
verses.english_translation: Desire, wrath and greed- this is the triple gateway to Naraka, ruinous to the self. Therefore one should abandon these three.

verses.original_text:
एतैर्विमुक्तः कौन्तेय तमोद्वारैस्त्रिभिर्नरः । 
आचरत्यात्मनः श्रेयस्ततो याति परां गतिम्
verses.english_translation: One who has been released from these threefold gates of darkness, O Arjuna, works for the good of the self. Hence he reaches theSupreme state.

verses.original_text:
यः शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य वर्तते कामकारतः । 
न स सिद्धिमवाप्नोति न सुखं न परां गतिम्
verses.english_translation: He who, abandoning the injunctions of the Sastras, acts under the influence of desire, attains neither perfection nor pleasure,nor the supreme state

verses.original_text:
तस्माच्छास्त्रम् प्रमाणं ते कार्याकार्यव्यवस्थितौ । 
ज्ञात्वा शास्त्रविधानोक्तम् कर्म कर्तुमिहार्हसि
verses.english_translation: Therefore, let the Sastra be your authority for determining what should be done and what should not be done. Knowing what is enjoinedin the injunctions of the Sastra, you should perform work here.

verses.original_text:
अर्जुन उवाच 
ये शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य यजन्ते श्रद्धयान्विताः । 
तेषां निष्ठा तु का कृष्ण सत्त्वमाहो रजस्तमः
verses.english_translation: Arjuna said: Now that, O Krishna, is the position or basis of those who leaveaside the injunction of the Sastra, yet worship with faith? Is it Sattva, Rajas or Tamas?

verses.original_text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच 
त्रिविधा भवति श्रद्धा देहिनाम् सा स्वभावजा । 
सात्त्विकी राजसी चैव तामसी चेति तां शृणु
verses.english_translation: Threefold is the faith of the embodied beings, born of their own nature, constituted of Sattva, Rajas and Tamas. Listen now aboutit.

verses.original_text:
सत्त्वानुरूपा सर्वस्य श्रद्धा भवति भारत । 
श्रद्धमयोऽयं पुरुषो यो यच्छ्रद्धः स एव सः
verses.english_translation: The faith of everyone, O Arjuna, is in accordance with his internal (Antahkarana). Man consists of faith. Whatever his faith is , thatverily is he.

verses.original_text:
यजन्ते सात्त्विका देवान्यक्षरक्षांसि राजसाः । 
प्रेतान्भूतगणांश्चान्ये यजन्ते तामसा जनाः
verses.english_translation: The Sattvika types worship the gods. The Rajasa types worship Yaksas and Raksasas. And the others, the Tamasa types, worship thedeparted ancestors and hosts of Bhutas.

verses.original_text:
अशास्त्रविहितं घोरं तप्यन्ते ये तपो जनाः । 
दम्भाहङ्कारसंयुक्ताः कामरागबलान्विताः
verses.english_translation: Those men who practice terrible austerity not enjoined by the Sastras, given to ostentation and conceit, and prompted by the force ofsensual desires and passion;

verses.original_text:
कर्शयन्तः शरीरस्थं भूतग्राममचेतसः । 
मां चैवान्तःशरीरस्थं तान्विद्ध्यासुरनिश्चयान्
verses.english_translation: These foolish men, torturing the group of elements in their bodies and Me also who dwell within the body- know them to be demoniacalin their resolves.

verses.original_text:
आहारास्त्वपि सर्वस्य त्रिविधो भवति प्रियः । 
यज्ञस्तपस्तथा दानं तेषां भेदमिमं शृणु
verses.english_translation: Even the food which is dear to all is threefold. So are sacrifices, austerity and gifts. Listen about this distinction among them.

verses.original_text:
आयुःसत्त्वबलारोग्यसुखप्रीतिविवर्धनाः । 
रस्याः स्निग्धाः स्थिरा हृद्या आहाराः सात्त्विकप्रियाः
verses.english_translation: Foods which promote longevity, intellectual alertness, strength, health, pleasure and happiness and those that are sweet, oily,substantial and agreeable, are dear to Sattvika men

verses.original_text:
कट्वम्ललवणात्युष्णतीक्ष्णरूक्षविदाहिनः । 
आहारा राजसस्येष्टा दुःखशोकामयप्रदाः
verses.english_translation: Foods that are bitter, sour, very salty, exceedingly heating, very pungent, dry and burning, are all dear to Rajasika men; theyproduce pain, sorrow and disease.

verses.original_text:
यातयामं गतरसं पूति पर्युषितं च यत् । 
उच्छिष्टमपि चामेध्यं भोजनं तामसप्रियम्
verses.english_translation: That food which is stale, tasteless, putrid, decayed, refuse, unclean, is dear to Tamasika men.

verses.original_text:
अफलाकाङ्क्षिभिर्यज्ञो विधिदृष्टो य इज्यते । 
यष्टव्यमेवेति मनः समाधाय स सात्त्विकः
verses.english_translation: The sacrifice (worship) marked by Sattva is what is offered by those desiring no fruit, and having the conviction that it should be performedas enjoined in the Sastras.

verses.original_text:
अभिसन्धाय तु फलम् दम्भार्थमपि चैव यत् । 
इज्यते भरतश्रेष्ठ तं यज्ञं विद्धि राजसम्
verses.english_translation: But that sacrifice which is offered with the fruit in view and for the sake of ostentation, know it, O Arjuna, to be Rajasika.

verses.original_text:
विधिहीनमसृष्टान्नं मन्त्रहीनमदक्षिणम् । 
श्रद्धाविरहितं यज्ञं तामसं परिचक्षते
verses.english_translation: That sacrifice which is bereft of authority, which uses offerings not sanctioned by the Sastras, which is performed without recitationof hymns and bereft of the gifts and faith- that, they say, is marked by Tamas.

verses.original_text:
देवद्विजगुरुप्राज्ञपूजनं शौचमार्जवम् । 
ब्रह्मचर्यमहिंसा च शारीरं तप उच्यते
verses.english_translation: Worship of the gods, the twice-born, the preceptors, the enlightened ones, purity, uprightness, continence and non-injury, these arecalled austerity of the body.

verses.original_text:
अनुद्वेगकरं वाक्यं सत्यं प्रियहितं च यत् । 
स्वाध्यायाभ्यसनं चैव वाङ्मयं तप उच्यते
verses.english_translation: Speech that causes no shock(hurt and fear etc.) and which is true, pleasant and beneficial, and also the practice of recitation of thescriptures are called the austerity of speech.

verses.original_text:
मनःप्रसादः सौम्यत्वं मौनमात्मविनिग्रहः । 
भावसंशुद्धिरित्येतत्तपो मानसमुच्यते
verses.english_translation: Serenity of mind, benevolence, silence, self-control, purity of mind these are called austerity of the mind.

verses.original_text:
श्रद्धया परया तप्तं तपस्तत्त्रिविधं नरैः । 
अफलाकाङ्क्षिभिर्युक्तैः सात्त्विकं परिचक्षते
verses.english_translation: The three fold austerity, practiced with supreme faith by men who desire no fruit and are devoted- they call it austerity of Sattva.

verses.original_text:
सत्कारमानपूजार्थं तपो दम्भेन चैव यत् । 
क्रियते तदिह प्रोक्तं राजसं चलमध्रुवम्
verses.english_translation: That austerity, practiced with ostentation for the sake of gaining respect, praise and reverence, is here said to be Rajasa. It isunsteady and impermanent.

verses.original_text:
मूढग्राहेणात्मनो यत्पीडया क्रियते तपः । 
परस्योत्सादनार्थं वा तत्तामसमुदाहृतम्
verses.english_translation: That austerity which is practiced from deluded notions by means of self-torture or in order to injure another is said to be Tamasika.

verses.original_text:
दातव्यमिति यद्दानम् दीयतेऽनुपकारिणे । 
देशे काले च पात्रे च तद्दानं सात्त्विकं स्मृतम्
verses.english_translation: Gifts given with the feeling, that it is one's own duty to give to one who makes no return, at the proper place and time to thedeserving person- that is said to be Sattvika.

verses.original_text:
यत्तु प्रत्युपकारार्थं फलमुद्दिश्य वा पुनः । 
दीयते च परिक्लिष्टं तद्दानं राजसं स्मृतम्
verses.english_translation: But that which is given as a consideration for something received or in expectation of future reward, or grudgingly, is called Rajasikagift.

verses.original_text:
अदेशकाले यद्दानमपात्रेभ्यश्च दीयते । 
असत्कृतमवज्ञातं तत्तामसमुदाहृतम्
verses.english_translation: That gift which is given at the wrong place and wrong time to unworthy recipients, without due respect and with contempt, is called the giftof Tamasa nature.

verses.original_text:
ओं तत्सदिति निर्देशो ब्रह्मणस्त्रिविधः स्मृतः । 
ब्राह्मणास्तेन वेदाश्च यज्ञाश्च विहिताः पुरा
verses.english_translation: Om, Tat, Sat- thus Brahman is denoted by this three fold expression. Associated with these, Brahmanas, the Vedas and sacrifices were ordainedin the past.

verses.original_text:
तस्मादोमित्युदाहृत्य यज्ञदानतपःक्रियाः ।
 प्रवर्तन्ते विधानोक्ताः सततं ब्रह्मवादिनाम्
verses.english_translation: Therefore, the Veda-enjoined sacrificial acts, gifts and austerity by these expounders of the Veda, or those belonging to the firstthree stations are always and at all times begun after pronouncing Om at the beginning.

verses.original_text:
तदित्यनभिसन्धाय फलं यज्ञतपःक्रियाः । 
दानक्रियाश्च विविधाः क्रियन्ते मोक्षकाङ्क्षिभिः
verses.english_translation: Acts of sacrifice, of austerity and of various gifts are performed without aiming at reward by those who seek release, after pronouncingTat.

verses.original_text:
सद्भावे साधुभावे च सदित्येतत्प्रयुज्यते । 
प्रशस्ते कर्मणि तथा सच्छब्दः पार्थ युज्यते
verses.english_translation: This term Sat is used in the sense of existence and goodness. And so also, O Arjuna, the word Sat is applied to an auspicious action.

verses.original_text:
यज्ञे तपसि दाने च स्थितिः सदिति चोच्यते । 
कर्म चैव तदर्थीयं सदित्येवाभिधीयते
verses.english_translation: Devotion to sacrifice, austerities and gifts is also called Sat; and so any act for such purposes is named Sat.

verses.original_text:
अश्रद्धया हुतं दत्तं तपस्तप्तं कृतं च यत् । 
असदित्युच्यते पार्थ न च तत्प्रेत्य नो इह
verses.english_translation: Whatever offering or gift is made, whatever austerity is practiced and whatever action is performed without faith, that is called Asat,O Arjuna. It is naught here or hereafter.

verses.original_text:
अर्जुन उवाच 
संन्यासस्य महाबाहो तत्त्वमिच्छामि वेदितुम् । 
त्यागस्य च हृषीकेश पृथक्केशिनिषूदन
verses.english_translation: Arjuna said; I desire to know the truth about renunciation (Sanyasa) andabnegation (Tyaga) severally, O Krishna.

verses.original_text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच 
काम्यानां कर्मणां न्यासं संन्यासं कवयो विदुः । 
सर्वकर्मफलत्यागं प्राहुस्त्यागं विचक्षणाः
verses.english_translation: The Lord said: The sages hold that Sannyasa is the giving up of all works which aremotivated by desire. The wise declare Tyaga to be the abandonment of fruits of all works.

verses.original_text:
त्याज्यं दोषवदित्येके कर्म प्राहुर्मनीषिणः । 
यज्ञदानतपःकर्म न त्याज्यमिति चापरे
verses.english_translation: Some sages say that all actions should be given up as evil; others declare that works such as sacrifices, gifts and austerities shouldnot be given up.

verses.original_text:
निश्चयं शृणु मे तत्र त्यागे भरतसत्तम । 
त्यागो हि पुरुषव्याघ्र त्रिविधः सम्प्रकीर्तितः
verses.english_translation: Listen to My decision, O Arjuna, about abandonment; for abandonment (Tyaga) is declared to be of three kinds.

verses.original_text:
यज्ञदानतपःकर्म न त्याज्यं कार्यमेव तत् । 
यज्ञो दानं तपश्चैव पावनानि मनीषिणाम्
verses.english_translation: The acts of sacrifice, gifts and austerities should not be relinquished; but should be performed.... For sacrifices, gifts and austerities arethe means of purification for the wise.

verses.original_text:
एतान्यपि तु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा फलानि च । 
कर्तव्यानीति मे पार्थ निश्चितं मतमुत्तमम्
verses.english_translation: It is My decided and final view that even these acts should be done, O Arjuna, with relinquishment of attachment and the fruits thereof.

verses.original_text:
नियतस्य तु संन्यासः कर्मणो नोपपद्यते । 
मोहात्तस्य परित्यागस्तामसः परिकीर्तितः
verses.english_translation: But the renunciation of obligatory acts is not proper. Abandonment of these through delusion is declared to be Tamasika.

verses.original_text:
दुःखमित्येव यत्कर्म कायक्लेशभयात्त्यजेत् । 
स कृत्वा राजसं त्यागं नैव त्यागफलं लभेत्
verses.english_translation: He who renounces acts as painful from fear of bodily suffering, performs a Rajasika abandonment; he does not gain the fruit ofabandonment.

verses.original_text:
कार्यमित्येव यत्कर्म नियतं क्रियतेऽर्जुन । 
सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा फलं चैव स त्यागः सात्त्विको मतः
verses.english_translation: When actions are performed as what ought to be done, O Arjuna, renouncing attachment and also fruits, such abandonment is regardedas Sattvika.

verses.original_text:
न द्वेष्ट्यकुशलं कर्म कुशले नानुषज्जते । 
त्यागी सत्त्वसमाविष्टो मेधावी छिन्नसंशयः
verses.english_translation: One who has abandoned, who is imbued with Sattva, who is wise, whose doubts have been dispelled- such a person hates not disagreeableacts nor lings to agreeable ones.

verses.original_text:
न हि देहभृता शक्यं त्यक्तुं कर्माण्यशेषतः । 
यस्तु कर्मफलत्यागी स त्यागीत्यभिधीयते
verses.english_translation: For it is impossible for one who bears a body to abandon actions entirely. But he who gives up the fruits of works, is called theabandoner.

verses.original_text:
अनिष्टमिष्टं मिश्रं च त्रिविधं कर्मणः फलम् । 
भवत्यत्यागिनां प्रेत्य न तु सन्न्यासिनां क्वचित्
verses.english_translation: Undesirable, desirable and mixed- thus threefold is the fruit of work that accrues after death to those who have not renounced; butto those who have renounced, none whatsoever.

verses.original_text:
पञ्चैतानि महाबाहो कारणानि निबोध मे । 
साङ्ख्ये कृतान्ते प्रोक्तानि सिद्धये सर्वकर्मणाम्
verses.english_translation: Learn from Me, O Arjuna, these five causes for the accomplishment of all acts, as described in Sankhya-krtanta- the science of theexact understanding of things for the accomplishment of works.

verses.original_text:
अधिष्ठानं तथा कर्ता करणं च पृथग्विधम् । 
विविधाश्च पृथक् चेष्टा दैवं चैवात्र पञ्चमम्
verses.english_translation: The seat of action and likewise the agent, the various kinds of organs, the different and distinctive functions of vital air and also thefifth among these, Divinity.

verses.original_text:
शरीरवाङ्मनोभिर्यत्कर्म प्रारभते नरः । 
न्याय्यं वा विपरीतं वा पञ्चैते तस्य हेतवः
verses.english_translation: For whatever action a man undertakes by his body, speech and mind, whether right or wrong, i.e., enjoined or forbidden by the Sastras,the following five are its causes;

verses.original_text:
तत्रैवं सति कर्तारमात्मानं केवलं तु यः । 
पश्यत्यकृतबुद्धित्वान्न स पश्यति दुर्मतिः
verses.english_translation: Such being the case, he who sees only the self as the agent on account of the uncultivated understanding- he , of wicked mind,does not see at all.

verses.original_text:
यस्य नाहङ्कृतो भावो बुद्धिर्यस्य न लिप्यते । 
हत्वापि स इमाँल्लोकान्न हन्ति न निबध्यते
verses.english_translation: He who is free from the notion ' I am the doer,' and whose understanding is not tainted- slays not, though he slays all these mennor is he bound.

verses.original_text:
ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं परिज्ञाता त्रिविधा कर्मचोदना । 
करणं कर्म कर्तेति त्रिविधः कर्मसङ्ग्रहः
verses.english_translation: Knowledge, object of knowledge and the knower are the threefold incitements to action. The instrument, the act and the agent are thethreefold constituents of action.

verses.original_text:
ज्ञानं कर्म च कर्ता च त्रिधैव गुणभेदतः । 
प्रोच्यते गुणसङ्ख्याने यथावच्छृणु तान्यपि
verses.english_translation: Knowledge, act and agent are declared in the science of Gunas to be of three kinds, according to the difference in the Gunas.Listen about them also as they are.

verses.original_text:
सर्वभूतेषु येनैकं भावमव्ययमीक्षते । 
अविभक्तं विभक्तेषु तज्ज्ञानम् विद्धि सात्त्विकम्
verses.english_translation: Know that knowledge to be Sattvika by which one sees in all beings, one immutable existence undivided in the divided.

verses.original_text:
पृथक्त्वेन तु यज्ज्ञानं नानाभावान्पृथग्विधान् । 
वेत्ति सर्वेषु भूतेषु तज्ज्ञानं विद्धि राजसम्
verses.english_translation: But that knowledge which sees all beings, by reason of their individuality, as entities of distinct nature-know that knowledgeto be Rajasika.

verses.original_text:
यत् तु कृत्स्नवदेकस्मिन्कार्ये सक्तमहैतुकम् । 
अतत्त्वार्थवदल्पं च तत्तामसमुदाहृतम्
verses.english_translation: But that knowledge is declared to be Tamasika which clings to one single act as if it where the whole, which is not founded on reason,and which is untrue and insignificant.

verses.original_text:
नियतं सङ्गरहितमरागद्वेषतः कृतम् । 
अफलप्रेप्सुना कर्म यत्तत्सात्त्विकमुच्यते
verses.english_translation: That obligatory act is said to be Sattvika which is done without attachment, without desire or aversion, by one who seeks no fruit.

verses.original_text:
यत्तु कामेप्सुना कर्म साहङ्कारेण वा पुनः । 
क्रियते बहुलायासं तद्राजसमुदाहृतम्
verses.english_translation: But that act is said to be Rajasika which is performed with great effort by one who seeks to gratify his desires and under the promptingof egoism.

verses.original_text:
अनुबन्धं क्षयं हिंसामनपेक्ष्य च पौरुषम् । 
मोहादारभ्यते कर्म यत्तत्तामसमुच्यते
verses.english_translation: That act is said to be Tamasika which is undertaken through delusion, without regard to consequences, loss, injury and one's own capacity.

verses.original_text:
मुक्तसङ्गोऽनहंवादी धृत्युत्साहसमन्वितः । 
सिद्ध्यसिद्ध्योर्निर्विकारः कर्ता सात्त्विक उच्यते
verses.english_translation: That agent is said to be Sattvika who is free from attachment, who does not make much of himself, who is endued with steadiness and zealand is untouched by success and failure.

verses.original_text:
रागी कर्मफलप्रेप्सुर्लुब्धो हिंसात्मकोऽशुचिः । 
हर्षशोकान्वितः कर्ता राजसः परिकीर्तितः
verses.english_translation: That doer is called Rajasika who is passionate, who seeks the fruits of his acts, who is greedy, harmful, impure and who is moved bydelight and grief.

verses.original_text:
अयुक्तः प्राकृतः स्तब्धः शठो नैष्कृतिकोऽलसः । 
विषादी दीर्घसूत्री च कर्ता तामस उच्यते
verses.english_translation: That doer is said to be Tamasika who is unqualified, unrefined, stubborn, depraved, dishonest, indolent, despondent and dilatory.

verses.original_text:
बुद्धेर्भेदं धृतेश्चैव गुणतस्त्रिविधं शृणु । 
प्रोच्यमानमशेषेण पृथक्त्वेन धनञ्जय
verses.english_translation: Hear now, the threefold division of Buddhi (reason) and Dhrti (fortitude), O Arjuna, according to the Gunas, fully and severallyto be set forth.

verses.original_text:
प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च कार्याकार्ये भयाभये । 
बन्धं मोक्षं च या वेत्ति बुद्धिः सा पार्थ सात्त्विकी
verses.english_translation: That Buddhi, O Arjuna, which knows activity and renunciation, what ought to be done and what ought not to be done, fear and fearlessness,bondage and release- that ( Buddhi) is Sattvika.

verses.original_text:
यया धर्ममधर्मं च कार्यं चाकार्यमेव च । 
अयथावत्प्रजानाति बुद्धिः सा पार्थ राजसी
verses.english_translation: The Buddhi which gives an erroneous knowledge of Dharma and Adharma (its opposite) and also of what ought to be done and what ought notto be done, O Arjuna, is Rajasika.

verses.original_text:
अधर्मं धर्ममिति या मन्यते तमसावृता । 
सर्वार्थान्विपरीतांश्च बुद्धिः सा पार्थ तामसी
verses.english_translation: That Buddhi, O Arjuna, which enveloped in darkness, regards Adharma as Dharma and which reverses every value, is Tamasika.

verses.original_text:
धृत्या यया धारयते मनःप्राणेन्द्रियक्रियाः । 
योगेनाव्यभिचारिण्या धृतिः सा पार्थ सात्त्विकी
verses.english_translation: That Dhrti (fortitude or persisting perseverance) by which one maintains the unswerving activities of the mind and vital force andthese sense-organs through Yoga-that Dhrti is of the nature of Sattva.

verses.original_text:
यया तु धर्मकामार्थान्धृत्या धारयतेऽर्जुन । 
प्रसङ्गेन फलाकाङ्क्षी धृतिः सा पार्थ राजसी
verses.english_translation: That Dhrti, O Arjuna, by which one, who is desirous of fruits, longs for them with intense attachment, and holds fast to duty, desireand wealth- that Dhrti is Rajasika.

verses.original_text:
यया स्वप्नं भयं शोकं विषादं मदमेव च । 
न विमुञ्चति दुर्मेधा धृतिः सा तामसी मता
verses.english_translation: That Dhrti by which a foolish person does not give up sleep, fear, grief, depression and passion, O Arjuna, is of the nature of Tamas.

verses.original_text:
सुखं त्विदानीं त्रिविधं शृणु मे भरतर्षभ । 
अभ्यासाद्रमते यत्र दुःखान्तं च निगच्छति
verses.english_translation: Now hear from Me, O Arjuna, the threefold division of pleasure..... That in which a man rejoices by long practice and in which he comesto the end of pains.

verses.original_text:
यत्तदग्रे विषमिव परिणामेऽमृतोपमम् । 
तत्सुखं सात्त्विकं प्रोक्तमात्मबुद्धिप्रसादजम्
verses.english_translation: That which is like a poison at first but becomes like elixir in the end, born from the serene state of mind focusing on the self- suchpleasure is said to be Sattvika.

verses.original_text:
विषयेन्द्रियसंयोगाद्यत्तदग्रेऽमृतोपमम् । 
परिणामे विषमिव तत्सुखं राजसं स्मृतम्
verses.english_translation: That pleasure which arise from the contact of senses with their objects, which is like elixir at first but like poison in theend , is said to be Rajasika.

verses.original_text:
यदग्रे चानुबन्धे च सुखं मोहनमात्मनः । 
निद्रालस्यप्रमादोत्थं तत्तामसमुदाहृतम्
verses.english_translation: That pleasure which, at the beginning and at the end, deluded the self through sleep, sloth and error- is declared to be Tamasika.

verses.original_text:
न तदस्ति पृथिव्यां वा दिवि देवेषु वा पुनः । 
सत्त्वं प्रकृतिजैर्मुक्तं यदेभिः स्यात्त्रिभिर्गुणैः
verses.english_translation: There is no creature, either on earth or again among the gods in heaven, that is free from these three Gunas born of Prakrti.

verses.original_text:
ब्राह्मणक्षत्रियविशां शूद्राणां च परन्तप । 
कर्माणि प्रविभक्तानि स्वभावप्रभवैर्गुणैः
verses.english_translation: The duties of Brahmanas, Ksatriyas, Vaisyas and the Sudras are clearly divided, O Arjuna, according to Gunas, born of their nature.

verses.original_text:
शमो दमस्तपः शौचं क्षान्तिरार्जवमेव च । 
ज्ञानं विज्ञानमास्तिक्यं ब्रह्मकर्म स्वभावजम्
verses.english_translation: Control of the senses and the mind, austerity, purity, forbearance, uprightness, knowledge, special knowledge, and faith- all theseconstitute the duty of Brahmana born of his inherent nature.

verses.original_text:
शौर्यं तेजो धृतिर्दाक्ष्यं युद्धे चाप्यपलायनम् । 
दानमीश्वरभावश्च क्षत्रं कर्म स्वभावजम्
verses.english_translation: Valour, invincibility, steadiness, adroitness and non-fleeing in battle, generosity and lordliness are the duties of a Ksatriya bornof his inherent nature.

verses.original_text:
कृषिगौरक्ष्यवाणिज्यं वैश्यकर्म स्वभावजम् । 
परिचर्यात्मकं कर्म शूद्रस्यापि स्वभावजम्
verses.english_translation: Agriculture, cattle-breeding and trade are the duties of the Vaisya born of his nature... And the duty of a Sudra is one of service,born of his nature.

verses.original_text:
स्वे स्वे कर्मण्यभिरतः संसिद्धिं लभते नरः । 
स्वकर्मनिरतः सिद्धिं यथा विन्दति तच्छृणु
verses.english_translation: Devoted to his duty, man attains perfection. Hear now how one devoted to his own duty attains perfection.

verses.original_text:
यतः प्रवृत्तिर्भूतानां येन सर्वमिदम् ततम् । 
स्वकर्मणा तमभ्यर्च्य सिद्धिं विन्दति मानवः
verses.english_translation: He from whom arises the activity of all beings and by whom all this is pervaded- by worshipping Him with his own duty man reachesperfection.

verses.original_text:
श्रेयान् स्वधर्मो विगुणः परधर्मात्स्वनुष्ठितात् । 
स्वभावनियतं कर्म कुर्वन्नाप्नोति किल्बिषम्
verses.english_translation: Better is one's own duty, though ill done, than the duty of another though well performed..... When one does the duty ordained by hisown nature, he incurs no stain.

verses.original_text:
सहजं कर्म कौन्तेय सदोषमपि न त्यजेत् । 
सर्वारम्भा हि दोषेण धूमेनाग्निरिवावृताः
verses.english_translation: One should not relinquish one's work, O Arjuna, though it may be imperfect; for all enterprises are enveloped by imperfections as fireby smoke.

verses.original_text:
असक्तबुद्धिः सर्वत्र जितात्मा विगतस्पृहः । 
नैष्कर्म्यसिद्धिं परमां सन्न्यासेनाधिगच्छति
verses.english_translation: He whose understanding is on all sides un attached, whose self is conquered, who is free from desires- he attains by renunciationthe supreme perfection transcending all activity.

verses.original_text:
सिद्धिं प्राप्तो यथा ब्रह्म तथाप्नोति निबोध मे । 
समासेनैव कौन्तेय निष्ठा ज्ञानस्य या परा
verses.english_translation: Learn from me in brief, O Arjuna, how one who has attained perfection, attains the Brahman (or the self), who is the supreme consummationof knowledge.

verses.original_text:
बुद्ध्या विशुद्धया युक्तो धृत्यात्मानं नियम्य च । 
शब्दादीन् विषयांस्त्यक्त्वा रागद्वेषौ व्युदस्य च
verses.english_translation: Endowed by purified understanding, subduing the mind by steadiness relinquishing sound and other objects of the senses and casting asidelove and hate;

verses.original_text:
विविक्तसेवी लघ्वाशी यतवाक्कायमानसः । 
ध्यानयोगपरो नित्यं वैराग्यं समुपाश्रितः
verses.english_translation: Resorting to solitude, eating but little, restraining speech, body and mind, ever engaged in the Yoga of meditation and taking refuge indispassion;

verses.original_text:
अहङ्कारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं परिग्रहम् । 
विमुच्य निर्ममः शान्तो ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते
verses.english_translation: Forsaking egoism, power, pride, desire, wrath and possession, with no feeling of 'mine' and tranquil- he becomes worthy for the stateof Brahman.

verses.original_text:
ब्रह्मभूतः प्रसन्नात्मा न शोचति न काङ्क्षति । 
समः सर्वेषु भूतेषु मद्भक्तिं लभते पराम्
verses.english_translation: Having realized the state of Brahman, tranquil, he neither grieves nor craves. Regarding all beings alike, he attains supreme devotionto Me.

verses.original_text:
भक्त्या मामभिजानाति यावान्यश्चास्मि तत्त्वतः । 
ततो मां तत्त्वतो ज्ञात्वा विशते तदनन्तरम्
verses.english_translation: Through devotion, he comes to know Me fully- who and what I am reality, who I am and how I am. Knowing Me thus in truth, heforthwith enters into Me.

verses.original_text:
सर्वकर्माण्यपि सदा कुर्वाणो मद्व्यपाश्रयः । 
मत्प्रसादादवाप्नोति शाश्वतं पदमव्ययम्
verses.english_translation: Taking refuge in Me and performing all works constantly, one, by My grace, attains the eternal and immutable realm.

verses.original_text:
चेतसा सर्वकर्माणि मयि सन्न्यस्य मत्परः । 
बुद्धियोगमुपाश्रित्य मच्चित्तः सततं भव
verses.english_translation: Surrendering all acts to me by your mind, thinking of Me as the goal, and resorting to Buddhi-yoga, focus your thought ever on Me.

verses.original_text:
मच्चित्तः सर्वदुर्गाणि मत्प्रसादात्तरिष्यसि । 
अथ चेत्त्वमहङ्कारान्न श्रोष्यसि विनङ्क्ष्यसि
verses.english_translation: Focusing your thought on Me, you shall, by My grace, cross over all difficulties. If, however, out of self conceit, you do not heed Meyou shall perish.

verses.original_text:
यदहङ्कारमाश्रित्य न योत्स्य इति मन्यसे । 
मिथ्यैष व्यवसायस्ते प्रकृतिस्त्वां नियोक्ष्यति
verses.english_translation: If, in your self-conceit, you think, 'I will not fight,' your resolve is in vain. Nature will compel you.

verses.original_text:
स्वभावजेन कौन्तेय निबद्धः स्वेन कर्मणा । 
कर्तुं नेच्छसि यन्मोहात् करिष्यस्यवशोऽपि तत्
verses.english_translation: O Arjuna, bound by your own duty born out of your own inner disposition, and having no control over your own will, you willbe compelled to do that very thing which you now desire not to do through delusion.

verses.original_text:
ईश्वरः सर्वभूतानां हृद्देशेऽर्जुन तिष्ठति । 
भ्रामयन्सर्वभूतानि यन्त्रारूढानि मायया
verses.english_translation: The Lord, O Arjuna, abides in the heart of every being, spinning them round and round, mounted on a wheel as it were, by His power.

verses.original_text:
तमेव शरणं गच्छ सर्वभावेन भारत । 
तत्प्रसादात्परां शान्तिं स्थानं प्राप्स्यसि शाश्वतम्
verses.english_translation: Seek refuge in Him alone, O Arjuna, with the whole of your being. By His grace, you shall find supreme peace and eternal abode.

verses.original_text:
इति ते ज्ञानमाख्यातं गुह्याद्गुह्यतरं मया । 
विमृश्यैतदशेषेण यथेच्छसि तथा कुरु
verses.english_translation: Thus the knowledge, the mystery of mysteries, has been declared to you by Me. Reflecting on it fully, do what you will.

verses.original_text:
सर्वगुह्यतमं भूयः शृणु मे परमं वचः । 
इष्टोऽसि मे दृढमिति ततो वक्ष्यामि ते हितम्
verses.english_translation: Hear again My supreme word, the most secret of all; as you are exceedingly loved by Me, I am telling what is good for you.

verses.original_text:
मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु । 
मामेवैष्यसि सत्यं ते प्रतिजाने प्रियोऽसि मे
verses.english_translation: Focus your mind on Me. Be My devotee. Be My worshipper. Prostrate before Me. You shall come to Me alone. I promise you, truly; foryou are dear to Me.

verses.original_text:
सर्वधर्मान्परित्यज्य मामेकं शरणं व्रज । 
अहं त्वा सर्वपापेभ्यो मोक्षयिष्यामि मा शुचः
verses.english_translation: Completely relinquishing all Dharmas, seek Me alone for refuge. I will release you from all sins. Grieve not:

verses.original_text:
इदं ते नातपस्काय नाभक्ताय कदाचन । 
न चाशुश्रूषवे वाच्यं न च मां योऽभ्यसूयति
verses.english_translation: Never should this be told by you to one who is not austere, who is not devotee, nor to one who has no wish to listen, nor certainlyto him who traduces Me.

verses.original_text:
य इमं परमं गुह्यं मद्भक्तेष्वभिधास्यति । 
भक्तिं मयि परां कृत्वा मामेवैष्यत्यसंशयः
verses.english_translation: He who proclaims among My devotees this supreme mystery, shall come to Me, acquiring supreme devotion towards Me. There is no doubtabout this.

verses.original_text:
न च तस्मान्मनुष्येषु कश्चिन्मे प्रियकृत्तमः । 
भविता न च मे तस्मादन्यः प्रियतरो भुवि
verses.english_translation: Not among men is there any one who does dearer service to Me than he. Nor shall there be another on earth dearer to Me than he.

verses.original_text:
अध्येष्यते च य इमं धर्म्यं संवादमावयोः । 
ज्ञानयज्ञेन तेनाहमिष्टः स्यामिति मे मतिः
verses.english_translation: And he who will study this dialogue of ours which is consistent with Dharma, by him I shall be worshipped through the sacrifice of knowledgesuch is My view.

verses.original_text:
श्रद्धावाननसूयश्च शृणुयादपि यो नरः । 
सोऽपि मुक्तः शुभाँल्लोकान्प्राप्नुयात्पुण्यकर्मणाम्
verses.english_translation: And the man who listens to it with faith and without cavilling, he too shall be released, and shall reach the auspicious realms ofthose who have performed virtuous deeds.

verses.original_text:
कच्चिदेतच्छ्रुतं पार्थ त्वयैकाग्रेण चेतसा । 
कच्चिदज्ञानसम्मोहः प्रनष्टस्ते धनञ्जय
verses.english_translation: Have you heard, O Arjuna, with one-pointed mind? Has your delusion caused by ignorance, been dispelled?

verses.original_text:
अर्जुन उवाच 
नष्टो मोहः स्मृतिर्लब्धा त्वत्प्रसादान्मयाच्युत । 
स्थितोऽस्मि गतसन्देहः करिष्ये वचनं तव
verses.english_translation: Arjuna said: Destroyed is my delusion and I have, by Your grace, O Krishna, gainedknowledge (Smrti). Freed from doubts, I stand steadfast, I will fulfil Your word.

verses.original_text:
सञ्जय उवाच 
इत्यहं वासुदेवस्य पार्थस्य च महात्मनः । 
संवादमिममश्रौषमद्भुतं रोमहर्षणम्
verses.english_translation: Sanjaya said: Thus have I heard this wondrous dialogue between Vasudeva and thegreat-minded Arjuna, which makes my hair stand on end.

verses.original_text:
व्यासप्रसादाच्छ्रुतवानेतद्गुह्यमहं परम् । 
योगं योगेश्वरात्कृष्णात्साक्षात्कथयतः स्वयम्
verses.english_translation: By the grace of Vyasa have I heard this supreme mystery of Yoga as declared in person by Krishna, the Lord of Yoga.

verses.original_text:
राजन् संस्मृत्य संस्मृत्य संवादमिममद्भुतम् । 
केशवार्जुनयोः पुण्यं हृष्यामि च मुहुर्मुहुः
verses.english_translation: O King, remembering again and again this wondrous and auspicious dialogue between Sri Krishna and Arjuna, I rejoice again and again.

verses.original_text:
तच्च संस्मृत्य संस्मृत्य रूपमत्यद्भुतं हरेः । 
विस्मयो मे महान्राजन्हृष्यामि च पुनः पुनः
verses.english_translation: And remembering over and over again that most marvelous for of Hari, great is my amazement, O King, and I rejoice again and again.

verses.original_text:
यत्र योगेश्वरः कृष्णो यत्र पार्थो धनुर्धरः । 
तत्र श्रीर्विजयो भूतिर्ध्रुवा नीतिर्मतिर्मम
